text: Great food. High quality ingredients, meticulously prepared. Easy to share. If Seth is there, ask him for suggestions. We gave him a few of our foodisms, ordered what he suggested and enjoyed every morsel. The Bee and the Flower Wine was a good one that I didn't recognize. Tresodura, I believe it was called. One of our favorite meals ever. Highly reccomend this pot.
Overhyped. Food ok but decor is stellar. Definitely wouldn't wait long not for a table though

I tried several of the dishes and they were good, but nothing special. However, the Chorizo wrapped bacon dates were freaking amazing. Sweet and spicy in the same bite. That is why I am rating this place 5 stars. Looks like people either love them or hate them. I loved them! I like the counter concept and the bathrooms were clean with paper towels.

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. I'm literally day dreaming of when I can return. Came here for brunch and had the baked egg, stuffed dates, potatoes and avocado toast. The bread was out of this world. The dates were amazing. Our service was also excellent. I can't wait to come back for dinner! It is more community style seating but I really liked the atmosphere.

I finally got to try Avec this week, I had their pork shoulder which had and overwhelming amount of meat but still good. I also tried their sangria Rosé, which was excellent. The Dates are a must try and the paella was the best paella I've ever had. I would Highly recommend the Paella, the wait for it wasn't that bad but it also wasn't that busy. Defiantly worth the wait!

I never believed all the hype surrounding Avec but I can confidently say that I think it's completely deserved. I "get it" now - Avec is a cool cool place and not to be missed by any self respecting foodie!  A booking here is really essential if you want to avoid an extensive wait. My friend and I were lucky enough to get something relatively early on a week day and get the coveted chefs' counter seats. Most of the seating is in community banquettes which are usually not really to my taste. I loved being right on the pass though and interacting with the chefs. They were funny and pretty cute I might add.  The food was downright delicious. The menu changes all the time but I've been told that some favorites stick around. I loved the chorizo stuff dates (sounds weird but trust me, it works) and the mushroom risotto (which I don't see on the menu now). The dishes are larger than a traditional multi course tasting menu but smaller than a normal sized entree. Definitely talk to your server about plate size as some were larger than expected for us.  I was expecting Avec to be a lot more expensive than it turned out to be. The price point is extremely reasonable for the quality of food, the West Loop location and frankly, the massive publicity surrounding this restaurant.  If you have a foodie friend visiting the city or just want a cool culinary adventure, Avec is an approachable and fun place to start.
Food is amazing.  Everything we ordered was outstanding.  Pricing is very reasonable for the quality of food provided.

The food was absolutely delicious. bacon wrapped dates was definitely my favorite dish. Pallela was ok. That said, I left feeling a bit disappointed by service. I felt semi-ignored most of my time there... Did we not fit into their desired clientele? Did we not look rich enough? Or is it because we didn't order wine? No idea but just didn't feel welcomed there.
The food is always amazing! For many years in Chicago this place is still one of the favorite to have lunch or dinner with friends and family. Love focaccia!

I was super excited to finally try out Avec, but was left rather disappointed. My friend and I came for Sunday brunch. I had heard so many buzzes about the bacon wrapped dates, but they were way too rich, creamy, and huge for my taste. Definitely prefer the ones at Ba-Ba-Reeba a lot more. The baked egg shakshuka was a runny mess, and that came from my friend who studied abroad in Jerusalem and is usually a big fan of shakshuka. We also got the pork shoulder, squash pizza, and panna cotta for dessert, all of which turned out rather boring.  Also, the space was way too crowded. I know it's very popular, but we were literally rubbing shoulders with the diners next to us. Maybe I need to embrace the idea of communal table better, maybe I should try more/other things on the menu; but my experience was a letdown.

Wow! This place is amazing! Order the medjool dates and pork shoulders - so rich in flavor and will make you come back for more. Friendly, casual vibe that provides excellent service. It's unbelievable how their small kitchen can generate such great dishes! Reservations a must, otherwise, you may have to wait for some time. Recommended for groups, too!
For such a small kitchen, this place amazingly produces very hearty and flavorful dishes. The dates as everybody has mentioned is absolutely delicious. The pork shoulder was also one of my favorites.

Came here with my wife and it was just okay. Minimalist communal seating loses its novelty after the 3rd time you have to get up to let another patron in or out of the booth. Music was way too loud, I couldn't hear every 3rd word my wife said during dinner. Service was not that great. Had to wait about 10 minutes for anyone to come and take our drink order. About a 10 minute or more wait in between each small plate they brought out. They brought our large plates out before we got all of our small plates. Couple next to us came in about 20-25 minutes after us and got their food before us. Also left about 20 minutes before we did. Chorizo stuffed dates and the smoked oysters were the stars of the dinner. Everything else was just mediocre. Maybe my expectations were too hyped up based on their yelp reviews?
Fantastic apple-pumpkin bread with butter.  Stuffed dates are great.  Avocado toast and hummus are both good.  Burger was decent.  Steak was decent.  Short rib wasn't great.
Awesome tapas. We ordered salmon and oysters. Very delicious. The paella is mediocre though.
Umm so delish.   Ate so much. The dates are a must.  Small place.  Family style.  Yummo!  Savored each and every bite.

Wow, this place is stellar! Most dishes had everyone at the table impressed. I savored each bite. Marinated Olives 3/5 Bruschetta 5/5 - Each bite was heavenly. Chorizo Dates 5/5 - Unique flavor and not sweet at all. Lots of chorizo.  Brandade 5/5 - Garlic/fish spread. So good! Salmon 5/5 - Most salmon at restaurants is good but boring. They had a lot of flavor on this. Pork Shoulder 4/5 - Very tender. Could use a tiny bit more sauce. Paella - 3/5 - Good but nothing special. It's very filling if you want a large dish.  Seating is communal so I recommend going with 4 people.

The food: 5/5. I went for brunch and only tried a salad, but it was delicious. A very generous serving too. For drinks, I had a brunch gin cocktail which was very good.  The service: 4/5. We sat at the bar and our server gave good recommendations, but the service was slow even when it emptied out in the afternoon.  Overall: 4.5/5. I'll be back to try their dinner menu.
My favourite place. Every time when I go there Im still amazed how good they are. U can't go wrong there. Love every dish they have. Fun atmosphere, good place to meet people.
Very small and unique. The service was excellent as well as the food. Even the small portions are large. I had the chorizo stuffed dates, wrapped in bacon , with a sauce. It was heavenly!
Great food, good portions, friendly prompt service. Small place but good atmosphere. Good wines and drinks as well.

Went here for dinner on a Tuesday night and it was packed and had great energy. I was on a business trip so I opted to sit at the long bar which was perfect. The wait staff was friendly, upbeat, and steered me in the right direction for wine and food options. I had the roasted black bass which was superb. I wouldn't hesitate to return next time I'm in Chicago.

While the stuffed dates are delicious and the ambiance is inviting we found it to be disappointing on the whole. Their fish was was unappetizing, lacking flavor and texture. Wouldn't recommend to a friend but you could do worse.

One of my favorite Chicago restaurants. For me, it's a special occasion place that still has an upscale-casual vibe. Prices are reasonable and portions are appropriate.  Their menu does occasionally rotate, but there's always a wide selection of great dishes. The paella here is my favorite dish and I hope they don't get rid of it. The cod dip is also very good. They used to have a chicken liver mousse that we loved, but it's currently not being served. It's a small restaurant and can get pretty busy, so plan ahead!

Really delicious. I had been meaning to come to Avec for a long time, and I finally made it to Chicago for a long weekend and had the time to give it a try.  I think really the only fault of this restaurant is just how cramped it is. We had a party of 5 and the waitstaff kept bumping into us, and there's a cabinet in the corner that kept getting in the way. Maybe it's time to expand, haha. Despite the cramped conditions, all the food was on point. And I mean all of it. Some of our favorites: - Wood Oven Paella: the prawns were delicious and the rice was perfectly cooked. - Chorizo-stuffed bacon-covered medjool dates: a perfect mix of flavors, and probably the best bite we had the entire meal. - Whole-roasted pork shoulder with littleneck clams: Definitely on the the greasier side, but unbelievably tasty, and if you ask for some extra bread, you can soak up all the rich drippings and stock. Hoo-wee. Overall, the service was very friendly and helpful with recommendations. The prices were about on par with the area, likely a little bit more on the expensive side. However, the dishes were all delicious and well-executed, so at least you know you'll be getting a quality meal. While this might not be the best place for a large group, the food at Avec is outstanding, so it's worth a try for a date or small group. If you're in the West Loop area, definitely give it a shot.

We were looking for a unique restaurant near our hotel, and Avec came up with a lot of stars. We came in without a reservation, and we're immediately welcomed and seated. The atmosphere was fun and creative, and our waitstaff were attentive and caring. The appetizers and  entrées were delicious. The wine selection was unique and diverse, we absolutely loved the entire meal. If you have the chance to go to  Avec, don't miss it. It truly is a gem

Nice , small, cozy restaurant. I like the plates. A bit overpriced. Stuffed chorizo was to heavy and salty. Branzini was ok. Prefer without cream. Bread was good. Manager was professional and sure all the customers doing good. I would come back again if they change the music :-)

Fantastic beet salad and tabouleh. Really fresh and flavorful and well-balanced. The tabouleh was non traditional with course-cut greens and herbs, olives, quinoa and walnuts.  Also ordered the hummus and pita, which was listed on the menu with the sandwiches. It came with either chips or lentil salad and I got the lentil salad. Both were delicious, but probably better as an app than an entree. The girl I was with got the smoked salmon tartine and it looked amazing. The bread was really fresh and there was quite a bit of salmon on it. Very attentive service. A bit loud and you share a table, so not the most private/intimate.
This visit Saturday was what I have come to expect. Everything was on point from the couple we met at our communal table who we made friends with, to the service, and of corse food.

Went here last night by myself and had the worst service I've ever seen in a restaurant. I was really excited to try it, as I am an out of towner and heard great things. They clearly forgot about me, I waited 30+ minutes for the foccacia, then sat with that over-truffled mess for close to 70 minutes with no other food. I asked several times, as the people around me all got their food (some even finished and left while I still picked at my foccacia). Finally one girl came over and snottily told me that my food was being coursed because that's how they do it. Yes, I wanted to sit with this bread for an hour and a half and watch strangers eat how did you know?? Also, this was BS because the guys next to me got their foccacia last. There was no apology, nothing, no offer to bring me something to compensate. They acted like I was a jerk for bothering them with asking if my food was coming.  At the end of my meal they did not ask how the food was, did not apologize, but they did ask if I wanted the foccacia wrapped up to go. NO FOOLS, I DO NOT.  The 2 stars is for the salmon and the cabbage, both were great. The service here is AWFUL, worst ever from anywhere in the world. I left in a bad mood. They did comp my $9 salad but they didn't mention it. I really wish they would have said, we made a mistake sorry. Instead they acted like I was an idiot.

My friends and I came here on a early Sunday afternoon for brunch. We made a reservation, which I would definitely recommend as the restaurant itself is fairly small and fills up fast. I ordered the pizza carbonara and it was delicious. I loved the crust and it was crispy and didn't get too soggy as some crusts do. I also ordered the papas bravas which I would definitely recommend as a side no matter what you order! It might be because I am a huge fan of potatoes no matter how they are cooked, but these were some of the best papas bravas I have had! The garlic aioli on them was delicious! Great brunch spot!
Amazing creativity with the menu. I have been here multiple times when visiting Chicago and usually go back. There is always something new and exciting to try and I've never been disappointed!

I have been to Avec once before in the past for dinner and I remember that I was not the biggest fan. I decided to give Avec another chance and returned once again, but this time it was for brunch. I can safely say that the second time was much more enjoyable for me. For Father's Day brunch, my family shared orders of the Avocado Toast, Carrot Cake, Medjool Dates, and Pizza Carbonara. I laugh because the Avocado Toast (with the addition of an egg) was a whopping $12 (what did they say about millennials and avocado toast again?), but it WAS good. The bread was nice and fluffy and all of the vinaigrette really brightened the flavor. The Carrot Cake was extremely delicious! I recently discovered that I am a huge fan of carrot cake in general and I must say that this was one of the best I've had. The cake was packed with tons of spices and the cool cream on the side provided a nice, refreshing touch. The Dates are probably the most popular item on the menu and after eating them for the second time, I will have to say that they have grown on me. I liked the sweet and savory flavors with every bite provided by the dates and chorizo stuffing. My least favorite dish that we ordered would have to be the Pizza Carbonara. The entire dish was way too salty in my opinion. I appreciate how the dishes at Avec are reasonably priced. Avec has now made its way onto my list of restaurants that give you the most for your money. The small, cozy interior makes walk-ins somewhat difficult, especially if you have a larger party. I would definitely recommend making a reservation ahead of time. I will most likely be back in the future to explore more of the menu.

Came here for dinner on a Wednesday night. They don't take reservations but there wasn't much of a wait. Ordered the lamb ribs special which was delicious. The meat was flavorful, not too gamy, and fell off the bone soft. Loved the tiny orange tomatoes in the salad and humus mixture that came with the ribs. Also tried the focaccia which was different, thinner and more like a crunchy cheese sandwich snack. Last, we shared an order of the paella. The paella was decent, but the rice was a bit more on the soft and sticky side. Flavorful and the sausage, chicken, shrimp in the dish were all great. The toasted rice on the edges were excellent. Nice relaxed atmosphere, good for conversation.

So communal sitting can be slightly off putting when you get stuck with the middle seat... so we sat at the bar. :) First off - service was on point and everything came out on time with beautiful presentation.    We ordered two " Jamaican Vacations " the drink was good taste wise, but could use a bit more alcohol. I was expecting a bit more with the title and  Appleton Jamaican rum.  For dinner we ordered: Hummus, Salmon, Benzino Whole Fish, Rice Krispies desert. The flavor profile on each course was winner in my book. However, my favorite would be the salmon, cooked to perfection!   This was my second visit here and I will deff be back.

I don't know how to write this review. Am I completely out of touch? Is it normal to be made to feel like you need your server more than they need you? I've been to some awesome places in the area from Girl and the Goat to Next. I even worked as a server during undergrad for 5 years. My fiancé and I came here for our 1 year engagement anniversary today and experienced some of the worst treatment from our waiter while seated at the counter during brunch early this afternoon we have ever experienced. I understand being slammed, I understand forgetting an espresso order, I more than understand having plates served and cleared by multiple people. I don't understand not once checking in on us to ask how our dates and avocado toast was. I don't understand passing by us with empty plates and not acknowledging us, several times. I don't understand having to ask the kind hostess literally to my left if I may place an order with HER. She was doing her job and had to get our waiter. I don't understand not asking us how our meal was upon paying. I don't like writing bad reviews, that is why my Yelp page is blank. But come on!! Everyone ELSE was kind, attentive and the food was amazing (definitely get the French toast...!!) But we will never go here again based on this one experience. Which is so sad. My family gave me a gift certificate to use here, my colleagues told me I'd love it here. Regardless, we didn't let it ruin our anniversary. Cheers!

Got the following:  1. Asparagus- as good as asparagus can get 2. Burrata Bruschetta- amazing  3. Salmon- good 4. Steak- standard  5. Dates- interesting 6. Hummus- great  7. Focaccia- big but yummy and light  8. Pork shoulder- amazing  Highlight of the meal was the burrata bruschetta and pork shoulder!

Love love love it here! The food is undeniably good, it's hard to beat. I'm usually not impressed by many vegetable dishes most restaurants serve, but Avec's charred cabbage dish was my favorite of the night. It was beautifully presented and the cabbage was juicy with a hint of sweetness. It was the most creative vegetable dish I've ever tried, and there were just layers and layers of flavor incorporated into each bite. Some bites I got a burst of tartness from the fresh cherries, others I got a crunch from the spiced walnuts. I loved that each bite tasted different from the last. And I also loved that they incorporated quinoa into the dish for a more substantial feel.  Another must get item is their chorizo-stuffed medjool dates. I have a weakness for chorizo anything so this one was a clear winner. It was sweet, salty and a little spicy from the piquillo pepper-tomato sauce. Start any meal with this and you're guaranteed a good time! The restaurant is long and narrow with communal seating, so be prepared to get cozy with your neighbors. And during peak times, it gets super loud.
Meditteranean minimalistic restaurant with wooden communal seating and bar seating but extremely noisy.  Tapas style with full bar. Staff friendly and on top of their game.

Went for Sunday brunch & we were lucky to get seats before the crowds poured in. Server was attentive and very thorough in helping us with some dishes on the menu. The place can get pretty busy and loud but I had a great time. If you don't mind a sweet/roasted mix, the Bacon and dates is amazing. Coffee wasn't bad neither, will definitely make another visit

Went here for a Friday lunch with my teammates from work. One of the girls like this place and she recommended it. The place has minimal interior and communal tables. So unless you have a big party you might end up sharing a table with someone else. Also, you might want to make a reservation before you go or check for the wait time coz it is packed and there is a reason for it. The food is delicious!! The atmosphere is amazing too, especially during summer. The service, I thought was a little slow, we had to wait for about 30 mins to get our food.  We ordered paella, salmon tartine, hummus and affogato for dessert. Paella was great tasting, so was the salmon tartine - the salmon was cooked beautifully. The hummus was okay, nothing special about it. The affogato was great too, its nothing new but it felt and tasted amazing at the time. Though a bit pricy which you should expect from all restaurants in this area, it was a nice experience and I will go back if I get a chance.

I have nothing but positive things to say about the food, atmosphere, and service here. That should come as hardly a surprise for a restaurant with a 4.5 star rating on Yelp. The restaurant itself has communal seating (so you might share a table with another party). While that may have bothered me if it were a different restaurant, it was a nonissue. Food was phenomenal. I liked the fact that my family and I shared plates. We picked two small and two large, in particular, the whipped brandade (amazing) and the asparagus for the small, and the paella and fish for the large. The whipped brandade is like a soupy cod dip that they serve with garlic bread, and the asparagus was a fresh salad with some sprouts and some cheese. They were a good pair to start with. Then we had the paella, and man was that delicious. As was the fish, very fresh, I quite liked the lavender vinaigrette that accompanied it. All in all, fantastic fare, and 100% I would return the next I am in Chicago.

Visiting from Providence and Avec was recommended by a few locals. Sat at the bar on a busy Friday night. The interior is minimal but impeccably done. Acoustics and lighting were perfect and the long stainless steel bar was striking as well as comfortable.  I drank a wonderful Italian Rosso and started with the dates. They are, by far, the best stuffed dates I've ever tasted. I followed that with the garganblu and red hawk (my favorite) cheeses with the accompaniments. I love honey with my cheese and the honeycomb added an interesting texture and crunch.  Todd and I want to say Ryan (I wish I could remember) took very good care of me. High energy, engaging, helpful and very sweet! If you are in Chicago, definitely check out Avec.

Went for dinner. The food is amazing, and not too expensive. The beet salad with smoked yogurt is the shit. Order anything, honestly, not just the popular dishes, except the oysters, they were eh. Coming back for sure.

Ambience: There is seating at the bar and the table have communal seating, its small space so generally packed and loud during peak service hours.  Food: Serrano Ham - 5/5 Avec is owned by the same group as The Publican so they have quality meats on their menu. Bacon wrapped Dates - 3.5/5 Came highly recommend by the waitress, wasn't all too impressed by the flavors. Cheese Plate - 5/5 Red Hawk and Omorro Amanteigado Came with a side of crackers, cherries and salted almonds. Didn't care much for the crackers. Butchered Steak - 4/5 The blistered fava beans in the dish weren't really needed. Pork Shoulder - 3/5 The flavor felt very monotone and boring. Panna Cotta - 5/5 Service: Did a walk in around 7PM on a Saturday evening, were told that the wait would be around 40 mins. We were offered a table within 15 mins which was great. There is a patio setup outside where you can wait and order some appetizers and drinks. The food service overall was quick and our waitress was quite attentive. Verdict: Avec was 3.5 star rated restaurant in my experience. May go back to try some of the other dishes that looked interesting(Calzone, Bucatini, Paella) but the list of other restaurants to try on my list may take precedence.

Everything I ordered from the braised pork shoulder to a few Tom Collins was exceptional. Even the simplest dish - cacio e pepe - was unexpectedly delicious. Staff was friendly and happy to give suggestions and explain the menu. The staff is also great at getting you seated quickly even when you show up at a busy time. I have no criticisms but just one clarification for potential visitors - the space is tight and the atmosphere is very convivial. I found that none of this distracted from the food though and if you go with a group it may even enhance the experience.
Our favorite meal in Chicago.  We shared dishes among 4 people - this was the way to go.  Each dish was fantastic - interesting combinations, artistic, and delicious.

We had a pretty nice dinner at Avec last night. It's not a very large space, and is dimly lit and simple inside. Because it was a Friday evening and we had no reservation, we waited outside in their little standing patio area and enjoyed a few tapas off the "bar snacks" menu and drinks. The anchovies were pretty good but the lavender almonds were divine. Definitely tried to stop myself from eating them all and failed lol.  When we were finally seated (we were told it was a 45 min wait but we only waited 25-30 min so that was nice) we ordered the chorizo stuffed mejdool dates (an Anthony Bourdain recommendation!), the slow roasted pork shoulder with clams and one of the cheeses. You could really taste the thought and care that went into each dish. My one complaint was that while the cheese and dates came out pretty quickly, it took foreeeever for us to get the pork shoulder. Still, it was delicious and worth the wait.
A small and fancy place. Food is truly tasty. Love the Chorizo-stuffed Medjool Dates~ Better have reservation.

Given the hype and popularity of this restaurant, the food is good enough but not mind-blowing. If only Yelp could do 3.5 stars!  We arrived at 5:30pm on a Saturday for the three of us, and even though we were told the wait would be 45 mins, we only waited for around 25 minutes or so. All the seats inside are communal, so space is a little tight and you will be sharing a table with other guests.  We ordered: - Beet salad: roasted beets with yogurt and fried lentils. A refreshing starter, this was recommended by our waitress, but I could probably do without this dish.  - Chorizo-stuffed medjool dates: probably the highlight of the meal. It's like a really tender meatball that melts in your mouth, along with the sweetness from the dates.  - Paella (half-portioned) - the rice is very flavorsome and moist, but I didn't quite like the snail boudin (sausage). Pretty average dish.  - Pork shoulders: the meat is very tender, but halfway through there isn't enough sauce to moisten it up and it gets a little dry. I do love the broth that is cooked with fregola pasta, clams and peas. A pretty substantial portion for meat-lovers out there.   - Chocolate rhubarb semifreddo: a rich, thick mousse covered in a chocolate shell. Not a bad dessert.  Overall a good experience, not sure if I would come back. But I know their focaccia bread (stuffed with cheese and truffle oil) is very popular, and if it weren't for the amount of food that we've already ordered, I would totally get that too!

This meal was pretty much just stellar all the way through.  Every dish was spot on.  Amazing flavors throughout.  Tight space, but so worth it.  11 of us, so pretty much tried most of the menu.  So many good things about all these dishes.  I won't go into detail, just go and try them for yourself. Highlights -  Burrata Bruschetta Lemon Bucatini Pasta Chorizo stuffed Dates Roasted Salmon Charred Cabbage  Deluxe Foccacia Paella with Confit Chicken and Prawns Slowed Roasted Pork and Clams Thank you Avec.  Looking forward to next time.

Lots of great word of mouth and reviews, was super excited to eat here. Had their chorizo-stuffed dates - literally perfect. Then went for the burrata bruscetta (sp?) That would have been good had the burrata not been over salted. Final plate was the charred cabbage which was so so so tasty...except again the dressing was just too salty - basically lifted the cabbage out of its dish and ate it plain. There was a lot going on with the charred cabbage dish too, roasted cherries, quinoa, some kind of reduction, and more that I'm totally not remembering at this point, and it wasn't the bestest combination tbh. On the other hand, amazing bar staff. They didn't have the white wine I wanted and dude quickly offered me two samples to choose a replacement. When they saw that I left most of the food, they comped one of my dishes.  Overall, I'd come back and try again. Hopefully the over saltiness is an anomaly!

Disclaimer: I haven't been here in years (it's out of my usual travel routine and price range). But when I was last year, it was one of those rare restaurants that actually meets the hype. The entire meal was perfectly proportioned both in time and quantities---we got here at 4:30 and left at 7 (just in time to make the opera curtain), and they did a great job of staggering food items so that we were always thinking about the dishes without being overstimulated. And each dish was worth taking time on---all of the flavors were fully worthwhile.

We had a delicious meal at Avec while visiting Chicago this week.  We enjoyed the communal tables and tried several dishes on the menu.  The beet salad with the toasted lentils was so flavorful - we devoured it.  The cabbage dish was amazing and the whole yellow tail fish over artichoke hearts was very good too.  The staff is so helpful and the service was great.  I can't wait to go back.
LOVE this place. It's a staple in my collection of favorite Chicago restaurants. Beautiful interior, knowledgeable staff, and creative menu items. Delicious!

Order the beet salad. Don't wrestle with this- just do it. I nearly returned the next night specifically for that. The salmon was also delicious but they could knock down the creme quite a bit. A little too heavy on that. Server was friendly. After dinner coffee was very nice.
Great food and atmospheres. The focaccia bread is amazing. Highly recommend the fish as well.

Ate at the bar solo while on a business trip. Had to wait 20 mins (which was accurate) but the host was very accommodating. Got me a drink and found the outside area comfortable, even had a heat lamp. Got two small dishes. The beat plate was insane. So many flavors. there's a smokiness to it in the base cream. Also got the steak. Again, lots of things going on, different textures and flavors. Definitely a great place if you don't mind close quarters and a bit of a wait.
The food and service was great!!! The chorizo-stuffed dates were Amazing. Definitely a must!  Service was excellent, the guy didn't even let my glass of water be less than half full.

I've been wanting to try Avec for a long time and I'm so glad I finally stopped by with a friend for brunch! We ordered three items: the dates, papas bravas, and French toast. The dates were the clear winner of the meal. They were delicious and the accompanying bread was very fresh. The papas bravas were done well too, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. They were very reasonably priced. The French toast was the most underwhelming and I likely wouldn't order them again. The presentation was beautiful but I didn't think they were special in any other aspect.  I was really impressed by the quick service - we were done eating within an hour. They take reservations now so make sure to make a reservation ahead of time to avoid a crazy long wait!
Had my doubts on the cramped/claustrophobic ambiance but that lasted only until the food was served...just simply amazing!!! DO IT...GO check out this place...

Avec is super cute and has great food. It's a small restaurant, not too fancy. There are a few smaller tables, but primarily community tables and bar seating. They squeeze quite a few seats at the community tables, so it can get a little tight, but we made some friends and it was fun. My date and I had the spicy chorizo stuffed dates wrapped in bacon to start. They were amazing, the perfect balance of spicy and sweet. I've had the exact same dish once before at Bacchanal in New Orleans. I love them all, and am glad I know where to find them in both cities! For the main course we shared the wild hake with saffron cous cous, almonds and mint. It was pretty good. I like the almonds, but thought the entire dish was salty, which may have been necessary to give the fish some flavor. To finish we had the affogato dessert. It was exceptional! It was the perfect consistency, a little thicker than a mousse, but still very light.  The perfect ending to a nice meal. The servers were very nice and patient. We never felt rushed. When my friend called to make a reservation, they said they would do something to celebrate my birthday, but I guess they forgot. Not a big deal to me, but my friend was annoyed. I definitely want to come back and try a few more dishes. I dream about those chorizo stuffed dates!

LOVE this place! We've heard so much about this place since moving to Chicago, so we had to give it a try. And it totally lives up to its hype! It's a very dark,  modern and small venue with a few giant tables meant to be shared with strangers. If you like your personal space, this may not be the best restaurants for you.  We started off with the whipped brandade with some awesome garlic bread. The brandade is basically a dip made from chunks of cod and olive oil. It was really delicious and pairs VERY well with the crispy garlic bread! We also got the slow roast pork shoulder. This was probably the BEST pork shoulder I've ever had! It is suuuper tender and every thread of the pork was soaked in so much flavor. We finished off with the pesto lamb calzone. This  thing was HUGE and totally worth the price! I seriously would order every one of these items over and over and over again!  Despite the three $$$ signs, everything was very reasonable and portions were larger than expected! Will definitely be coming back here!

Such a good lunch yesterday at Avec. There's a reason the chorizo-stuffed bacon-wrapped dates are such a hit, they're unreal! I also had the paella and was blown away - it rivaled anything I had in Spain. My server Richie was so helpful and even had them split things into half sizes for me as a solo diner. He was also super helpful with suggestions when he learned I was visiting! Loved this spot and the service - would eat here constantly if I lived in Chicago!
The pork shoulder omg so good. Along with the steak and the paella .  Very friendly staff . Would defiantly visit again.

We had a reservation at 11:45am on a Friday but we didn't need it as there was available seating at the bar and a few spots at tables.  As previous reviews indicate seating is tight but the food was unique and delicious.  We shared the beet salad (pretty good), bacon wrapped chorizo dates (wow!) and pork sandwich (another wow!).
Bacon wrapped dates, calzone, pork shoulder - all delicious.  Limited seating so expect a wait because they don't take reservations.  Community seating which I am not a big fan of.

The menu for lunch is small but diverse.  They force you into a category but each is relatively unique and really flavorful.  I had the pulled pork sandwich which was amazing but too heavy - buttered bread and sauce was too much.  The lentils were ok. Setting was great if you like something informal and shared (we shared a bench with 2 other parties).

I came here for a late lunch and their dinner menu was out. It was around 4 so there wasn't that many people there but once we sat down a few minutes later it got super crowded. You have an option to sit at the bar or the communal tables and i chose the communal tables because it was the furthest away from the door and they had their windows open. It's a small space so it gets pretty cramped. You're also very close to the people sitting next to you so you're going to be cramped but you might also make new friends. A lot of the people I saw coming in were tourist so it's also a cool place if you want to be nosy and listen to other peoples conversations.  I ordered the beet salad, butchers steak, and paella to share. They had a lot of other dishes I wanted to order but I was just too full. We were given the beet salad first with apples, yogurt, dill, and lentils. It was really refreshing and a good appetizer to start off with. I noticed a lot of the dishes were really herb forwards and had a strong dill taste. The next item we received was the butcher steak with fave beans, celery walnut tapenade, and fresh horseradish. They were all small portions but they were very good. The paella dish however was very large. I don't know how I could have finished it if I wasn't sharing. The paella came with confit chicken, snail boudin, shrimp, and tangerine aioli. I loved the paella it was very delicious and had a great sear to it. Their wine list has no American wine but they have a lot of interesting choices. I really loved going to Avec. The servers are very attentive of clearing the space since you don't have that much being a communal table. Although, the servers didn't keep pouring our wine it was alright since I assume the place was crowded they had a lot to deal with. Out water was never empty though so that's a good sign. The awkward part about being in a communal table is having everyone get up because you have to go to the restroom. It's better if you're in a bigger group asking friends to get up for you but asking as stranger makes it awkward especially since they have to get up again for you to get back to your seat. If you're going with a date I suggest you request the end of the table or sit at the bar.
deliciousness !!!!! bring a few friends and order a few of everything ;) you cant go wrong, even the unusual dishes are great

Another delicious restaurant in the West Loop, shocking! I've been wanting to take my boyfriend to this spot but they don't take dinner reservations. I called last Friday night around 8ish and the hostess said a couple was getting up soon. So we got to the restaurant ASAP and was seated right after.  We were seated at a communal table, which I don't mind - I can talk to anyone. Except for the couple next to us were fighting about how the boyfriend didn't want to share plates...guess he didn't get the memo that it was a tapas restaurant.  The food was amazing and the server was very helpful. Enjoy! Favorite Dishes: -Chorizo stuffed medjool dates: My two favorite ingredients, chorizo and dates... WOW -Burrata chesse bruschetta  -Paella
Avec is probably one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The food is fantastic. I especially love the medjool dates. I hope to be back soon.

Came here for a late reservation to celebrate my wife's cousin's "match day" for her residency (whatever that is).  This place is great.  Great shared plates kind of place, get to try a bunch of things and share them all.  Like a Girl and the Goat, but smaller and more rustic.    Word of warning though, is that they don't have a great beer selection. They had a bunch of weird Belgium beers and such.  Don't come here for that though, come for the foods.  It does get tight in the restaurant, so be forewarned if you are a big guy like me... wink wink,

Awesome small, cute, chic ambience. I came here for brunch, and it's high quality for sure. I guess I'm my own victim of my high expectations here. Everything was delicious and so well-prepared. The medjool dates were delicious, but maybe I just don't prefer a tomato sauce for my wrapped dates. The pork shoulder was heavy filling and delicioso, but didn't knock me out of the park for some inexplicable reason. I'm going to be a contrarian and say: I don't know...something was missing in general. This is close to the top of my list of places I want to try again. I hear it's stellar. I know it's stellar, I can feel it in my bones. It's not you, it's me....I'll be back.
Great dining at communal tables. We went with a number of small plates, one large, and one desert for theee of us on a girls night.

Went here for restaurant week. Wasn't too impressed with it. Nice place to try, but I don't think I'd go there again. Inside is very small. There is bar seating and then just long tables that stretch all the way to the back of the place. You feel very crowed when others are seated next to you at the large table. Not a fan of having to sit inches away from strangers. Had the chorizo burger. First time I've ever not finished a plate in one sitting at a place of this caliber. It just wasn't that appetizing. The dessert was good, though (some kind of coffee pudding cup). Overall, just ok.

We've soured on avec a bit. First, I'd like to criticize the choice of naming their "focaccia". It's not. Focaccia is far thicker. This is more like flatbread with ricotta inside. Again, it's fine.  Unfortunately we've found the quality of dishes has slipped into lesser.

I went here for brunch this morning and had a good time. It's a small and cute space, and the service was great. We got the banana bread with spice butter to share, and it was so delicious. I got the Greek yogurt and granola, which was very good, and also tried the French toast and hummus, which were both delicious. Food and coffee were all fresh and wonderful, but I'm giving four stars because I wish the menu were either bigger or a little less weird. I would have appreciated a few more classic options, like a simple egg dish, but all of the options are a few steps more complex than the classic comfort food I often want out of a brunch.  So it was a good experience, but it won't be my first choice for brunch in the future.

We've wanted to visit for quite some time and finally had the opportunity to do so before a concert. We made reservations, however we chose to sit at the bar. It seemed as if we sat at a table, we'd have to squeeze in between others and I just wasn't content with that. Not sure I made the right choice though, the bar was pretty cramped as well.  We had a variety of things but my favorites were the oysters, the bacon wrapped dates and of course the espresso cookie.  The food came flying out at such a pace, we barely had room for the plates at our cramped little spot & the wait service was slightly slow.. it's pretty evident when the bar backs poured my wine & removed empty plates.  The food was better than average though, so that's a plus. If asked, I'd go back again but won't really go out of my way to make another reservation.
excellent brunch spot. great food. great experience. be prepared for tight quarters.

Salt cod with olive oil paired with bread and the bacon wrapped chorizo dates were all we got. Plus a drink and we were stuffed. Shared a panna cotta for dessert. I was surprised that between the two of us we only needed two dishes to be full. The dishes were pretty rich and delicious. I'd highly recommend this place. They won a James Beard award.

I really wanted to love Avec but sadly did not enjoy the plates I had tried. I came in on a Friday evening around 6 pm (winter season) and was seated immediately, much to my pleasant surprise!  The wine, cheeses, and bruschetta were great, but my main entree, side salad, and dessert just didn't do it. I had the fleur de marquis for my starter, which is a sheep's cheese from France. I had the sea urchin bruschetta with cured ham and pickled mustard seeds as a small plate, and the cheese was very moist and fresh, pairing well with the other ingredients. We ordered the classic pork shoulder with tuscan kale ribollita, apple, and ricotta salad vinaigrette. I'm not a huge pork fan and really shouldn't have ordered the pork shoulder, however, it was a classic so we felt as if it was a must-try. It was bland. We had initially put in an order for the focaccia large plate, but later changed that to a brussel sprout salad. Our waitress ran into the kitchen to immediately change our order and handled the request graciously, whereas we felt like such a request would warrant an eyeroll by any other waitress. The brussel sprout salad was made with shaved brussel sprouts, and that too, was bland. When a waiter came by and asked if I wanted dessert, I had requested to know what the gelato offering was. He said "banana coffee"... I thought.. "hm, I don't like banana but I love coffee, so why not". Unfortunately I had misheard what he had said and the gelato turned out to be banana "poppy", two flavors I am not fans of. Overall, I think I had just ordered the wrong items, as it seems like everyone else here loves the food.

Yes, avec earns 5 stars. My experience might have been impacted by the delicious bottle(s) of wine we ordered, and the delightful company, but also, it. was. de-licious.  The place: Even though we felt a little bit like we were on Noah's Ark, and I might have gotten bumped by the door a few times while waiting for the rest of my party to arrive, there was something incredibly cozy, familiar, almost familial about this place. I don't normally love the communal seating, and it was a little inconvenient when we had to use the restroom, but we made it work, and it was totally manageable. The taste: Everything that I ate, I'd eat again today, tomorrow, you name it. I didn't have the bruschetta with cured ham or the bacon wrapped dates, which I've heard amazing things about, but my crew seemed to enjoy them. I did eat the brussels sprouts (YUM), the focaccia with tallegio (YUM YUM), the lemon bucatini (solid. tasty), the charred cabbage (mmmmm). We shared the citrus pavlova for dessert. And 2 bottles of the Indalia pinot noir - that was a fantastic bottle of wine, IMO. My face: A little flushed from the wine, though I stopped after not too much since I had to drive us home. A little radiant because someone who wasn't me picked up the whole tab for the 4 of us. Dinner for 4 with one bottle of wine, pre-tip was $170; the bottle of wine I bought at the bar before was another $50 I think.  This is a place to go if you want to catch up, laugh, impress someone, and/or eat very well. Make reservations if you can. It's small, but still is a venue that can make for some big memories.

It took me a while to get around to making it over to Avec, but I was very pleased with my experience here.  The servers weere extremely helpful and while I could go on and on about the chorizo stuffed dates, it's such an iconic dish that you've could probably find a million reviews about it.   The Brussel Sprout Panzenella that we shared as a appetizer, was a little bit lighter on the bread than I expected, but was still and amazing light and refreshing sandwich that was perfect for lunch.  Their cocktails are reasonably priced and on the strong side.  It is worth a visit.

First of all, the menu on their website is outdated. Please fix that. We were super disappointed to find out the butternut squash pizza wasn't an option.  We were seated at the end of a table where another guy was sitting in the middle. He had to get up any time any one from our table got up. Poor guy.. horrible seating.  Their cocktail section is limited in terms of type of liquor. However, they were nice enough to make me a vodka cocktail. I didn't care for it, but glad it exists as an option. Boyfriend didn't love his either. For food, we started with the brussels sprout panzanella, which was delicious. Shaved Brussel  sprouts tossed with bread and onions and cheese. Yum! Def the highlight of our meal. Next we got the deluxe foccacia and holy crap it was SO salty. Half of it was covered in salt and inedible. The second half was alright. It needed more flavors like honey or arugula to balance it and lighten it. (aka like Bar Siena.. best thing ever). I'd skip or have at least 4 ppl sharing it.  We also tried the calzone, which again holy crap on the salt!!! The middle section was inedible because of all the salt. The edges were great and had delicious flavor. Lastly, we got the chocolate cremeaux and it was alright. Whipped mousse with whipped cream. Nothing mind-blowing. Wish they had another warm chocolate dessert option. Overall, we were very underwhelmed by the food based on all the hype. Most of it was SO salty that it was inedible. On top of it all, it has a serious price tag that is completely not worth it. The seating only continues to make it worse. Skip.

The close-quarters seating made me slightly nervous at first but it was perfectly fine after the first few minutes. The food is good and the attitude is non-pretentious. Definitely make a reservation ahead of time and definitely order the Medjool dates.
AMAZING for dinner or brumch! The chorizo stuffed medjool dates are an absolute must!

One of my favorites. I've been several times for special dinners and never been disappointed. The menu changes frequently but sharing a few plates is definitely the way to go. The chorizo stuffed dates are a fantastic staple. Seasonal vegetables are always cooked just right and seasoned in ways that surprise and delight the pallet. Cocktails are excellent, service is consistent, and if you can save room for dessert definitely get the tahini blondie.

Amazing food!! Every bite was a burst of flavor! Presentation was on point, service was great. Initially I was thrown off with community seating, when we had to sit between other customers on the same table, due to tight quarters within the restaurant. Benefits, we were able to see what other customers were ordering!! Highly recommend this!

The place is tiny, the noise level can be quite loud at times.  When we were seated we were seated at a communal table, it was a bit awkward because we seated in the middle of two parties and had to ask one party to let us in.   There were times where our neighboring party was so loud that I was unable to hear the person in front of me.   The food on the other hand was magnificent.  We had to try the bacon wrapped dates... OMG they were beyond what I was expecting.  The bronzino was cooked to perfection.

Came here for the friends of Avec brunch series with Cellar Door Provisions. We got the carrot pastry (Sunday morning pastry), pizza carbonara, and bone marrow quiche (CDP special). The pastry came with an amazing apple-coconut butter that matched the slightly sweet carrot bran cake perfectly. Next came the pizza carbonara, topped with a runny egg. I thought the guanciale was on the salty side, but I was still a huge fan of the dish. We ended brunch with the bone marrow quiche, which was nothing short of excellent. It's amazing how the quiche can be so fluffy. The bone marrow gave it a great, rich taste. I'm looking forward to coming here again for brunch and also trying their dinner menu. In particular, I aim to try the Avec burger and medjool dates.

I booked this place for bday celebration not realizing their seating arrangements.  We were seated at corner right at the entrance.  I felt cold but the hostess helped with the heater which was readily available right next to me!  Hummm Anyway food was delicious, we ordered cheese platter oddly assortments have to be ordered separately, we did and the wildflower honey yum!!! ...   my favorite!   We had a whole fish, oysters, chicken and chef special cheese toast which was almost like a burrata on toast. Overall it was a fun experience!!

Very busy on the weekend, I like communal seating you can see what other people order and chat. We met lots of interesting people. What can I say their dates are simply amazing and keep me coming back.

I was not happy.  The waitress did not explain much about the food.  Unless you are pork lover there really isn't much in my opinion to eat.  I ordered what I thought was fish as the waitress advised that was the only item I could order that didn't have pork in it.  As I started to eat it I realized a piece of bread with a mayo type of spread that included cod flavor and called it a cod sandwich with fish eggs on the side.  Really???  There wasn't even pieces of fish in the spread.  Even their hamburger was made of pork with bacon, huh?   Never go there again.  In my opinion the only thing Mediterranean about is the Hummus.   I give it one star.  The piece of bread was good.

Over priced for the taste. Not many vegetarian options, I got the focacia but it was very bland and needed a sauce to compliment it which they didnt offer. My husband got the pork shoulder which he loved, melted in his mouth and filled with lots of meat! He got the bacon wrapped dates which was really good as well! Maybe a great place for carnivores!

Ridiculously good. I came here about a year ago with work. We ordered a bunch of things (can't remember it all, but the menu is constantly changing anyways) to share and each dish was better than the last. The waiter was also helpful with making recommendations. Highly recommend this place, even just to check out once. Obviously it's not cheap, but it's so worth it in my opinion. Glad I got to come here.

Avec has been on my list of restaurants for a long time, and finally I couldn't resist the siren call of their famous chorizo stuffed bacon wrapped dates. Hello! It's me. I loved them... seriously juicy to bite into, with thick cut perfectly done bacon and the chorizo is almost unnecessary but adds an interesting spice component. They also have this red pepper sauce that is yummy on bread, on the dates, on practically everything I would imagine. I also got the caldo verde off the lunch menu - this I would skip next time. The fish was delicious, but overly salted and the stew was served on top of the bread. I prefer it on the side so it doesn't get so soggy.  Pro tip: you're seated pretty close to your neighbors. So don't come here if you've just gotten into a fight. And expect to rub some elbows!

The food at Avec was good. The portions were for the Large Plates were adequate and the Small Plates were what one would expect. Be warned: This is all about food sharing. The dishes you order all come out at separate times in no apparent logical order. I could live with that. But the atmosphere is terrible. The place is small but lovely. But they stack bodies like cord wood at tables that are one step above picnic eating. I don't know what other diners are talking about in terms of quiet. The acoustics are terrible. I just didn't find the atmosphere matched what Avec is trying to project in terms fine dining. The hostess the night (2/20)we were there was quite snooty and very lacking in information. We had a reservation. The table was open. But we were made to wait outside until our other two people arrived. Mind you, we had a reservation. Your loss that we didn't buy those extra two drinks you could have sold in that 10 minutes. Avec needs to get a grip on what it thinks it is and think a little more about service. Good food is plentiful in Chicago and I will go where I get some service.
Phenomenal food, tapas-style. Pretty expensive but worth it. Trendy.

This was my third time visiting. 2 x Dinner. 1 x Brunch. Thoroughly enjoyed the dinner first time around. However, last week, on a Thursday night, after the auto show, I was disappointed. The salad had croutons that were over baked. Looks like someone forgot it in the oven. The cod, part of the mains, was over cooked and hard.  The sea urchin bruschetta was good. The desert was affagato and the gelato in it was fantastic. Atleast, we finished the meal on a good note. Service was good as usual. Not ready to write them off yet. I am willing to go back. Who doesn't have a bad day. However, can't rate it higher than 3.

I honestly didn't find it to be worth the hype, but maybe the crowded table and company I was with had something to do with it. I don't think that is the case, otherwise I would have given 2 stars. I really just wasn't very impressed. The bacon wrapped dates were of course excellent but you can find those anywhere these days.

This is a place you sure would be lucky to snatch a seat if you could find one. Though the space itself is very narrow, the ambiance is filled with patrons enjoying a good meal.  Had a fish entree and it was hand filleted for me at the table. Good craft cocktails. Will soon be back.

I have been coming to Avec almost 1x every 2 months for 5 years now. So this is a long long overdue review.  I will keep it extremely simple just like the restaurant. Decor: Super simple, it looks like a big wooden sauna. Communal tables or bar seating. Super small, warm, inviting, loud, great music. Service: The servers are all very knowledgable about the menu that is always adapating and changing. They are also very opinionated. They really don't BS you with that ever dreaded line "you know it is all very good"  They tell you their actual opinions and stand behind each item. Drinks: Extensive wine list. Very tiny cocktail menu that is always changing and very unique and solid. They also offer a full service classic cocktails but they just don't have it on the menu.  Food: The menu is so well edited, it is ever changing with a few staple items that never change for good reason (there would be a riot if they took off the chorizo stuffed dates). The menu is extremely simple and it represents their take on the food as a whole. Every dish is very well balanced.  I have honestly maybe had 2 dishes in 5 years that I wasn't a huge fan of. This is the best restaurant in Chicago. To the owner: I just wish they can go back to being a walk in only place. The reservation thing kinda ruins the overall vibe of the place. It is laid back place with communal table and bar seating. I get that it has become extremely busy, but this is a walk in kind of place!

We liked it but apparently not as much as most people. The food was good, the service at the bar was very good, but again, is another annoyingly long wait in a place that only takes reservations until 530p.  The chorizo stuffed bacon wrapped dates were good but I've had better plain bacon wrapped dates because you can better appreciate the sweet and salty dichotomy. These have too many flavors going on - spicy, salty, sweet, and tangy. I wasn't super impressed.  The field greens salad was good but maybe don't waste your experience on a salad you can easily recreate with some quality ingredients.  Oysters were teeny tiny! The lemony flavor was nice but not worth $18.  Lastly, we got half order of paella. The rice was meh, with a weird aftertaste. The shrimp was somewhat fishy. Chicken was fine. The sausage was definitely the best part.  We would go back if it weren't for the long wait, and if friends wanted to, but wouldn't make a special trip there.

I went here for a dinner by myself and to understand what's the fuss about. Their signature date dish is really worth it. The aroma of bacon and chorizo sausage with the tomato gravy is fulfilling, the dates add a good twist but I wish I could avoid the tad bit of sweetness and just could enjoy the pure bliss of sausage bacon bread and gravy, but not complaining. The only reason I am giving 1 less star is because I could have had much more to my pasta that I ordered. Refrain from ordering this bougatini pasta from appetizer and try something else, it would be worth it.

after trying paul kahan's blackbird next door for dinner a couple months ago and just thinking it was a-ok, i am happy to report that my brunch experience at avec was leaps and bounds better. while you can't really compare the two since it isn't apples to apples, my overall impression was that the weekend brunch menu at avec was much more creative, inspired and accessible than blackbird's dinner menu. onto the good stuff - between the two of us we shared 2 small plates and 2 sides. you wouldn't think this sounds like a lot of food, but let me tell you, we could've made do with one less dish and still been totally and completely stuffed. avocado toast - deeeelicious! how did they get the avocado to have such a buttery consistency?! butcher steak - they are serious about their medium rare steak, cooked to absolute perfection. kale, celery root and butternut squash are probably some of my least favorite standalone vegetables, but somehow the genius of chef perry hendrix thought to combine them in a way that blows my mind. pork belly - wow, in one word - decadent. this rich side dish alone would've been enough to fill one person's stomach. papas bravas - thought this would be a nice throwback to our spain trip last year, but this lukewarm dish faltered a bit and was our least favorite of the bunch. my only gripe is about the seating space - while i love the wooden tables and bar seating, they really weren't kidding when they said intimate setting. the tables are made for parties of 6, so often you'll find parties of 2's and 4's squeezed in next to each other. i'm all for cozy and saving space a la nyc style, but it does make getting in and out from the table to be somewhat inconvenient. but as you can obviously see, this didn't affect the 5 stars they received from me one bit.

Avec is superb. The food is very high quality and I've never left disappointed - it's also great for sharing at lunch. The dinner menu can get a bit pricey but there's usually seats available at lunch and the menu is great. I would insist anyone going start with Avec's famous chorizo stuffed bacon wrapped dates. They are the highlight of the menu in my opinion. The tomato sauce has a bit of a kick to it which helps mediate the sweetness of the dates. The bacon is well cooked and not super fatty while there's plenty of chorizo on the inside. These are a must have. I've had a number of the sandwiches (pulled pork, avec burger, some fish sandwhich which is no longer on the menu). All have been great and are excellently done so it's just a matter of what mood you're in.  Only thing I don't like about Avec - the communal tables which are a bit short. I know it's become a fad in more trendy restaurants, but if I'm going out with friends or for a date, I don't want to be surrounded by random people.
It's veeeeery compact and lively, very low profile but the food was really worth it ! It was quite loud there at all times but I don't think it's a disadvantage , it's a fun place!
Amazing spot, must try the dates.  Busy so make sure you have a reservation and don't forget it's a bit loud!
Love this place. The food is brilliant-I'm vegetarian and cannot rave enough about the cabbage dish. Brilliant night, friendly atmosphere. Definitely will make this a regular haunt!

My wife and I came here for restaurant week and couldn't have had a better experience. Blake was our server and wow did he take care of us. I think Blake made our experience even better because he guided us through our choices and made wonderful recommendations. I'd say my favorite item we had was the bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed dates, but I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu.

Absolutely delicious small plates perfect for sharing with a group. We had a group of 5, ordered about 5 dishes, drinks, and 3 desserts. Our bill was about $210 before tip. Place is always crowded, hip hop music plays in the background

Fabulous. I initially was hesitant as the location seemed casual and the menu was simple.  It was a fantastic meal. The focaccia pizza was delicious and addictive. We also had the hummus; we were weary paying for hummus but it was delicious. Highly recommend this. The pasta wasn't that great, but it tasted good. The other two dishes definitely things I now dream of. Also love the decor and tables. I never felt too cramped or rushed.

I went there during Chicago restaurant week and tried their prix fixe menu . Au Cheval's burger may have better bacon but the burger here is still quite tasty. Most people sit at the bar has to sit on their coat which is a little bit inconvenient. I would come here again, but it's not a priority.
This restaurant was an experience! I really enjoyed all the different flavors. My favorites were the steak and brussel sprouts. I recommend going with a large group so you can try one of everything!

Did not like this restaurant. Food is mediocre. Service was terrible, except for the man who kept refilling the water--he was attentive. Went for restaurant week and could not wait till the dinner was over. Community seating is not pleasant for a conversation that one cannot have anyway as the music is too loud. Would not go back ever. Valet parking is expensive at $14.00. So many other restaurants in Chicago that for the money do a much better job.

My second time at Avec, my friend and I chose to try the restaurant week menu since I enjoyed my first time here months before. I'd say all the main plates on the restaurant menu are Spanish tapa inspired, but a little bit too salty.  The chorizo stuffed dates with bacon were my favorite, the tomato sauce with piquillo balanced well between the sourness and spiciness. Service:  Both the waiter and bartender were very courteous, but the owner-like man seemed to skip talking to us about the food intentionally but not other groups who also ate at the bar maybe because we're both Asians and was talking using another language.  Even though the bartender was friendly, I sneaked him taking away my wine glass with maybe 1/5 unfinished when I was talking to my friend. I didn't ask the reason, though I felt weird. Atmosphere: Avec is small, and everyone has to sit close to each other and share tables, the music is turned deafening so that you can only hear what you want to hear by 'yelling' at each other with your friend or to your waiter/waitress. My throat got tired after 1 and half hours. In conclusion, I might not visit here again in a relatively long time.
Small spot.Hard to get a table on a weekend and they don't take reservations.Try to go for lunch on a weekday where you get some space to enjoy your meals.Fantastic food with average portions.

This spot is great for shared plates!  With two of us, we shared three small plates - beet salad, bruschetta, and chorizo stuff dates - and one large plate - the paella.  All were really fantastic. Wine list was extensive and our waiter brought me one to try.   Not bad, but a couple things to know... it's community seating.  They first tried to sit us at a table where we would have been in the middle seats of a long rectangular table.  The people dining would have had to get up to let one of us sit in the booth.  A little awkward, as they didn't seem to expect that coming.  We ended up at the bar.  Also, they won't see you until your entire party has arrived, which is somewhat common but good to know.

The slow roasted pork and the Brussels sprouts were amazing, while the dates were good, and the truffle focaccia was very oily. Overall the food was good but the space is too uncomfortable, you're eating and talking over each other. We felt very uncomfortable.

I certainly can't speak for what's normal here as I've only been once, but my wife and I had a very rude waitress. She largely ignored us and specifically told us not to put our entire order in at the beginning of the night. Well, once we got through our small plates and ordered the main dish we were there almost two hours before even being served the entree! We had to cancel our desert order and have the main dish wrapped to go. Two hours for one glass of wine, two small plates, and an entree is excessive, but like I said we just didn't see our waitress much throughout the meal. Other tables got two or three small plates and a drink within 10-15 minutes of sitting down, so I'm not sure if we were unlucky or if the waitress didn't like us for some reason. When we asked nicely where our entree was she became defensive and rudely told us we should have put the order in at the beginning of the meal- precisely the opposite of what she told us before. The food is definitely above average but the experience was bad enough that I won't go back and can't recommend.
Amazing bacon wrapped dates (spicy!) and avocado toast (note for vinegar haters like me: the vinaigrette has lemon juice, not vinegar).  Service was a little spotty, but friendly.

I loved brunch here so giving them 5 stars since they have exceeded expectations at brunch and dinner.  We had breakfast paella, medjol dates and baked egg. Everything was just as delicious as it can be. We typically enjoy dinner here but brunch was spectacular as well. I was surprised to see Ryan bartending during the day. He is such a nice guy and very professional.  Music was a bit loud though.

Mediterranean tapas best describes this place.  Small set up with group seating, I preferred to sit at the bar.  Service was nice with very good recommendations. However, the timing of the food was off as we get two items right away, then had about a twenty minute wait for our next items. They were all small plate apps, so the timing was weird.  Everything we ordered was great, but I would say all items were overly seasoned.  The dates are a staple, they were good, but a bit tough to eat.  The beets with fried lentil were the best part.  Hake was a great smokey surprise. Prices are a bit high but I'll be back.

Avec is our go-to place for guaranteed great food and drinks consistently. My husband and I have been here multiple times while we lived in the West Loop and loved every experience. Love that Avec now takes reservations.

I'm not really sure what else there is to say about Avec that hasn't already been said but I just had to write a review anyways because I LOVE AVEC SO MUCH! All of their food is always perfect. It has never once disappointed me. I've been for both brunch and dinner. I would definitely recommend making reservations for brunch because it fills up early. I don't think they allow reservations for dinner. Just order anything off the menu, I am sure that it will be delicious!

The waitstaff is always friendly.  Our first time here a year ago, we must have had some luck ordering because everything was delicious. Chicken liver mousse was the best I've ever had. I could have just had that with red wine and been good for the night. Tried the dates- they're good but not something I'd have to get again the sauce and chorizo are a little overpowering. We also got the pork dish which was also amazing.  Second time there- no chicken liver on the menu- sad but no big deal right? Because everything last time was amazing. We got the brussel sprout salad which was over salted and needed more acidity to it. Roasted cauliflower also really salty. We aren't vegetarian but everything we got that night was and the salt was everywhere- kind of disappointed since we had such high expectations after the first time here.  If the chicken liver mousse comes back I'll be back
"Stuffed dates" is really all you need to know

This place has a wonderful atmosphere. I loved the cozy ambiance from the minute we walked it.  You sit and eat family style as the food gets finished they bring the dish out and you share.   We had the chorizo stuffed dates.  They were amazing!

I have to give credit where credit is due! I wrote a not so wonderful review of this place not long ago... However, we returned due to all of our coworkers insisting and I have to say it was amazing this time! We sat at the bar and had the paella and a steak. Both were exceptional and the service was spectacular. I think the first go around, we were just unlucky. But this is most certainly the restaurant everyone says it is. So my apologies and we will definitely return for the wonderful service and food you folks have. Very much enjoyed. Cheers!

This tiny restaurant serves up great food! My fiancé and I went for lunch on a week day and there was no wait. I expect this place gets busy at night and does not take any reservations. We had the pork shoulder which was delicious. I also had the focaccia bread which was great, and I was able to eat it the next day, it was so big! I look forward to going here again!

Chicago is a foodie's dream city, and it's because of places like Avec. Located downtown, Avec is a trendy restaurant that is serving up some truly delicious food and creative drinks. I've been here a few times and the experiences were equally awesome. The chorizo stuffed dates are absolutely amazing. They come in a tomato like sauce which results in a sweet and spicy taste that is given an extra lift by the tomato sauce. I've also has a few other dishes such as the French toast which is excellent, and the four lettuce salad which was one of the mist unique and delicious salads I've ever tasted.  They also have a lot of creative and delicious cocktails. I've had a few rum cocktails as part of their brunch menu which were awesome. There is specific drink made with dark and light rum, bitters and lime that is delicious.  Seating is set up in a straight line as tables line the wall and the bar is extremely long with lots of seating there as well. Service and atmosphere are both excellent, which tops off an overall awesome experience.

My friend and I went for brunch this morning (December 11, 2016). I had no problem making reservations on Open Table and we were seated right away. It was a great place to beat the snow, warm and intimate. The service was phenomenal! My friend started with tea and I had a Harissa bloody Mary. It was one of the best I've had. It was smoky and a little spicy, but well balanced and I liked the beer back.  We ordered: chorizo stuffed dates (HAVE to have these, they are known for this dish, so rich and salty, very satisfying, you can have a half order! It was perfect because my friend does not eat pork. The waiter talked us into the pastry of the day-it was an apple and carrot bread with walnut butter. I have NEVER had fruit/veggie bread this good. It was so moist and flavorful! I was amazed how good this bread was! My friend had the butcher steak and she said it was great! I had the lamb burger and it was cooked perfectly! The roasted tomatoes were smoky, and I loved the creaminess of the goat cheese. I like the fact that they have a smaller menu to share and larger plates. I was happy that my friend and I could share a few plates.  I was really impressed with the food and service! Lunch, brunch, dinner, I would highly recommend it!

There is no reservation at this place so you can either go there really early or really late or be ready to wait wait wait.  The food here is simply delicious.  There is nothing in the menu that you will not like.  You can close your eyes and just point.  Everyone's favorite are the stuffed dates.  This dish is simply heavenly and in itself is worth waiting for a table here.  The place is elbow room so if you are a bit claustrophobic and are not into communal seating then you may have some issues.  It can also be loud so be ready to scream during your conversations.  Regardless of all the other factors, the food in itself is worth dining here.  There were 5 people in our group and we stuffed our faces with food and spent 50 per person without drinks.

Great place!! The interior is okay. There's limited seatings. About 4 long tables and a bar. People would have to share seatings with other people because there's no tables that fits a small group.  We made reservations for 9:30 but we came a little early and they sat us right away. We ordered the chorizo stuffed medjool dates, butcher steak, and slow roasted pork shoulder. The portions are smaller than usual since each entree is meant to be shared. Everything was so good! I especially liked the steak. It was not too done but not too rare. It was cooked so perfectly! Not only was the food good, but the service was excellent! My water was filled literally every time I finished it, they changed our plates for every entree, and they were extra friendly. The service was definitely above and beyond my expectations!

Decent food and great atmosphere, the chorizo-stuffed bacon wrapped dates are an absolute must try. I liked the slow roasted Pork Shoulder, be prepared to share or bring your appetite. I had a dessert with pomegranate and chocolate mint, it was delicious. My waitress Michelle was good, she made good recommendations and set expectations regarding preparation time for the pork Shoulder. My only negative about this dining experience was their choice in music. I don't care for explicit lyrics during my dinner, especially in a public setting, according to Shazam it was Marmalade Sky by RetcH, why risk possibly offending diners???
Exquisite flavors. Healthy variety with delicious combinations. Try the cookies for sure.

My final meal in Chicago was at avec and boy, am I glad we ended on a high note! My friends and I were able to make a reservation during brunch time on Sunday through Open Table (MAKE RESERVATIONS!) and were promptly seated upon arrival. The ambiance was great and the decor was simple yet warm and homey.  We ordered the following: - chorizo-stuffed medjule dates: amazing! Perfect combination of sweet and savory, this is a must!!  - baked eggs with prosciutto: I was a little confused at first but this was filling and delicious. Bottom layer of baked beans, topped with poached eggs and lots of savory prosciutto! YUMMM - French toast: perhaps my least favorite of the three. The bread itself was really dense, I prefer my French toast fluffier and chewy. The flavors were also really rich but I liked the pear  jam/reduction on top.  We were going to order more (among 3 girls) but our waitress said that it might be too much food. Glad we took her advice because we had food leftover and were stuffed!! Service was great, it's located in a cute area in Chicago, and food was overall amazing! Can't wait to come back and try other seasonal dishes.
Good food.  Buut nothing that would make me go "oh my god."  Lol. For the price, it was rather a small portion.. Tip: Parking is hard to find in the area so anticipate in getting valet parking.

Had heard so many good things and avec definitely lived up to them. Everything from the cozy and modern ambience to the creative presentation of the food made for a great brunch.  We started off with the chorizo stuffed dates wrapped in bacon and were blown away. I would never think of ever ordering something like this but so glad we did. The date just gave a hint of sweet to the heavily flavored chorizo and crispy bacon. Then we had the lamb burger, also amazing, tender and juicy. The avocado toast and pork shoulder fell a little short for me. The pork was just too much even for 3 people, and I didn't enjoy the crunchy nuts and grains. Would love to go back to try the dinner options.
The only thing that keeps me from giving this 5 stars is the noise level and small space resulting in communal dining. The food is AMAZING!
Avec in English means with! Small place, intimate to the point you can go alone and make friends. They truly live their minimalist perspective. Great place especially if you are going alone.

Loved this place! Ordered the lemonade on a whim and it was awesome! My husband and I ordered the roasted pork and butcher steak. Both were delicious. We went right when it opened for lunch and it filled up quick!

Creative menu and modern rectangular interior! You must try the medjool dates. Awesome spices. The greens were also good for appetizer. The Spanish style octopus is also a must-try.
