Pork shoulder was a bit small but nice and spicy. If you like cheese, focaccia would be a good choice and it's quite filling too compared to most other menu here. The only downside would be that food became a little saltier than about 3 years ago in my opinion.

Cute little restaurant on Randolph Row with excellent vegetarian choice! We started with the mezze which was delicious; all the sides that came with it were tasty and we especially liked the labneh and beet mahammara. We also enjoyed the marinated kale and charred corn tabbouleh. Everything was extremely fresh tasting and our entire group had a good time :)

I do so adore that cozy hole-in-a-wall restaurant, Avec Moi! Dining there was the one ray of sunshine in a trying week. Spoiled creme fraiche, a tardy manicurist, the death of my prize-winning hydrangea. How much hardship can one person take? How much?!? It all started on All Hallows' Eve -- wouldn't you know it -- with Maurice's bright idea (why do I listen to that man?) to conduct a seance to determine the true cause of death of our dear Uncle Roald once and for all. Well, I'm not one for Maurice! MAURICE!! There's pulp in my mimosa! PULP! How did this happen? You know I can't -- and I won't -- abide flecks of fruit flesh. Well it's too late for apologies now, my breakfast is ruined. Ruined like Pompeii! Just bring the bottle of Bollinger, sans jus d'orange, for Christ's sakes. Put it here. No here. Here, lodge it between the cushions. You know I can't reach when I'm wearing Oscar. histrionics or drama but summoning the dead is more than this woman-of-a-certain-age's nerves can take. I was beside myself! Literally! Bippy popped-by post-alcohol-fueled-all-day-breakfast at the 3rd Coast Chicago. Mya (my certified CranioSacral therapist) and her ever-present female friend Wolf (Parkinson-White) lingered after simultaneously bilaterally adjusting my sphenoids (the release actually unclogged my first chakra and it was heavenly!) to participate. The motley five of us dragged Chef away from his bubbling béarnaise sauce, and of course my dear, bloated friend Eugenia arrived in a minute, as God knows she had nothing better to do with her day. That was seven. And everyone -- EVERYONE -- knows that it takes eight -- Eight is Enough -- to conduct a proper seance. So what did Maurice do? Do you guess? Do you guess? Do you? He invited Blanche (Blanche!). She had the audacity to arrive escorted by those insufferable, entitled Brant Boys. I had no part of them, sending them off to the Viagra Triangle to wreak their havoc on the new moneyed set and the Eurotrash and the general riffraff who gather there. AND.... And nothing! We tried, but we could not summon dear Uncle Roald from his grave. His demise remains a mystery.... Well, let me tell YOU: nothing stimulates the appetite as much as an attempt to rouse the dead! Maurice suggested that the eight of us -- minus Chef and Mya and Wolf -- mere hired help -- five of us actually, try Avec Moi for dinner. Avec Moi! A charming, narrow wooden space (I couldn't help but be reminded of our sauna at the hunting lodge in upper Haapajarvi) that just oozes with hygge. Friendly servers and bartenders, if they are a bit rough around the edges. And those wines by the glass. Delightful! We each had four! I found the brandade and pork shoulder (they never ever leave the menu) To Die For, but let me tell you this....THAT TRUFFLE FOCACCIA BREAD was tastier than any lover Mother, Bippy or I have sampled, or shared, and that's saying a lot! I would have never tried it -- focaccia is a tad blue-collar for someone as sophisticated as myself -- but the couple next to us swore by it. Simply orgasmic if I do say so myself. I do! Imagine! Me! Talking to strangers! Noshing on scrumptious focaccia! In fact the communal seating -- as dreadful as it sounds -- was a hoot! I conversed with a woman from Ohio. Ohio!?! She was a tad overweight, of course, but perfectly capable of conducting a (brief) conversation. Anyway, I am returning to Avec Moi to sample their bacon-wrapped medjool dates (I haven't indulged in that dish since Serge and I visited the Gettys in Marrakech (before Talitha's glamorous drug-addled descent into paranoia and death)). With Maurice, of course. And if we can entreat my dear, departed Uncle Roald to join us (he was a man of refined taste, afterall), we shall. And we will!

Friendly and courteous staff.   Communal type tables created pros and cons.  Pro, you found yourself talking to table guests overall and about food to order.  Cons, had to get up several times for people leaving and coming.    Because of the tables, I would recommend for small parties as it's easier to get seated in this small venue.   Additionally would reco heat lamps where people have drinks as they wait to be seated. Food was good, some dishes stood out more than others.  Our favorite was the carrots, amazing flavor and spice.  Mezze is a good starter as it has various flavors and dishes in one!  Pita was cooked perfectly and served while hot.  Rigatoni dish was good, interesting flavor.  We ordered the paella for a main, it was the only dish we didn't like.   Dessert we had the pumpkin and the special for the night. A note on service... they decided to tell us 20 mins after we ordered that they were out of the paella, but were able to spare us half the order.  While we appreciated the update, it probably should have come a few mins after we ordered.  Service actually redeemed itself without being probed.  They realized we didn't like the paella and took it off the bill.  Additionally they provided 2 desserts on the house.

My favorite restaurant in the city. The chorizo stuffed dates are mind blowing, and I cannot walk through the door without ordering them. I recommend coming when the weather is nice so that you can enjoy some excellent cocktails outside while you wait!

Food is nothing special. Plus, too loud to hear the person across from you. Avec is simply one of those places that everyone says is great simply because everyone else says it is great. No one is willing to call it what it truly is: mediocre.

Avec is good but I am at loss of why it is a 4.5 star restaurant. Im unsure why people wrote home so well about it. Located in Fulton Market, this is a modern american restaurant. A small, classy, and casual atmosphere with family style seating, meaning you may sit with randoms. The menu is a collection of large and small plates. If you do small plates only, you probably should do 2 to 3. The entrees are relatively small portions so splitting an appetizer with other table guests may be a good idea. We went during a peak time and service was prompt and courteous. The food was a good but the tasting experience wasn't out of this world. A few simple ingredients were combined and unique but the flavor explosion expected by my tongue was lack luster. The food textures werent thought out that well either. I certianly would go again but this wont be on top of my list for my next visit to Chicago.

I saved the best for last on my Chicago weekend of eating!  I love and seek out Mediterranean food whenever possible, and Avec was a standout among the rest. Communal tables are cute, albeit cramped. But the food and service quickly made up for this. Went for brunch. Pro tip: reservations accepted for brunch/lunch only! Waits can be daunting for dinner. Food favorites: + Pastry of the day - carrot Apple bread with spiced walnut butter: UNREAL. This may be the best loaf bread I've ever had. Super moist and flavorful... And that spiced BUTTER!  + hummus with homemade pita and soft poached egg + avocado toast - best I've had in a while  + yogurt with fall fruits - simple but done perfectly  + papas bravas - a must get  I'll be back to try dinner (now that I've deemed it well worth the wait) and for another taste of the pastry of the day!

Avec had long been on my list ever since hearing it was one of Chef Stephanie Izard's favorite spots.  While the atmosphere was great and the staff very welcoming, the dishes were collectively only average to above-average. With lunch menus in hand, my colleague and I went with a bunch of small plates along with a large one to share.  The egg-topped avocado toast was fantastic and the easy star - the hot, toasty bread was the perfect canvas for the mix of creaminess, acidity, fresh greens and EVOO.   For the lamb burger, the patty itself was rich and gamey with the cool yogurt, cucumber and mint cutting the fattiness nicely.  However, the bun was entirely forgettable and honestly looked like it could've come from McDonald's.  Suffice it to say, the entire presentation was surprisingly plain and underwhelming. Thereafter, the butcher steak with a fried egg was pretty good, just that nothing about the flavors stood out.  For the large plate, our slow roasted pork shoulder was very warming and super generously portioned, yet the flavors lacked complexity and bored the palate after a few bites.  On top of that, the shoulder meat wasn't the most tender and the dish really needed the fat from the sausage and feta to balance that out. Finally, the char and sumac glaze on the slabs of pork belly was brimming with sweet and savory notes.  Like the shoulder though, the meat itself was fairly dry and once again needed the glaze and fat for balance. On the upside, the wines by the glass were very well curated as we both thoroughly enjoyed our picks from France and Spain.

We decided to share everything, and ordered the whole fish, bucatini pasta, stuffed dates, and mussels.The bucatini pasta was by far our favorite, I liked the dates, and the fish was fine, but I was super disappointed in the mussels. They came in a cast iron pot with a flatbread cooked over the top of it - which became mushy and gluey from the steam. The sauce was not very flavorful and the mussels were consequently pretty bland. I will say that I enjoyed the sangria and it's worth noting that they served us the best cappuccino I have had in Chicago, no lie. I might come back for a happy hour but probably not a full sit down meal.

The food was great, especially the salmon and brussels sprouts and pork shoulder! And negative was waiting for a half hour standing in a small cramped area by the door when we had reservations! If you're in a hurry don't go here. The place is loud, crowded but it's great food!

mediterranean influenced new american solid brunch.  Chorizo stuffed medjool dates in piquillo pepper tomato sauce are definitely tasty but not very unique.  however, the overstuffed chorizo part is nice with more spice from the pepper sauce than the sweet of the date.  also enjoyed the lamb burger with berebere spiced tomato jam and tahini, cucumber, and mint.  the baked egg shakshuka with a tomatillo kale salsa and crispy pita which had a nice textural contrast.  the hummus with pickled red onions, parsley, and israeli chili sauce was also done expertly.

I went recently as suggested by one of my companions, who is a repeat patron. We went on a Monday right when it opened and were seated right away. It got pretty busy within the hour. I heard the focaccia was a must, and it is. OMG. I really loved the kale salad as well. The mussels were so-so, but my companions loved them. I did like, however, how the pita was draped over the mussel cookware it was served in - you can tell it was baked fresh on top. Service was average. I like the minimalist interior, as it really shows how menu and cuisine focused they are. I didn't mind the communal seating, but we also were not hardcore packed in like sardines.

Avec had an inspiring menu with amazing food!  You know when you feel like you're a decent cook and you go out to eat and leave feeling like you could've made that?  Not this place!  I wish I had even a quarter of the skills that this chef had.  Yum!

This place is absolutely phenomenal, and the service is top notch! The hummus, dates, and pork shoulder are an absolute must. If you are lucky enough to have Sandra as your server, ask her for suggestions on wine pairings. She knows the list and menu inside and out, and anything she suggests will blow your mind. The next time I'm in Chicago, I will make it a requirement to return!

Brunch review: Unfortunately, this restaurant does not accept reservations for their weekend brunch, but if you come soon after they open the wait wont be too long.  The tables are communal style, so you will be sitting super close to your neighbors.  I didn't mind this aspect too much, but I wouldn't like this if I wanted to have a private conversation with someone.   Our waitress was nice for the most part, but I don't think she gave the most accurate descriptions about portion sizes.  The baked egg dish was appealing to me as a main entree, but she kept going on and on about how it would be too small for me.  She carried on the same way when a couple other members of my group ordered appetizers as their main meal.  I ended up ordering the baked egg, and it was more then enough for brunch.  Yes, it wasn't a huge portion, but the waitress made it seem like the dish came with half an egg or something.  The baked egg dish was delicious, and everyone else at my table seemed happy with their meals. I'm not dying to come back, but maybe sometime in the future I would try their dinner dishes.

Went to Avec for lunch today - it was absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the chorizo stuffed dates and the lamb burger. The portions were decent sized too. The one area for improvement would be how close together everyone was sitting - we felt like we were on top of each other. Thank goodness we didn't have to use the restroom mid-meal.

Avec was recommended to us as a must-try. We had no idea Avec's sister restaurants with The Publican and Blackbird, but it makes sense because we also LOVED those.  We had a reservation for lunch, which I highly recommend, since the place got packed pretty quickly. The restaurant consists of all countertop seating and communal tables, so don't be shy! We really enjoyed all the items we shared: - werp farm greens: light, refreshing salad. Loved the touch of the lavander almonds! - salmon tartine: the beet muhamarra was delicious  -  and a half order of the chorizo-stuffed medjool dates for the meat eater, didn't try these but they seem to be an overall favorite and yes, you can do a half order of these The service here is superb. We ordered a small salad, but they accidentally gave us a large and then comped it. WHAT?! Super nice of them and we weren't expecting that at all. Definitely one of the best meals we had in Chicago!

We had lunch here and was impressed with the quality of the food, service, and ambience. Also enjoyed the music here that they played as well. It is a very modern restaurant. Our server was excellent!! -Sausage with bacon wrap (flavoring was great) -Salmon sandwich (the salmon was fresh)

Fantastic service and food. Everything I ordered was great including a few Tom Collins. The concept may not be for everyone, it's loud and no reservations (you may have to wait 30 minutes as I did) are taken but if that sounds OK Avec is an ideal place to have exquisite food in a less formal setting.

There is a simple reason that Avec has been here for more than 12 years.. it is Outstanding!  Deserves all the accolades it gets - interesting menu, incredibly friendly service, great atmosphere & vibe.  Negatives.. ?? Zero, zip, none.

Overrated. Came here for brunch. Overpriced food, bad service.  Pros:  1. Pretty atmosphere, good location Cons: 1. Instead of apologizing, our waitress gave attitude to my boyfriend when he asked about our bloody marys, which she had clearly forgotten about.  2. The bloody marys, when they finally arrived, were small and way overpriced.  3. We ordered the shakshuka, which was bland and came with regular bread (where's the pita?) 4. We had the famed carbonara pizza, which was, again, overpriced, and just 'okay.' Most of the runny yolk ended up on the serving dish. The crust was the best part. We were really excited about trying this place, and sadly, won't be coming back. There are many more delicious places to eat in Chicago.

Amazing experience. I came here by myself, so I could not enjoy the small plates experience as much but the staff were so welcoming and the food was so good. I could not finish everything I ordered so I took the pork shoulder through airport security and had it for lunch at work. It was well worth getting pulled aside for "extra screening". I couldn't imagine a better way to round out my trip to Chicago.

I'll admit, I've only been to dinner there once, but go often for lunch. It is always outstanding. The set up is small shared plates but I'm an eater and I always feel satisfied. It's loosely communal seating but I've never had that be of any issue. It can get very loud in there... lots of wood. So depending on the day or time, it's not exactly intimate. It's more celebratory and conversational. The staff and service have always been great. And the food is outstanding.

Been here for both lunch and dinner, and luckily didn't have to wait for either one (and the dinner was at 6PM on a Saturday night for 2). For lunch, I highly recommend the salmon tartine as it's a perfect combination of sweet, salty, and sour. Very resonably priced too! The roasted pork one is also great. Only complaint is they tend to be a little messy to eat (large chunks of meat that may or may not be semi falling as you bite into it) if you're the super dainty type. For dinner, I honestly feel like there are just way too many good choices: - Chorizo stuffed dates: a classic and many folks swear by it, but personally I think it's a little too saucy for me. The pepper-tomato sauce feels a bit blunt - I like my flavors "harmonized" with each other better if that makes sense?  - Butcher's steak: beyond awesome in terms of how much the beef tastes like beef - Pork shoulder: Very soft and beyond substantial. We were both basically full after just finishing up this dish P.S. It's community sitting so make sure you don't mind being elbow to elbow with other people.
My favorite restaurant ever. Pretty much. This place is incredible, food is always top notch (chorizo dates, brandade) and solid wine list.

Food was delicious, wine recommendation was perfect and servers were very attentive and polite. Can't say the same for the hostess though, she was short and stand offish. On top of that I was charged incorrectly (correctly at restaurant, incorrect on my bank statement), no biggie just call and get it fixed right? I was starting to tell her what happened when she rudely cuts me off, acting as if what I'm telling her isn't important to her...Sure, it isn't your job and you'll have someone call me fine, but don't belittle your customers!!! Specially when the place you work at has made a mistake. 1st person you interact with entering and last person leaving a restaurant are the hostesses, choose wisely!

Had a terrific meal here last night! Arrived at 7:00 and was seated for two promptly. We both ordered the pollinator cocktail to start - very refreshing. To eat, we started with the smoked corn tabbouleh salad and the heirloom tomato and peach panzanella. Both were delicious. We also ordered the brandade which was very rich and creamy. The salmon was also cooked nicely, and my friend ordered the dates which she enjoyed. For dessert, we shared the lime and coconut gelato in strawberry soda, and the fruit tart. The fruit dessert was nothing particularly special, but I loved how unique and refreshing the gelato float was. Altogether, a great dining experience that I would highly recommend. My one criticism for the restaurant is that the booths at the communal tables don't work! My friend had to get up about 5 times throughout dinner to let someone in or out of the booth. Not functional!

Let me tell you about my work team. We all love food a bit more than is probably healthy, we tend to overindulge while traveling, and we have a vegetarian in the group. We chose to have dinner at Avec when first getting in to Chicago and our only regret was that it was tough to find places for dinner the remainder of the week that lived up to our meal at Avec. We decided to just go veggie for the whole table to keep it simple and we ordered a trio of cheeses (say yes to the honey. do it.), olives, the foccacia, the kale salad, the tabbouleh, the burrata, an amazing bottle of wine, then dessert because you always need dessert, right? Everything was light, fresh, and just generally delicious. The space is on the small side, but very comfortable and it didn't get super loud despite being quite busy on a Sunday evening. Chicago has a ton of great restaurants but this will definitely be a repeat stop next time I'm in town.

I was recommended to try Avec after talking with a colleague on how great my meal was at Publican.  He thought this would be another great restaurant that has a small plate approach with the focus on food tastes and not being pretentious!  He was absolutely right.  One of my favourite dishes came from here and I would happily come back to see if it's on the menu. We were told the menu rotates often and though they do have some standards (the dates!!)... it changes often so don't expect to see the same menu even a month later.  It is a small restaurant with the actual kitchen among the diners.  We sat along the bar instead of the communal tables and got a great view of the chefs at work.  We were given a nice introduction to their top dishes and we composed a VERY filling dinner.  Everyone working in the restaurant is in constant motion.. whether it be clearing plates, cooking, taking an order, or serving... it's a constant hustle.  It gives a great vibe to the place. We started off with the sprout salad (love the flavours and texture... crispy sweet apple slices with a hit of mustard, and crunch and nuttiness of peanuts), calamari (my fellow diner was really hesitant on calamari.. he thinks rubber bands. Turns out this was a great dish and now he's open to having it again.  They were tender and the lime citrus note was good), chorizo dates (very good... love the sweetness hits you first then the paprika and pork flavour comes afterwards.  LOVED the sauce... we used all the bread to sop it up), paella (WARNING this is a LARGE portion.  Like more than enough for 2 people... we're talking probably 4.  it came with 5 large head on shrimp and 3 chicken legs... plus a ton of crispy bottom rice.  Great dish but damn we were stuffed), and ended with kumquat flan (LOVE this... my dining partner thought this might be too eggy and it was more like creamy milky heaven... the caramel was so good).  We did over order but wow, great flavours and execution.  I love the constant changing menu and how it does offer a variety of vegetables, seafood, and meats... not just a constant focus on red meats.  For those of us who like to eat more vegetables, Avec will be a constant on my list of places to eat in Chicago.

Went for lunch. Had an amazing salmon tartine. It was fresh, seared and delicious. My partner got the avec burger and his mind was blown. The menu is creative with lots of veggies thrown into the mix. Definitely want to try dinner here.

If you don't mind communal tables, then do take the chance and have a meal here. The food is superb!! Nothing super fancy but a very good interesting take on some dishes you know and you realise how could they can actually taste. For example, we have had the dates wrapped with bacon and the deluxe focaccia with truffle oil. Both are dishes that we had had before but we were amazed how great they tasted here in contrast to other places we had visited. The atmosphere is also laid back and the staff is really friendly and attentive. Without doubt amongst the best places in Chicago!

Very impressed!  It was exactly what we were looking for on a night out. We went with another couple and everyone thought it was great. We each ordered a small plate and got two large and shared them all. Some items stretched our palette like the octopus but we enjoyed the food atmosphere and will be back.
Excellent food! The paella and the pork shoulder was amazing!! They also give good portions for the price.

Of all my meals in Chicago, this one was my favorite. Perhaps it was just the welcomed solitude after constantly being around people for a week?(#introvertprobs) But aside from the occasional glances from the server or corporate guys drinking on their lunch break next to me, my attention was solely fixated on the food. That's what you would call an unbiased, unclouded experience! I dropped in during lunch and was happily seated at the bar. I overheard the host tell guests that the wait for even groups of two were at least 20 min for a table. (However, they do take reservations for lunch now!) I considered ordering the famous pork shoulder, but after consecutive meals at the Girl and the Goat and the Purple Pig, I was all pork-ed out haha. I ended up deciding on the kale and carrot salad with mint, dill, green harissa, and sunflower seed dukkah and the popular chorizo-stuffed medjool dates. The server was so kind to half the portion of the dates (from four to two) so it was more reasonable to finish -- and it was perfect! I loved how refreshing the salad was, with a hint of spice from the harissa. I've never had dukkah before, but I didn't mind it at all! I would have preferred smaller slices of the carrots though, much easier to eat! The half portion of chorizo-stuffed dates was just right with a good balance of sweetness from the dates and saltiness from the bacon and chorizo. But the pepper-tomato sauce was such a hit, I was devastated when I ran out of bread to dip into the sauce. Definitely would come by again, perhaps stop by its sister restaurant Blackbird next door next time!

The second Chicago tapas outing of the day - while superior by 1-star (compare to Purple Pig), not perfect. The 'woodsy' ambience remains constrained by the boxy dimensions of the restaurant. In no particular order: squash flower pizza (flavorful - garlic x 20, but where was the flowered squash?); octopus with charred watermelon (excellent, but why so acidic?); panzanella with grilled halloumi cheese (agreeable, but high on vinegar); chorizo stuffed dates (perfect); initiated with fantastic Greek rosé and in-house chamomile-beer. Nonetheless, we somehow don't feel a strong desire to return.

We came here before seeing the Broadway show. The all wood simplicity interior design is very casual and chic. All the food are special combination. We ordered kale salad, medjool dates, and deluxe focaccia.  Food comes fast. Almost every table ordered Medjool dates, a combination of sweet and savory, and it does not disappoint us! Focaccia has very strong cheese flavor and maybe not for everyone. (I like it but my friend doesn't like it at all, so we left half of it)

Was in Chicago for a conference and decided to meet up with a friend here. I had a vodka tonic and we ordered: -Brandade -Kale salad - Dates wrapped with bacon All three were the shiznit let me tell you, especially the brandade. It was the first time I had it, and it blew my mind so much I had to look up recipes to make my own. Kale salad was good - well marinated without wilting/ soggy. Portion was generous - we were very full just with 3 dishes. It was a weekday and the place was already crowded, so I imagine you probably need a reservation for popular times.  Avec just made me fall in love with Chicago a bit more. Thank you and keep up the good work!

At the Chicago Best party, featuring more than a dozen best restaurants in Chicago of the year, Avec presented an incredibly AMAZING bacon wrapped burger with the works. It was probably the best bite at the event (who would've thought a burger would steal the show?)!  One of my favorite burgers thus far; however, as I browse the menu online, it doesn't appear to be listed. Not sure how this particular burger fits into the "Mediterranean or French" menu, but it is worth keeping!  I'll venture in for the burger, and for the eastern Mediterranean dishes!

I love Avec. The only bad thing about it is how good it is that I come back here all the time. Finding a reservation for this is as hard as finding a spot to park in downtown Chicago :) :)  My suggestion is to go here by yourself so you could be seated at the bar. *What I did*  Love the communal tables and the atmosphere here a lot a lot and a lot! Everyone there was very friendly and attentive. Was expected that from the hype and everything. The food... omg omg omg. Everything was amazing.

One of our all-time fav spots. Food is solid & we go a few times a year. No reso policy is great for an early brunch or dinner. And very welcoming of kids, even though they don't have highchairs. BYOHC!

I can't wait to go back!  I just moved back to Chicago, so I was just riding my bike around and checking out all the changes. I stumbled upon Avec, and always wanted to go when I visited, but for whatever reasons i didn't. I was alone and only ordered the bacon wrapped dates and a couple drinks. OMG the dates were insanely good. The drinks were great too, but how were those dates so good?  The service was friendly and fast. I cannot recommend Avec highly enough.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. I took my best friend here for a birthday dinner. We had incredible service as well as food. The dates stuffed chorizo were the best thing that we ate all night. The dessert that I enjoyed at the apricot tiramisu, it was the best tiramisu that I have ever had. The price is definitely worth the food and I highly recommend this restaurant!

Creative and super flavorful! Our favorites were the kale salad (spicy and rich) and the chorizo stuffed dates (seriously??). Also really liked the salmon tartine and lamb burger. The green hazelnut tea was also delightful. Community style tables added charm and our service was impeccable. I love being served by people who get as excited about food as we do :)

This place is amazing!  It's a tapas place, as it seems with everything else in Chicago, so everything is shareable.  The small plates are pricey (but still good!).  The large plates are all really good deals (because they are double the size, great portions but pretty much the same price).  The pork shoulder was cooked perfectly and is probably my favorite thing on the menu.  Also really liked the lamb tartare, and the mussels.  If you want to get something that is filling and delicious but won't break the bank, I would get the pizza. The wait is not that bad (barely any wait for 4 people on a weekday), and there's sort of a patio-like area where you can chill and order drinks while you wait. Oh, and it's a Pokestop.

I'm good for a Chicago trip once a year and Avec is always at the top of my list for go-to restaurants. No matter how many times I've been there before, I'm always impressed with how consistently amazing this place has been for 10+ years. Seriously, it's dumbfounding.  In my most recent visit to Chicago, Avec was my first stop directly from the airport. The long bar is most welcoming to travelers, locals and anyone who is looking for a casual yet elegant meal. I'm a huge fan of eating at the bar because it's lively and you get perspective from the servers who handle food the most. Plus, I love geeking out about wine lists and bar menus :)  I ordered the kale, radish and tabbouleh salad to start which was perfectly seasoned and had just the right amount of acid. The crispy quinoa added a nice little crunch and the beets a proper amount of sweetness. It was really good. For my main course, I ordered one of the specials; the seared albacore with fennel, tzatziki, and apricots. It was a nicely sized piece of fish and cooked only over seared, which I appreciated.  If you're visiting Chicago, this place should be at the very top of your list. Seriously, it's impressive.

Very disappointing lunch experience. I specifically told two servers I am allergic to onions. No onions with my salad please. Salad arrives....WITH onions!  We ordered a $22 dish which was very average. When the bill came we were charged $28 for said dish.  Told the server.... his reply:  "Thats what it costs." We ask for the menu, show him the price, which was $22. As a customer, at the end of lunch, I watched as 3 people who work at Avec debated with each other behind the counter but ckearly visible and within earshot, on the price of said dish, for a good 5-10 minutes.  Finally the server returns with corrected bill and apologizes.  Service was "over attentive" .... Constant interruptions of our meal and conversation to ask if we were enjoying the meal. Expensive and very underwhelming food and service. What a dissapointing dining experience.

It breaks my heart to give Avec 3 stars (3.5 stars if possible) because it's been on my list for a while and it's so well rated on Yelp. But... Liked: -- Casual communal setting -- Hostesses were super friendly -- Roasted chicken was really good -- The "butcher's cut" small plate was also a hit Disliked: -- Everything was way too salty -- We ordered 4 small plates, 2 large plates, and only liked the two listed above. The rest were 'meh' -- The affogato with 'walnut nocino' was way too boozy... we mentioned it to our waitress and she kinda just shrugged -- $38 for a branzino that's neither large nor special Overall we had a good time, mais nous pouvons le faire sans 'Avec.' (my husband made me say it)
Attentive hospitality and A+ food (we ordered the chicken liver crostini, butcher's steak, and chorizo-stuffed dates).

Came here for a birthday dinner on a Monday night. Showed up early, around 5.30 and got a table right away.  Dinner was excellent, ordered Dates that were outstanding, muscles that were delicious and pork shoulder that literally melted in your mouth.  Wonderful service, great atmosphere and one of the best restaurants I have been to in Chicago. Do not miss it!

I LOVED this place and think it could be one of the best restaurants in Chicago. Small plates, big flavor! We ordered the chorizo stuffed dates (A MUST), the salmon with an amazing crispy skin like I've never had before, and finally the chicken. Also we got the truffle flatbread, which really wasn't that great -- it needed both salt and more truffle oil. Cons packed and sometimes over an hour wait no reservations

Oh, my poor, poor wallet. It felt the aftermath of dining at this restaurant. The food and service made the pain worth it for the most part though. It's unfortunate that you can't make reservations, so you might have to wait a while if you're coming during rush hour (considering it's not a large restaurant by any means). We came on a Thursday evening at 5:30pm and were able to be seated right away. Do note that you can't be seated unless everyone in your party is present.....supposedly. I arrived there a few minutes before my friend, and the host informed of that rule. However, there was one girl who ended up getting seated next to me, and her friend was probably 5-10 minutes late. Yeah, I'm looking at you, Avec. I see how it is. We ordered the following: - Whipped brandade: Very savory and delicious! Ration out your bread though because there's wayyy more dip than bread. Though you'd think there would be cheese in this dish due to the consistency, there isn't any surprisingly. - Slow roasted pork shoulder: This was also delicious and a nice-sized portion (granted it's $26). It was tasty, but it's not a dish I would absolutely order again necessarily. - "Deluxe" focaccia: I didn't eat this since it was made with primarily cheese, which wouldn't agree with my lactose intolerance. However, my friend said she absolutely loved it. The food was great, and I wouldn't mind revisiting. However, I felt that the food was a bit on the pricey side for what it was. Although the dishes I ordered were good, they weren't necessarily dishes that are a must-order. Our server was pretty attentive and friendly. She really took the effort to make me aware of which dishes I can order due to my food allergies (as in she crossed out dishes on the menu that I couldn't order and wrote down notes on the menu). +1 brownie point.

Yum is an understatement! Definitely couldn't recommend this place enough. Every single thing we tried for brunch was delicious. Bacon wrapped dates, lamb burger (OMG) and the pork shoulder are a major, major must! The French toast is the perfect ending for a delicious brunch. Must try this place while in Chicago.

I've been here a few times for both dinner and Sunday brunch and every experience has been very solid, although I have to say that my brunch experience probably edges out dinner by a little bit.  The bacon wrapped dates are a little on the salty side but still delicious. I've also tried a couple of the fish tartines, all of which have been consistently good. My favorite was the the smoked salmon taramsalata--the flavors of the smoked salmon were light and came together very well with the frisee and tangerines. The brunch pizza was also amazing--the crust was thin, light, and crispy, and the runny egg was perfectly melted into the cheese. For dinner service, the foccacia and honey is always a solid bet. The one entree I've gotten that I wasn't a huge fan of was the pork shoulder, which I found a little overwhelming because of its rich and heavy flavors  (though it would be great to share with 3-4 people).  Overall, avec's prices are very fair for the portion size and the quality of the food. The only complaint I have would be the setup of the restaurant--the communal seating forces you to sit elbow to elbow, and often times I find myself practically shouting at my friends in order for them to be able to hear. Other than that, though, avec is awesome and I will definitely continue to come back for the food.

First off, I love the atmosphere. Open, rustic, natural lighting, fresh air.  Service was superb, beyond expectations. One of the most recommended items I hear around town is that you gotta try the "Bacon wrapped Chorizos stuffed dates" and I did. My god, I'm adding them to my "you must eat before you die" list. Just amazing.  The mussels were a bit fishy and I can tell it's probably a more classic mussel broth dish with an interesting overly seasoned naan? Not my cup of tea.  The broccoli dish although had very little broccoli was very refreshing and tasty.  A hit. Lastly, I can remember the name of it but the bartender/server informed that it is a newer dish. All I know is it was a chicken entree and it was cooked to perfection.  If I'm ever in Chicago again, I'll definitely hit up Avec. It's casual, it's friendly and it's simply delicious.

Tabouleh, pizza with squash blossoms, cheese plate, olive oil chocolate cake and a French rose... Can't thank the shef enough for this great evening and tastes. Also design, stuff - excellent! Will come back for sure!!!!!

Hello AVEC Owner or Manager,  I love your restaurant - it's right in my neighborhood and one block away from my office, great food, awesome community vibe, warm service, nothing not to love. I'm a fan of the concept as well as the execution ever since it opened up a few years ago, and have seen it become a hip place for small gathering.  I appreciate your opening up the ability to make reservations, and also the lunch option. But I wanted to bring to your attention that lunch at AVEC is close to impossible and far from an enjoyable experience. Still great food and warm service, but the table set up is impossible to get in and out - I brought my colleague there just now, full of excitement for her to finally try the place I've been raving about, and it was embarrassing. It was close to empty when we entered, we were nonetheless to be seated right next to two gentleman all the way in the back of the restaurant. Upon request, we were moved to the brighter side of the restaurant, but had to keep getting up and sitting down when other customers were getting in and out of the table. Also, we were seated so close to the next pair of customers at the communal table that we were really invading in each other's privacy - again, I get the concept of communal table and love it at dinner time, but it just does not work at lunch time, when people are showing up around the same hour, and all expecting to have an enjoyable experience. And on top of all these, the AC was constantly dropping water right on my face from the ceiling.  I will also point out that it is very special to have a sit down lunch for any working professionals these days, and when they so choose to come to your restaurant, they have a right to enjoy this experience. Right now, it's noisy, crowded, customers are cranky and waiters trying to put up a strong and happy face. It is NOT what the AVEC experience should be.  We had to finish our lunch faster than necessary, and I actually came back and cancelled my reservations for tomorrow with a friend at AVEC right away.  Please consider some changes  -- change the table settings, reduce how may pairs of customers you seat at each communal table, or maybe don't offer lunch altogether. Please don't drive us away by becoming the blah restaurant that makes customers feel unappreciated and a bunch of satin in a can.

Went to Avec yesterday on 7/19 for an anniversary. The Medjoll Dates and Foccaccia were amazing, if we were to come back I'd get those two items again. We also got the Pork Shoulder and the Mussel with garlic bread and those were very mild tasting. Not a lot of flavor, nothing special. The mussels were actually very small. One thing that really ticked my boyfriend and I off was what the hostess did while we were eating. As most of you read, the tables are set up so that you sit next to other people. Imagine a dining room table where you may be in the middle of two random couples on both sides. What ended up happening in our situation was the couple to the right of us left and the couple to the left right next to us left as well. However there was still another couple all the way at the left end. We were mid bite into our food and the hostess came over and basically told us "can you please move down a seat?" She basically did that so there would be four empty seats next to each other on the right. 1. I would have no problem doing that if she would have waited for me to put down my fork and stop chewing 2. If those four seats were actually going to be used within the next couple of minutes. However the fact she rudely interrupted us and no one sat down next to us for the next twenty minutes or so was just bizarre. I was actually pretty mad at the situation and was going to tell her she should wait till a more appropriate time to tell someone to move till our waitress came over and mentioned that she saw what happened and that it was wrong. Her name was Sontra and she made the situation way better. She was very nice to us and apologized for something she didn't even do, so thank you Sontra. The hostess that was working though, should be taught when to interrupt someone especially when they are expecting such great service from a well known restaurant. Overall don't think we'd come back here again.

Avec is great. Small restaurant = long waits, but there are high top tables outside where you can buy a drink or two while waiting for a table to open up. Seating is at shared tables (cafeteria style, i suppose), which doesn't bother me at all but is worth noting in case you feel strongly about having a private dining experience. Focaccia is incredible. My boyfriend and I were hesitant to order bacon-wrapped dates (which are pretty over-done at this point); however, I had read reviews and we decided to try them. They were some of the best we've had! This is a great restaurant to go with a group of 3-4 and order family style - almost everything is amazing, so the more things you are able to try, the better.

I mean what to say about this place that hasn't already been said. Came here on a Friday night right after work, and a group of 4 was easily able to slide into one of the communal tables and get right to it. Super extensive wine list (didn't even read it to be honest) and very short cocktail list. Ordered an old fashioned which wasn't on the menu but turned out very well. Girlfriend ordered a tea and gin inspired drink, which actually arrived after our first plate of food - the only downside to the meal. Food order included the dates (they are everything that other reviewers have mentioned and more. you need these in your life), mussels with fresh naan and flavorful lemony broth, greens with feta and fennel (needed something green.. right?), focaccia bread which was more like dry flatbread with creamy cheese in the center (wouldn't order again), lamb shank with calabria chili sauce and apricots (wow!), fresh yogurt and berries, and finished with olive oil chocolate cake. Dates were easily my favorite thing, followed by the lamb and mussels.  The place is loud and busy (rightfully so) so expect that going in. You'll sit in close quarters and stare at the surrounding plates wondering - hm should we order that? Yes. Yes you should. Order as much as you can eat as the menu rotates a bit and make sure if you take guests they are comfortable with communal seating. Not as pricey as the neighboring blackbird makes Avec a great spot with high repeat potential.
I love this place. Their bacon wrapped dates was the best item on their menu. Highly recommend trying it out.
Consistently always great fresh food. You can never go wrong dining here.

Very chic place with awesome service and food. When you come here, expect to experimented different flavors from the Mediterranean Regions! My favorite was the chorizo stuffed dates!! Mouth watering!!
Highly recommend: chorizo in dates, hummus with pita, fideo (kinda like a paella). Do NOT get the baked egg with kale and green tomatoes, tasted like warm kale juice. Service was great tho!
Get the stuffed dates. I know I'm just a stranger on the Internet, but you must trust me

Avec has always been one of my favorite places for dinner. I always go for the chicken liver patè  (which is one of my all time favorite foods in the city), and the cod brandade.  My boyfriend and I came in for dinner this past Tuesday, and I wanted to give a shot out to our server, Christine. She was very attentive, helpful, had a fantastic attitude, and always had a smile on her face!  I always love coming here for dinner, but thank you Christine for the wonderful dining experience!

My father, brother, and I came here for lunch and had a great meal that I would give an easy 4 stars. Kelly, our server, was really nice as was everyone else we encountered here, but I'm adding the 5th star for Blake who was fantastic! The layout is simple, narrow, and cool. I like how, depending on where you're sitting, you can see the cooks and servers hard at work. For food, we went with: Chorizo-stuffed medjool dates, Charred beet tartine, Smoked Salmon tartine, and the Avec burger. All the sandwiches and tartines come with a choice of marinated lentil salad or spiced chips as a side. We got both. Everything was great. The bread that came with the dates was nice and crusty and perfect for sopping up the remaining piquillo pepper sauce. Each tartine had it's own unique flavor as did the burger and everything was made with quality ingredients, precision, and care. I did prefer the marinated lentil salad over the chips, but they weren't bad. A great spot for lunch, brunch, or dinner. I definitely intend on returning for all the above.

Avec was quite an interesting and unique dining experience. The atmosphere is modern with an interesting setup of tables and benches. We chose to eat at the bar on stools. The food was phenomenal! The portions were great for sharing. We started with the bacon-wrapped dates, and calamari, followed by the pork shoulder and fish. The only thing we didn't like was the calamari as it wasn't fried and had a strange taste to it. Everything else was superb! Great presentation and excellent service!

This place has easily risen to the top as my favorite restaurant in Chicago. The flavors and balance of the dishes are spot on, and everything was beautifully executed. One of my favorite meals in a long time, and I've been to many amazing restaurants. The restaurant is loud (biggest gripe), but also fun and the service was great!

Jesus Christ! Avec is an easy to miss spot on Randolph, so PAY ATTENTION or you'll waste a lot of time. The food is phenomenal, though, and the pork shoulder dish has vaulted to the very top of my favorite dishes in not just Chicago but the entire world. Look, I'm not a guy prone to hyperbole, but it was that good. There's a solid selection of cheeses, too, if you want to make a plate, and the dates and fish were amazing as well. But they could have been fried cardboard, and I wouldn't have cared and would have still given Avec a coveted "Merlin Five" because the pork shoulder was just that good. If you want an example where one of the most tired "meat cliches" actually is true -- "so tender you could cut it with a butter knife" -- then go to Avec and order that. Our server was awesome and had cool tattoos. Warned us against ordering too much food, but little did she know how fast the metabolism on this lil' AZN is!

Overall food was good, especially the kale salad with beets and the mussels. The mussels came with a pita bread baked on top of the pot it came in which added a nice way of being able to enjoy the broth. We also ordered the squid ink fideo with octopus. The presentation was nice, kind of like a paella, but it was too much fideo, not so much of the vegetables to help balance the textures. Overall it was nice to try. Would be back to try some of their other dishes.

Went here awhile ago and most recently went back a few months ago. What can I say it's an amazing restaurant with delicious dishes that are great for sharing.  I went with my husband and the wait was about an hour on Friday night which wasn't too bad, so we decided to stick it out. We were sitter at the shared table which was a gift and a curse.  On one hand we got to see all the dishes everyone else was ordering which helped us pick our dishes. On the other hand we got to see all the dishes everyone else was ordering... Delicious place, definitely worth the wait and I hope to be back again soon.

Wow. This place is absolutely amazing. I came here off a friend's recommendation and I am so glad I took her advice.  The restaurant is a Mediterranean-style, wine bar kind of place and has a very cool, modern vibe. You can also eat outside at these wooden standing tables, which was also pretty cool.  The service was great, and I got a salad which was very good. But the most amazing part was by far the dessert. I ordered a Turkish Float (lemon gelato + strawberry malt soda) and chocolate sesame truffles, and both changed my life!!! They also have a wide selection of international fine wines and cheeses, but I didn't order those (unfortunately). I would feel safe assuming they're just as awesome as the items I did order. I cannot wait to come back to Avec the next time I am in Chicago, it really was awesome.  Highly, highly recommend.

Epic, amazing, insightful combinations that punctuate Chef Paul's ability to know exactly how to leave you wanting more (and to try all of his restaurants!) the dates stuffed with chorizo - a must. Liver pate - holy cow! Ribeye, pork shoulder - flavors jump out. And dessert was a unique tiramisu. The coffee in and of itself is worth writing about. I hope to bring other foodie friends here again.

First of all, wow. A friend of mine and I went to Avec as a part of our restaurant hopping trip in the west loop of Chicago, and this has now become my favorite place to eat.  I had a couple of small plates like the Chicken liver patte, Steak w/ hummus & walnut, and lastly, their well-known chorizo-stuffed bacon-wrapped dates, all of which I HIGHLY recommend. We were also lucky enough to sit at the chef's table and talk to the chef as he was cooking, which was also fantastic. It's decently crowded as deserved, but the service is fantastic.  Highly recommended!

Avec is probably my local favorite restaurant, and I am always happy to be here. This is my go-to spot for taking guests who are visiting the city. The staples -- chorizo dates and focaccia -- are remarkably consistent in quality, and are always a pleasure.  The other parts of the menu, which change seasonally, are nearly always worth trying. I fondly recall sumac salmon, squid ink spaghetti, poached eggs, and many other great seasonal dishes. That being said, I've also had ones that weren't so good (duck egg pizza this season, for instance), so there's some variance among the seasonal items. The gelato and sorbet selection, which changes daily, is also always worth going for. Not only is it usually very well done, but it's almost always an interesting and compelling flavor. That being said, the music and atmosphere are great too. Avec manages to be intimate and feel vibrant while maintaining a high level of polish.  Service is usually great. I have only once ever had an unhelpful server.

There are so few times I've eaten at an establishment that just transcends the 1 - 5 Star Review system. As rare as this happens, it sometimes does - like tonight at Avec. Let me throw some adjectives out there; memorable, fantastic, complex, thoughtful, delicious, smart and a list of twenty more. Avec was a dining experience I've had only as many fingers (no toes) as I have or maybe less than that. So let's go through the dinner I just had: Tabbouleh Salad with so many things going on your palette was jumping like a frog. Chicken Liver on Crostini that was as smooth as silk and kicking with a lot of side flavors given by ingredients that I had no idea what they were.  Let's just say IT WORKED! Chorizo with Dates that was as thoughtful as a dish I've ever had.  This dish affected my mind more than my palette - Very Cool. A Pork Shoulder Casserole that made my Chef Wife's head buzz. She was blown away and I haven't seen that awed look on her face in years. Fideos with Squid and Ink - Wow - Unbelievable! Portokaloptia pudding with ice cream that was crazy good.   Sure you have to wait an hour for your table at 9:00 on a Wednesday night, but let me say emphatically that it is totally worth it. The wine list is well constructed to fit the food.  The service was very good. The price is surprisingly not much compared to similar dinners as memorable. I apologize if this glowing review sounds like my son owns this restaurant (which he doesn't) but I will not forget this evening anytime soon, and I say those words so seldom.

I always disliked communal seating, but now I really despise it.  This was my second time returning to Avec, and the food still didn't impress; no need to call out anything specific - everything was just mediocre. Why the 1 star?  There were a series of incidents with the hostess who didn't know how to seat separate parties at this narrow restaurant that has communal tables. My husband and I were celebrating something and decided to come here for a date night.  We got seated at the last table at the back of the restaurant. I sat with my back against the wall.  Later on, a party of 3 got seated at the end of the table adjacent to us, and 1 of the guys was told to sit in the aisle in between our two tables, so I was blocked if I tried to get out.  Then a large party arrived and occupied the opposite end of our table, leaving just two vacant seats in the middle of our table next to my husband and me.  Near the end of our meal, a couple arrived, and the clueless hostess asked me to move to let them in, but like I said - I was blocked by the guy.  What first bothered me was that she didn't notice the guy blocking me, so I had to ask him to move when I feel it should've been her.  I looked over at her, and she clearly had this "oops" face.  Additionally, I was very pregnant, and squeezing past diners wasn't very easy.  My husband and I decided to just ask for the check and forego dessert at that time so we found our waitress who rung up our bill.  I waited alongside the counter next to her.  Moments later, the hostess returned and asked me if I needed any assistance in an impatient tone like she was trying to move me out of the way.  I'm like, "I'm trying to pay, and there's no where to go!"  And she's like, oh!  My husband was already by the front door waiting for me, and he told me she approached him and told him he couldn't stand there to wait!  What the heck?  Where do ya want us to go then, lady?!  We're trying to leave this stupid place!  She single-handedly ruined my night, and now Avec is officially on my shit list.

We ended up here because girl and the goat was a 90 minute wait. It was the second choice but were were very happy with the food.  A nice bottle of Spanish red, no domestic wines.  We started with the bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed date, wow!  I wasn't expecting the flavor blast, spicy, sweet, crazy good. The order came with 4 so good to split with 1 other person - you can't have just 1.  We then had the steak and humus. This was also good but it was such a mild flavor it did not compete with the dates. This dish should have been served first.  We then had the pork shoulder/butt. Very tender and nice portion for two.  The bread was fresh, chewy inside and crunchy outside. It was a nice compliment to each dish.  The staff was nice and helpful.  I might go higher on the rating but the place was too loud to really enjoy the company I was with. I don't mind the communal tables but the volume was too much for me.

I came here for lunch on my short trip.  What really got me is Anthony Bourdain saying this is a spot he liked in an interview i saw.  Kinda tricky to enter...either that or I'm just kinda dumb.  I tried to push the glass door open but it only opens from the inside.  The main entrance is actually to the side of the open doors.  Its kinda cramped in there.  Imagine one long space with Just bar seating on one side and community seating bench tables on the other side.  Cool decor though. Menu.  Their lunch menu is pretty limited.  Mainly consist of salads and sandwiches.  I wish there were more options since I'm from out of town, but I'm not their target market.  Lots of things i wanted to try, but prob are served during dinner.  They do have outside seating for nice days. Bacon wrapped dates stuffed with chorizo in a red sauce...DELICIOUS.  i really enjoyed this appetizer.  Comes with a ciabatta bread and dipping the bread in the sauce...it was really good. Steak Pita wrap sandwich.  The flavors were really good.  I love cilantro and red onions with that vinaigrette dressing.  came with a small lentil salad that paired really well with the dish. I did ask the waiter if i can get half salad and half chips for my side...never got my chips.   Service was mediocre.  We sat at the bar and the our waiter was just whatever.  Just ad a whatever attitude.  Maybe it wasn't his day.
The food was exquisite and the wine is just amazing. Ambience was very good. Friendly staff and conveniently located.

This place had this chicken paella dish a while back that was single handedly one of the greatest dishes in the Chi. They got rid of it for some lame vegetarian version, and that since event has ruined my entire life. I love this place, I just can't go back there until this dish is back.

Its been a few years since we went here, but its still in my Top 10 all time meals so, while planning for a cross country trip, I felt compelled to drop in and write a review.   We ordered the dates, a spin on a nicoise salad, the whole Branzino, and the nutter butter thinggies.   Every single thing we had was top notch, but Yelpers at the time stated that if the Branzino was on the menu ORDER it.  They could not have been more correct.  It was so simple and understated but I swear to god it was the best fish Ive ever eaten.  Deboned while keeping the body in tact and head on, stuffed with copious amounts of butter and fresh herbs, pan seared to the point of crispy skinned perfection and then finished in the oven to absolute flaky nirvana.  I really can't use enough superlatives for that dish.  Just get it if its available. The only real drawbacks to this place were the lack of reservations(we waited about an hour) and the tight communal seating.  Or course, that depends on who's next to you...... In our case we were seated next to an extremely obnoxious lady who f'ing sucked so bad.  I had to do some serious zen to not let her ruin my meal since your neighbor is no more than 2 feet away.  Luckily that excellent food and service served as a strong distraction from her loud ass mouth.
Undoubtedly my favorite restaurant in Chicago. Never disappoints. Food is excellent. Only area that I have found in multiple cities that serves Basque cuisine.
I've been here twice and both times ordered the bacon-wrapped dates among other things. I've had dates prepared like this at other tapas places but these were the best.

Avec is by far my favorite restaurant in the city. I often dine there alone. I sit at the bar and enjoy the food and a glass of red wine. The staff is very friendly and know the menu well. My favorite dishes thus far Include the butchers steak, fattoush kale salad, and freekah tabbouleh. The stuffed dates and focaccia cheese bread are also phenomenal. I've had the salmon- also amazing but a little small. The potatoes and payeaya are to die for. Ambiance is amazing. I love the music and how busy it is in such a small place. I love avec.

Oh man. There is so much hype around this place that I just don't understand. It's good, but it is definitely not exceptional. Chorizo-stuffed medjool dates (5/5): This was probably the highlight, then everything went downhill after this...It was creamy and flavorful and just brought me to another level.  Focaccia (2/5): bro... it's a simple dish. But it does not stand out. There's an overpowering flavor of truffles which is not pleasant. The whole thing is basically just bread + cheese + truffles. not worth the money or the hype. I expected more from avec. slow roasted pork shoulder (4/5): solid pork shoulder. Besides the strong note of salt there is not much going on with the dish. It is homey in deed, but nothing creative or makes it stand out.  Creme caramel (4/5): nothing to complaint about besides a little too sweet. nice balancing of flavor with the edible flowers and crunchy things

The food is phenomenal. It's so good I don't even mind the communal tables which I usually hate. The stuffed dates are my favorite. The breakfast paella is also delicious and good value. Service is wonderful.
it really is... okay. the bacon wrapped dates were good but I've had better ones for lower prices

Love it here. Great restaurant in the loop and in a cool location. I love the small wooden interior and the outdoor seating. All the dishes are wonderful. Definitely check this place out and give it a go! You won't regret it.

AVEC ... So far I had a great pleasure to enjoy few lunches.  The Vibe - I'm not a fan of communal tables, but their bar area is very comfortable and the people behind the bar are friendly and fun to chat. The Service -  excellent!  The FOOD - I believe this in my #1 lunch spot. The menu is not big , but it has plenty of choices. You can go healthy or hearty , vegetarian or not :). I'm not a vegetarian , but I respect my company, and I value a lot a place where different personas can enjoy quality food without compromise or asking to substitute. When you go through the menu everything looks temptingly , and then when you finally make a choice and get your order ... The food melts. Mix of flavors and freshness of ingredients are top notch, and you just want to be back again and again.  À la prochaine ! Need to come for dinner ... One day :)

I went here for dinner last night. The atmosphere is cute but you'll be sitting at a long table with other customers while you dine. I started with a red wine recommended by the waitress, the wine was really good and came in a cute little carafe. We started with the chorizo stuffed, bacon wrapped dates. Those were the highlight of the evening. I wish that they had an all you can eat option for them! For the entree, we ordered and split the paella which was huge. The dish was ok... I did like that they gave you large shrimp with the heads still on. So the last time we saw our waitress that evening was after we ordered our meal. I saw her going to other tables to socialize with her friends dining there that evening but she did not come back to our table. The customers sitting next to us had a different waitress who was very attentive to them. The water guy saved the day for us. He was on top of making sure our water glasses were full and our eating space was clean. He even got us the check!

If you haven't been here, what are you waiting for?  The truffled focaccia flatbread is a classic - I order it every time as soon as the party is seated (it takes a few minutes to bake).  The chorizo bacon date dish is a thing of beauty.  It is, indeed, loud and busy, the décor is sauna like and tables are communal.  Instead of annoying, however, the boisterous atmosphere is fun!  Bring a casual date or a large crew and start a conversation with your neighbor about the delicious food.
My favorite restaurant in Chicago!!! They could never disappoint, just when you think they've tried it all, they come out with new exquisite dishes. Order whatever, you cannot go wrong!!!

Oh. My. God. I love this place! I got in a little early for dinner on a Saturday night, around 5pm, and sat at the bar. The servers were very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. I ordered the mussels but was looking at the sausage stuffed dates, too. My server let me know that they offer a single date to try and it was one of there specialties. I ordered one and you should too. Amazing. The bread that comes with it was beautiful. The mussels looked like a pie with a pita bread on top. They were also amazing. Great meal! I can't wait to come back to Chicago! This is a hidden gem!

Came here because I heard so many great reviews about this place... but was VERY underwhelmed. I came here for brunch on a Sunday and had to wait about 15 minutes before being seated. I ordered the chorizo stuffed bacon-wrapped dates, slow roasted pork shoulder, and the baked egg dish. Chorizo stuffed dates: (3/5) Although this is supposed to be avec's "signature dish", I was not impressed. I've had better bacon wrapped dates at other restaurants in Chicago. Slow roasted pork shoulder (3/5): The meat was tender, but it wasn't very flavorful. I could only taste the saltiness of the broth, but didn't have much flavor otherwise. Baked Egg (2/5): This dish was recommended to me by the waitress. She said it would compliment the other dishes that I ordered. However, the sauce, kale, cheese and the chickpeas just didn't work together in my opinion. Service was average as well. Perhaps it was because the restaurants was so busy Sunday morning. Overall, I feel like this place is over-hyped. Or perhaps due to the hype, I had higher expectations.
A quarter liter of white burgundy for $12 in Chicago, count me in  Amazinggggg liver mousse  bowl  I walked by here a bunch but never came in Will return

Their most famous dish, chorizo stuffed medjool dates wrapped in bacon (bottom right) is to DIE for. Every bite took me to heaven   We also tried the branzino fish - baked and fried to perfection with delicious crispy skin, and the chicken liver pate (not in pic). They were finger licking good!!  If you are not a fan of lamb or goat cheese, skip the sausage.
Outstanding breakfast with wonderful service!   Go hungry because the portions are large.   The seating is communal and the menu is designed to share with others.

This place is really good. I went here on a Wednesday night with my fiance. It's a small place, and we sat at the bar. Everyone there was very friendly. We got all appetizers, and all of them were great. The dates wrapped in bacon were particularly good. Their whiskey selection leaves a bit to be desired.
Sad that food this good would be served by servers who don't want to work.

Saw a review of "how the mighty have fallen".  Funny, I'm the other way around...I think they are improving their game.  Second time around was even better. Sunday is a good time to go (as for me it fits the atmosphere there)...sitting at the bar area is the better way to go...service is really great there - very attentive, but not in your space. Everything is very well prepared, creative, and have a great wine list (by the glass). Pork shoulder was amazing btw...

Several years ago when I went to Avec, it had a high-end, trendy, American feel to it. I never detected anything French or Basque about it. And there was a hint of Mediterranean. As of my most recent visit, it's still very high-end, trendy, American. The service is top. The food now is okay. Since my visit in 2008, the small plates have seemingly become entrée size. My advice would be to order linearly, not all at once if you think you may not get to enjoy a large plate because the small plates are larger than expected. I had a shaved brussel sprouts salad that had grapes, slices apples, crunchy peas, and some flavourful cheese in a tasty vinaigrette. This came in a large bowl. The other dish I had was a huge bowl of mussels. This also was supposedly a small plate. The mussels were a bit mushy, opposed to the al dente lima beans. Having had mussels at other restaurants in a sauce accented with saffron, the sauce on the mussels at Avec made for an okay dish. And instead of toast for better sopping of the sauce, there was something akin to doughy naan. The server paired both with wine, a white for the salad and a red blend for the mussels, and both pairings were spot on. Avec is a happening spot, so reservations are recommended. For the food, I give 3 stars. The service bumps my rating up because the servers are very good with offering suggestions. I got the opportunity for a return.

Over the years, Avec has become so inextricable from my memories and experiences in Chicago that a trip to the Windy City feels incomplete without a bite of those incomparable dates and a cold Atomium. Like most restaurants of its ilk, Avec doesn't take reservations and can handle around 30 people at capacity, so the wait for dinner is typically 1-2 hours during the dinner rush. This may be a blessing in disguise if it's a nice day, since it gives you the chance to enjoy an aforementioned Atomium (a crisp, flavorful Belgian ale) in the small standing area outdoors. Inside, you'll find that the long, narrow venue is constructed floor-to-ceiling from shimmery reclaimed wood. The seating is communal, so be warned: you might find yourself shoulder-to-shoulder with a couple on an awkward date. The Mediterranean-inspired menu is subject to change, but thankfully there are some standouts that seem to be permanently in rotation. The shared dishes vary in size, but are all both filling and surprisingly affordable. There are no wrong answers here, but I personally was not a fan of the whole roasted fish, and others have reported that the paella is subpar. My favorites: Medjool Dates - Avec's most popular dish and with good reason: it's a masterpiece. The savoriness of the bacon and chorizo are cut nicely by the sweet, fruity tones of the dates. The smooth sauce is tangy and satisfying -- soak it up with the firm Ciabatta.  Pork Shoulder - One of the largest courses on the menu, the slow-roasted meat is tender and succulent. The broth is mild and the white beans give it a nice earthy consistency. Brandade - If you don't like seafood, you may want to avoid this one. But for the rest of us, this dish is a knock-out. It comes with a creamy, rich puree of white fish that you can spread on sliced toast. The fish is mouth-watering and warms you right to your core. Foccaccia - A large, thin serving of hot, perforated flatbread with taleggio and ricotta cheeses baked in. Not one of the more filling options, but definitely one of the tastiest. Ask for a side of honey to really make the flavors pop. The servers are always highly professional and don't try to insert themselves needlessly into your dining experience; I appreciate that. The venue is gorgeous and you can share some sensational food for $30-$45 each. Make plans to go this weekend and don't look back.

Am I the only one that found every dish here way too salty? We ordered the dates, calamari, and pork shoulder, and all three dishes were way too salty to enjoy. This was my second time here, and I wanted to like it, but again, like the first time I came, the salt overpowered any other flavor. Service was fine but not overtly friendly. It's less busy when you come for an early dinner. Overall, I still don't get the hype of this place...

Avec in french means "with". Its a restaurant that pretty much you share the table with people you don't know. It can be quite fun or extremely unpleasant depending on who is sitting next to you. People come to this place to "hook up" basically. Food is ok and so are the drinks.

OK food. Ridiculous wait to be seated.  I'll upgrade that to pretty good food - I had a cheese platter and a Spanish beer, plus I picked at the appetizers other folks ordered. The bread was legitimately great, kudos to the baker. The cheese was cheese - could have gotten the same thing from any Whole Foods grocer, guess fooey on me for ordering something raw. For the treat of cheese and a beer and THREE HOURS OF WAITING FOR MY TABLE, I paid something like 30 dollars. Welcome to Chicago I guess, would not repeat. Edit: I asked the waiteresse if the espresso was good, she said it was great. She was right - they have fine Intelligentsia espresso on bar. That was a nice touch, despite the ludicrous wait.

Two small plates and one large plate would be enough for two people.  We got the chorizo stuffed dates (our favorite dish of the night), paella, and the pork shoulder, and left with plenty of leftovers.  The paella was our second favorite dish with a tangy sauce and moist chicken thighs with crispy skin and huge shrimp.  The pork shoulder was just a rich dish of meat but without any greens or bread to counter the heaviness of the dish.   Overall, we enjoyed our meal but would have got the paella, the dates, and a lighter dish, like a salad.  Did not know there were half portions as our server never mentioned it to us.  She didn't talk to us really.  We got there at 4 PM on a Friday and there was no wait.  We also got to sit by ourselves at the communal table :).  Worth trying once.

How the mighty have fallen.  Its been a year or so since I've had some of those famous chorizo stuffed dates, or braised lamb neck, or some version of the always satisfying paella.  Sunday night, we decided to go get some of those delicious good feelings again and hopefully discover some new ones.  Unfortunately that did not happen. It started with the cold statue of a hostess. I dont mean she was made entirely of cement and motionless, but she was cold and didnt smile. At all. We sat at the communal table and roughly 10 minutes go by before we get approached by our server or anyone for that matter. We order a glass of wine and a beer. Both were fine. Then comes the food... Chorizo stuffed dates: A classic, and honestly as good as i remember. Smokey, spicy, fatty. The generous chunk of hot crusty sourdough is probably the best bread in the city. Holes bigger than golf balls. I dont remember the price of these, say 3 years ago? But 4 stuffed dates now? $15. They're still made with pork right?  Calamari salad: A confusing dish. Charred calamari with what looked like watermelon radish (a finicky winter vegetable) pea shoots (spring) and a couple smears of avocado mash, i didnt want to call it guacamole because it had virtually no flavor. The calamari itself was salty beyond belief. Like, it had to have been an accident, perhaps a deli of salt tipped over without anyone noticing. THAT salty. But beyond that, there was just no balance. It needed acidity (lime juice) really badly and it was slightly overcooked and rubbery to boot. Just not good. At this point, we wanted to flag down our server and address our culinary concerns, but she didnt even look our way, it was bustling, loud and crowded. We shrugged our shoulders and accepted the reality. A bus boy eventaully brought our paella.  The paella: In the past, ive probably had 4 different versions of this dish. Classic in its own right but always amplified somehow with a housemade sausage or few bright creamy dollops of orange/tangerine mayo. But this time? No sausage (sad face) 3 (small) head on shrimp and the mushiest rice imaginable. I wish i was being dramatic. You couldnt differentiate one grain of rice from the next. It was just one big blob of overcooked starch. The chicken thighs were fine. But the paella overall was far from enjoyable. So sad at $28.  We finished the meal with their affogato. By far, the best part of the meal. Delicious in its simplicity. After tip, which I reluctantly gave 20% HAD to pay $120. Very disappointing. Maybe ill come back in 3 more years...

It use to be my favorite place... I guess the service is not as good that use to be. Especially when we come in for after work late night snacks. Food was ok. Every item we order was too salty and we told the server about it and she didn't take the food away.. We were so disappointed that the server didn't care. I don't think I will be back for a while.

As I review some of the other reviews I can't help but have some doubt about my own perception of this restaurant. It's likely me, not them. But, nonetheless, I will continue with my 3 (gasp!) star review. First impression: Casual atmosphere with foo-foo menu items with which I have absolutely no familiarity.  Menu: the menu made the dishes out to be complex.  I didn't quite know what was in each dish as my mastery of culinary lingo is incredibly subpar.  Not totally a big deal as, from my experience, high quality restaurants like this usually deliver on taste.  Food: Overall everything was tasty and good.  Nothing was ever at the level of 'omg this is to die for' and conversely nothing came close to being spat out.  Everything was just...good! Chorizo stuffed dates (of course we got them- every single Yelp tip and review mandated the ordering and consumption of these ahhhhmaaaazzzing dates):  My thoughts:  they were.......good.  Nothing more, def nothing less.  I'm not going to rave about them as, for me, they don't deserve all the attention. Brussels Sprouts Salad: Good. (That is all) Mussels: Buuuuttttter!  (Which allows this item to hover between good and pretty good.) Lima beans were a good addition. Atmosphere:  Pretty cool vibe.  Casual environment.  We were seated at an upscale picnic-style table (if there is such a thing) which  was backed up against the wood wall.  Loved it until 3 different groups rolled through at various times throughout our meal and conversation, requiring us to stand up and allow them through.  At one point, whilst mid-chew, we stood up allowing a group to sit down beside us.
