However, the area in which we were standing became quite congested with the waiter who was attempting to deliver drinks, the new patrons, another table of ~5 getting up to leave, and us.  All ten of us were jockeying for position in 2'x2' space.  Whilst being excused this way and excused that way I was able to finish chewing the chorizo stuffed date with bacon.  Folks, the bacon made this situation tolerable. Therefore, I think the bacon (and I suppose the chorizo stuffed date to which it was attached) is due an upgrade on its ranking to 'great'! Ha. Anywho.  Everything was good. Glad I ate here once.  Unfortunately, I do not have a desire to go back at this time.  Pro-tip:  weekday 6:30 seating was easy peasy.  7:30-9 it was hopping- people were waiting.

Great little place in Chitown. Very flavorful food. Great ambience. Awesome drinks. Be prepared to wait as they don't take reservations but it's worth the wait. Went for dinner with a group of friends and had a great time ...everything we ordered was great. Will definitely visit again. Highly recommended!
Very cool vibe/ambiance. Best chicken liver patte I've ever had. Best steamed muscles I've ever had.
Loved it. The menu is interesting and everything was great and the service was top notch. It's small and gets quite crowded so go early if you get claustrophobic.

My fiancee and I gambled on a rainy Sunday night when the Oscars just happened to be on TV that we'd be able to score a coveted table at Avec and we were well-rewarded.  A few tables were open, and I noticed that everyone seemed to be having a great time at this low-key yet trendy establishment.   Service was efficient, and our server was very helpful in suggesting menu items and also procuring samples of their wines before we placed orders.  I really appreciated their wine program, which included carafes of an excellent Rhone-type red and a surprisingly great Moroccan cabernet.  By allowing us to try something totally off the radar (who knew they made such good wine in Morocco), they ended up selling us on an entire bottle of the stuff! Avec was among my favorite places in Chicago that I've been able to try so far, and only wish that it weren't so hard to get in!  I'm already looking forward to coming back

Used to be my all-time favorite restaurant.   Then I went vegetarian and their options are very slim.  I really wish they would have more to offer than charred sweet potatoes and a salad -- I can easily make both at home.   Yes, love the dates, pork and all the great meat dishes, but don't eat that anymore.  I wish someone would read my review and amp up the non-meat options -- as this is a veto vote for me and my friends.

Avec: one of the most amazing places you'll ever eat, but the ambiance is what kills it for me. You'll either love it or hate it. I don't recommend going in a large group, the place is small, no reservations, and seating is cramped and it's a pain in the neck to get up to use the restroom. It's like sitting in an airplane (you're that close to total strangers, and you could be seated in the middle between them - the tables are large and not broken up). Someone is always having to get up and interrupt their meal to let someone else out to use the restroom. It can be awkward for this reason. Service is good. Sometime feels rushed. But the food and drinks... Phenomenal. You must get the pork shoulder & dates. Always go for dessert as well. Don't miss it. It's hard to go wrong here with anything on the menu. This place is high energy but it's got the 5 star reputation for a reason.

Not good. Sandwiches were impossible to eat without fork and knife. Chorizo dates were incredibly spicy, same with the bloody mix. Flavors didn't really work. Nothing seemed French inspired, all Mediterranean/Asian.  Capped off the bad taste in our mouth when my sister fished a long blonde hair from the Bloody Mary after drinking the whole thing...  Might have just been a bad day but I would not recommend.

My first dining experience in Chicago and one of my favorite dining experiences overall.  We came without a reservation around 8 on Tuesday night and were promptly seated, albeit right in between two parties on a long picnic bench style table.  This may or may not be your thing, but be prepared to share space and conversation ;).  It also makes it so that the person sitting in the middle, with his/her back to the wall has to ask everyone to the left or side to get out in order to get out.  I think this may probably be the only thing I did not enjoy about our dinner.   Service at avec is great - our server knew her stuff and all of her recommendations were on point.  We had the chorizo-stuffed bacon dates (AMAZING - this is what they're known for so be sure to get it), the branzino (again, delicious - the sauce it sits above is out of this world; we drank it), the mussels (superb), and two desserts - the caramel custard and this deconstructed carrot cake (which was a special that night).   Every bite I put into my mouth was delicious.  I would (and will) definitely come back!

I'm so happy that this place exists. It's everything that a quality dining experience should be: unpretentious, brimming with happy faces and full bellies, chef driven, small venue. The food here is perfect. Every preparation was packed with balanced flavors and was thoughtfully executed. While the staff is a little too casual (I'm a wee bit old school in my expectations for quality service standards so I'll let this one slide), the food, the pace of the meal and the focus on celebrating the diner's palate was awesome. I wish I could splurge here on the regular, but I will remain a loyal fan from afar:)

This place was everything I was hoping it would be! Everything comes in small plates but the portions are larger than you typically would expect. The chorizo stuffed, bacon wrapped dates were fabbb. The focaccia with taleggio cheese was seriously good, which honestly surprised me! The pork shoulder and warp farm greens were also a great little combo. Additionally, they have a great wine list!  My only knock on this place is that the restaurant is tiny and they don't accept reservations, but that wont stop me from going back!

I have been to Avec several times. I don't want to claim that I tried all the menu, but I can say that I tried many many dishes on their menu.  Everything these guys do is delicious! really, there was never once that i tried the food and I thought it was off!  I think one of my favorite item on their menu is the chicken liver crostini. so so good! then, the brandade! and the notorious stuffed chorizo dates (and I don't like dates in general...) Overall, I think that the small plates are better than the large plates and, honestly, the portions size of the small plates is good enough to make you happy!  Also, the drink list is quite large. They have wine from almost all the European countries and from several regions within Europe.   I would definitely recommend this place to anybody who is craving for small twisted Southern European tapas! You will not get it wrong!

First look:  I was honestly so nervous that my family and I wouldn't like it due to other yelper's negative review due to no reservation and small space. I was prepared for a long wait, so I wasn't surprised once we got in around 7 and was told there would be about a 45 minute- 1 hour wait. We used this time to go in for a drink a couple doors down and a western restaurant for the wait.  Atmosphere:  I really did love the atmosphere it even though it is indeed a slim fit restaurant that has apparently be open for 12 years, so they must be doing something right. The lighting was great, the embroidered napkins were a nice touch, and the plating dishes were perfect. Yes of course it was loud but for the conditions, I think anyone could handle it.   Food: Hands down amazing, I can't complain about a single course. The char-grilled sweet potatoes was sweet with a tahini and grill taste, the Brussel sprouts salad was fresh, and the olives and bread was a nice starter but could've done without. Entree wise, my mom got the fresh fish which was good but was frightful of bones, and lastly my tangine was hearty for a vegetarian dish a  tang of the yogurt. I agree with others who said that two small plates or one large plate is standard as a filling meal. The proportions are perfect for any time of the day. Outstanding!  Dessert: Two out of the three of us went for the special desserts of the day where my dad got the lemon ginger sorbet and my sister got the mint chip gelato. Each had special touches, the sorbet with a torched meringue, and the gelato with two small shortbread cookies atop it. finally, I had the greek yogurt cake which was moist and creamy with a crunch and the currants inside made for nice collected components.  Conclusion: . Wouldn't regret this visit at all, Even Due to Lenten obligations, we had to pass on the chorizo stuffed dates, but next time it's a must. However, I learned my lesson that other reviews can't scare me anymore because they made me think I wouldn't like it. Don't forget that everyone has different looks on everything which was something you always have to keep in mind. sorry I was sidetracked! Great food, interesting atmosphere, good service, and really good food :)

Decent, got a flat bread wasn't super amazed. Drinks were good. The food just seemed a little overpriced for what it was. Didn't love it. Restaurant is beautiful. Service was pretty good. Liked the open kitchen concept. Would probably go back because the menu changes often and I do want to try the bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed dates.

Incredible. One of the best meals in all of Chicago.  The bacon-wrapped, chorizo-stuffed dates and the taleggio focaccia are the stuff of dreams. The wait was about two hours on Friday night, which wasn't bad considering you drink somewhere else while waiting and they text you when your table is ready. The decor and atmosphere were simple and rustic. It was a wonderful night with friends and fabulous food.  Go. You won't be disappointed.

Excellent everything -food, service, atmosphere, decor. Two of us went for early dinner.  Loved everything we ordered to eat and drink.  Helpful staff, as well. We aren't dessert people so we can't speak about that. Wish I wasn't so full and could have ordered more savory.  Will definitely go back!  I (almost) never review any place but felt the need here because it was such a great experience on a rainy sunday.
Fantastic service, great wine selection. Perry continues to expand the menu and maintains the strong tradition of Avec.
Glad we found this place while traveling to chicago. Totally made my day! The paella was impressive with duck confit and shrimp.

The place was packed, so three of us decided to sit at the bar and have a drink to ponder where to go to eat. After reading the menu we decided to just eat at the bar, we were all so glad we did. Ordered 5 different plates and each was better then the last. One of the best restaurants I've eaten at while in Chicago. Will absolutely be going back when I'm back in Chicago in a few months.

Sunday Brunch Review Tips:  -They don't take reservations and you have to get there at 9:55- well, I strongly recommend that.  -Don't complain about communal dining- if you don't want to do it, then don't come here. It's a laid back restaurant that stretches wide as other Yelp reviews have mentioned -Come with 2-4 people. If you're cool with sitting on the counter cause it's just two of ya- that's great! -Don't bring kids- not enough space -ORDER a PIZZA! Those flavors, that spice, that sunny side up egg, perfect to share. The crust is 'finishable' worthy. Probably the best breakfast pizza I have had in Chicago.  -French toast has a strong lemon taste if you like that.  -They have great tea- but I got an expresso and Bourbon for 8 bucks and that made my Sunday morning!  Will I come again? Sure, if I'm up early and going with 1-2 people. But not rushing!
One of the best restaurants in the city. It has a nice a casual ambience, friendly service and the food is amazing! I tried the pork shoulder and was one the best I've tried in my life!

Um, this place was over the top! My friend and I ate our way through Chicago one weekend and this was most definitely our favorite. You MUST TRY the Sunday brunch breakfast paella - I do not even eat meat but I was eating the rice around the meat to get the flavor because I could not resist. Check. It. Out. Now.

Amazing! Such great food and very different flavors that really complimented. We shared the chorizo stuffed dates, (delicious) the kale salad (best salad I've had), and the focaccia. The cheese in the focaccia was crazy good! definitely recommend

I went with my friend after work. This place is small and crowded but it has cool ambiance and the food is awesome. we ordered the charred sweet potatoes and pizza. For dessert we had Turkish sundae. They also have a good wine list.

The perfect lunch... This was as good as a lunch can get. Started with the sweet potato fries, which were perfect charred and flavored. Had the burger of the day and the pulled pork sandwich. Both were amazing, however the burger was one of the best I've had, cooked perfectly and stuffed with chorizo and wrapped with bacon.  Great ambiance and wait staff. The gentleman behind the bar was very helpful with wine selection. It's a bit pricy of a lunch but it's worth every penny. Highly recommended!

My wife and I never miss an opportunity to dine at Avec when we are in town.  It never gets old.  Even our 4 yr-old loves the food (she has very discriminating taste!). The dates rock, and the brandade, OMG the brandade!  Service is always quick, friendly, and unpretentious.  Only drawback is the noise level on a busy night, but hey - you're going there to have a good time right?  If we ever have friends visiting Chi-town, we ALWAYS tell them to go to Avec, and when they do, they thank us profusely.  Can't wait for our next visit!!!
Loved the small plates - great for sharing - the medjool dates with chorizo were exceptional. Service was spotless.
I have wanted to eat here for at least a year. Avec did not disappoint. Have the chorizo dates and a glass of Madeira! Wait staff....fantastic!

I came back to Avec for lunch in February and I have to bump up my rating from 3 (in December) to a 4. The things that mattered to me in December were no longer much relevant. I ended up ordering the seared trout for lunch - it laid on top of bread with a salad medley in between. It hit the spot and really gave me the push to update my review - yum! Here's my review for December: The place is a bit hard to find since the door is camouflaged with the wall. Once you find the door - push, don't pull. I was expecting the place to have a more formal or semi-formal ambiance based off of the info I read online (queue the dim lighting, semi dressy attire, and music with volume that is loud enough to cover eaves dropping but soft enough so that you won't lose your voice from screaming) - my expectations were let down. The lighting was faintly dim, workers wore jerseys, and I don't think music was playing at all. The restaurant menu is setup suggesting that people share plates family style. They recommended that 1 large dish or 2 small dishes be ordered for 1 person. Kale Salad (small) -  Delish! The salad was light yet full with flavor. If you're looking for greens, I would highly recommend this option! --- 5/5 Chorizo Stuffed Date (small) - The spice of the chorizo, saltiness of the bacon, and sweetness of the dates really made this an interesting dish! I enjoyed trying it after noticing the hype from Yelp; but a try was good enough for me. The dish comes with 4 stuffed dates; we had 1 each and had the rest for take away. --- 3/5 Pork Shoulder (large) -  The first thing I thought of when I took a bite is that this reminded me of a taco - in a good way! The pork was very flavorful and reminded me of flavored meat in tacos. I, as many, would recommend this dish. --- 4/5 Steak (small) -  Good. Nothing less or more than my expectations. This was the last dish we settled on for our dinner order. --- 3/5 Apple Crostata with Ice Cream -  I love it when warm breaded dishes meet cold ice cream! The apple pie wasn't as warm as I would have liked it so that was a bit of a let down. They don't mention it on the menu, but this dish has raisins! My bf is allergic to raisins so he wasn't able to try it which was unfortunate. --- 4/5 (with the caveat that it's not cool to leave out ingredients that people can be allergic to) Turkish Coffee Gelato (Special") - My bf ordered this since he recently came back from Turkey and has declared turkish coffee one of his favorite types of coffee. Unfortunately, he was let down from this ice cream rendition. --- 3/5 There were three things that really caught my attention: 1. The bathroom sink/dryer combo - I've never seen something like that before! Pretty nifty! 2. The "kitchen"! Are the back 2 ovens behind the bar the main part of the "kitchen"? I noticed it on the way out so I didn't have a chance to ask, but it's such an interesting setup! It may be why the dessert took much longer than expected. I would say dessert took over 15 minutes to be served. 3. About 5 minutes after we placed our dinner order we noticed a "specials" board and wanted to change one of our dishes for a special. We were told that they couldn't change it since they dish was already made - unfortunate since we really wanted to try to scallops, but fortunate since the kale was amazing! Maybe I'll come back in the summer time.

I had no idea what I was walking into when I came here, I just knew a few friends mentioned Avec was awesome and yada yada yada. Coming in was a bit of a surprise, the place is squeeze tight small. You'll have some room to walk around, but there is bar seating (which has long waits) and communal seating which is a free-for-all. You can get more privacy at the bar, but the communal you will basically be seated at a table with open seats. You might be squished into the middle, or if you're lucky, you will get the end seats. It'll be difficult to get seated with more than 4 people in my opinion, but you can try your luck. Came here with my gf and we luckily got the end of the table. Ordered some drinks which were good, and got two small plates - the butcher's steak and the whipped brandade. The steak came around medium and I enjoyed it, but my gf likes steaks more well done (I know...). The whipped brandade didn't do much for us, I would recommend trying the dates. I didn't try them, but someone next to us got them and they looked fantastic... bacon chorizo and some sauce, just get it. I recommend one small plate for a couple. The large plates are pretty enormous. We got the wood oven paella and the slow roasted pork shoulder. Wood oven paella was amazing. I loved the slow roasted pork shoulder as well, the lemon yogurt was amazing with the pork shoulder. The serving sizes seem pretty large - we orderd two small plates, and our waitress recommended half-plate of the paella and we couldn't even finish the pork shoulder dish that much. Stick with one small plate to share between two people, and individual large plate per person. It gets pretty cluttered but its a very casual feel. If you get stuck in the middle of a table you might hate the experience. The food is really good though. As long as you aren't uptight and demand perfection, you should have a good experience here. It takes a while for the food to come out, so maybe order your large plate as your small plate comes to you. Still, I'd recommend Avec to anyone.

My favorite restaurant in Chicago, hands down. Amazing prices for the quality and incredible wine list. Never knew I loved Basque food, but this is so special. Clean, but robust flavors. Also, impeccable service.

Wonderful food. Terrific atmosphere. The only reason I'm giving it four stars is because I broke up with a girl here and now have negative associations with the place. My advice: Definitely go, but take someone you're sure about.

Bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed dates.  Communal seating can interrupt a dinner and make for social awkwardness especially when talking about weiners. Did I mention the bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed dates?
$10 beers (not even pints), average food and a couple of strange people on staff. Will not be returning.

First time here and I couldn't even find the door, haha. I came here on a Friday night and of course it's crowded and cramped. The space is as big as the inside of a semi truck...not even exaggerating. It's extremely narrow and long so you will be overwhelmed with the lack of personal space. Besides the issue of space and noise, the food is incredibly delicious. Food takes sometime to come out. We ordered chorizo dates, pork shoulder, whipped brandade, sweet potato (fries?),  and slow roasted pork. Everything was seasoned perfectly. I think during the day or coming when it's not the weekend would be better. Be prepared to wait if you have more than two people because they do not take reservations.

Wife and I come here all the time, one of our absolute favorite places in the city. The chicken liver crostini and flatbread are incredible. Service is always fantastic, let them know of any allergies and they will customize a menu on the spot. Great spot.

Avec was in a dark place for a more than a few years, but has recently made a pretty big come-back, in my book. The food is better than ever, including the signature dishes, the service is more friendly and expedient, and overall vibe is more fresh and welcoming.
the hype seems legit. best food I had in the city. bit cramped on the inside though and there is usually a wait. pricing is actually OK for what it is.

I stopped by Avec for a long work lunch and definitely wasn't disappointed. If you're doing lunch, I recommend getting there right when they open so can get a seat and put your food order in before the lunch rush hits. As I came during Chicago Restaurant Week, for only $22 I got the following items from the prix fixe menu: charred sweet potatoes, Avec burger and sesame cocoa crunchies. A lot of restaurants skimp back on portions for lunch menus, but the portions here were huge and I left completely full. By far, the highlight of the meal was the burger. It was packed with flavor due to all the sauces and I couldn't help but scarf it down. The service was also great. I was seated at the bar and although it got pretty busy, the bartender was constantly refilling my water and my food was brought out quickly. Overall I had a great experience and can't wait to go back to try their famous dates!

Hubs and I sat at the bar and the bar tender was friendly and knowledgeable yet not obtrusive. We -almost reluctantly- ordered the bacon-wrapped dates everyone keeps raving about, almost certain the level of hype those get is over the top. Proven wrong! They were the best bacon-wrapped dates we've encountered so far (and these days so many places have something like it). We also had something similar to meatballs, very flavorful and much enjoyed. We weren't that hungry, else we would've gone for actual entrees rather than these small plates. Hubs enjoyed a beer, I a Spanish cidre. Coming from Europe I much prefer French and German style ciders, which are much less sweet and sparklier than US ciders, so I loved seeing a good selection here. Looking forward to going back some time.

This place is amazing. We were a party of 4 and ordered 3 small plates and 1 large. We left full. I suggest ordering less and then ordering more if you are hungry.  Prices are more than reasonable for the quality of the food. People list not taking reservations as a con, but I like first come first serve as it allows out of towners to try new places without planning. Also, there are plenty of fine places to eat around Avec if they are full. We got there right at 5 and were seated immediately.

Food was good but nothing extraordinary. Our pork shoulder took a very long time to arrive, and our server ignored us for a long time. It was salty. There was no apology for the food taking a long time to arrive. The group next to us who arrived after we did left before we did. The dessert menu was underwhelming. Ambiance was lacking. Felt like a sardine.
What an incredible dining experience! We had the dates three cheeses and the ricotta focaccia. The dates popularity do not disappoint and the ambiance is very cool.

When I told friends I was going to Chicago for work, this place was recommended time and time again. I figured that it wouldn't live up to the hype, but it did. The service was friendly, down to earth, and relaxed. We didn't feel hurried even though the place is constantly packed to capacity. They gave lots of helpful advice on dishes that felt genuine.  Each dish we had was perfectly balanced.  Case in point: I'm not a salad person, but even the salad was a "wow" dish. All of the vegetables were crisp and fresh and the cheese and salad dressing was drizzled on appropriately and not overpowering.  Who raves about a salad? I do, now that I've had Avec's salad.  And don't skip dessert. The peanut butter brittle at the end was worth it.  This is one of the best meals I've had in recent memory. Cant wait to go back next time I'm in town.

I came here in a group of four, so I got to try a good portion of the menu. The food was well-executed and tasted excellent. The interior is quite lovely, but definitely beware if you're claustrophobic. It is crowded and noisy. Our server made great recommendations and took great care of us. My absolute favorite dish of the evening was the chicken liver mousse. I could happily make a meal of that all on its own.
Always top of mind when somebody asks for a rec. The whole fish, the medjool dates, the insanely perfect affogato - nothing here disappoints.

It's ok. The idea of the pork&date is quite creative and I like it a lot! Rest of the food were meh... It's next to the Blackbird and shared the owner. Avec is more casual but the food could be much better as now the differences is quite obvious.
My first time at Avec! It was scrumptious, I can't wait to visit again. Four small plates (dates, burrata, kale and the steak) accompanied by a lager and an ipa everything was delicious.
Cons: No reservations, limited (very scrunched) seating. Pros: As long as you're comfortable sitting right up next to your fellow diners, the food is worth it. I loved everything I tried!

It pains me to write this negative review but I felt I had to. Avec has been our favorite restaurant for years. We haven't been in a while, and tonight we decided to dine there. Walking in we were surprised and excited there wasn't a wait, a rare occasion. We ordered 4 small dishes, as we usually do and not one single dish was the Avec quality we are used to. It seemed like they must have been under different management because something was off. We were served a burrata salad with a very bitter tasting vegetable. I didn't understand that, since it took away from the burrata and Avec prides themselves on fresh ingredients. Then, we had the kale salad which wasn't mixed well together (everything was at the bottom) and it was drenched in dressing. The rest of the meal was underwhelming to say the least. The most shocking is that our waitress could care less. She was there in body but not there any other way. So disappointed, this wasn't suppose to happen. I'm not sure how Avec can earn my trust & palate back after this experience. How could I continue referring people here after tonight?

I must say I really enjoyed this place and would love to go back. It's a tight environment with communal seating but I loved being able to sit at the bar and watch the chefs prepare the meals. I had a salmon dish that was literally the best cooked salmon I had ever had. Also the chocolate cheesecake was worth all the calories! =)

Avec! Great experience. We sat at the bar which was perfect, plenty of room (even though I wouldn't mind sitting next to stranger).  All of our dishes were delightful and very flavourful. We started with some cheese, chorizo stuffed dates.  We ordered the trout,  chicken liver which was absolutely delis! My date was a bit intoxicated so we had to rush out, overall  great experience! I had a tequila cocktail wish was stunning! And he had a rum drink which was also great.  The place is tiny but cozy. Will be back and this time my date will be sober.

I like this place. It's a bit small and awkward waiting for a table but we managed. They don't take reservations. Fortunately, the wait was only 30 minutes on a busy Monday for 2 people. The seating is banquet/or group style with a little space to separate tables of 8. It made for a lively buzzy atmosphere. It's fairly priced for Chicago, maybe a bit pricey. The menu is very diverse and eccentric. I don't know how french it is because we had an Italian pasta dish and focaccia cheese bread. All the food was delicious and well prepared. They encourage sharing and suggest how many you need to share a small dish or large dish. For 2 people sharing our two large dishes were plenty. We added a bottle of wine and had a great dinner. There is a wide variety of wine to choose from. If you don't mind waiting it's a great little place to visit in the West Loop.

Im not sure if this is my favorite restaurant, but it does have my favorite dish.  The chorizo stuffed dates are just amazing.  They are better than any other date dish that I have ever had. They are stuffed with a ton of chorizo, wrapped in bacon and then covered on a tomato pepper sauce. They have  perfect amount of spice.  If I had to pick a last meal,  it may be a few orders of these... All the other food was great as well and I really enjoyed the burger they serve for lunch.  Overall great place to check out.

The food at Avec is awesome, service is okay, and ambiance is awful. The chorizo dates were my favorite dish: much spicier than I had anticipated, but I love spicy food so that was fine. Our server and the hostess were both kind of...gruff. I was also irritated because I made a point of telling our waitress that we needed to be out of the restaurant by a certain time to catch a show, and she totally blanked on that so I had to flag her down frantically after we'd finished our meal.  My biggest issue with this place is the space. Yes, it's super cramped, and you dine at long tables smooshed up next to total strangers, which is not my thing at all, HOWEVER that is not my biggest issue. The tables/benches/chairs are AWFUL. The chairs are super tiny, basically little wooden squares with backs that are approximately one inch tall (that is not an exaggeration). I am a pretty small person and I could barely even cross my legs under the table, which was built for Smurfs. Also, my friend and I both had issues with the super mutant and pretentious wooden front door to the restaurant. What a terrible atmosphere. For this reason, I won't be back again, which is a shame because the food was very good and decently priced.

Great place if you are looking to have some wine and share plates. The food I will give 4 stars. The dishes were flavorful and balanced. We ordered the octopus, kale salad and skirt steak as small plates to share. The octopus and steak were satisfying dishes with plenty of interesting flavors, textures and colors.  The kale salad leaned a bit to far to the tart side. It could have used either more sweet or savory to balance the dish. That said, we had it first so it did a nice job to wake up the palate.   For a large dish, we ordered the paella.  This dish had good flavor and crunch since the dish was baked to crisp up the rice. I wish it had more protein or artichoke heart in the dish, but I enjoyed it quite a bit. Seating is either at the bar or on a communal table. They really pack you in. It's a fun atmosphere if you are in the mood to chat with a neighbor and see what everyone else is eating. If you want something quiet and more intimate, this is not the place. Service was attentive and friendly. I probably would lean toward 4.5 stars if I could but with some misses on the food and the packed in dining experience, it is hard to give the 5 star rating.
Such a nice ambiance and the food was great!! Ordered the 3 choice cheese for appetizer and it was out of this world! If I am ever in town, I'd def come back!

Went right around 5pm on a Monday and got seated immediately. It started to fill up around 6pm.  The wine list was good and reasonably priced. The chorizo stuffed dates were amazing and huge portion. We got the warm farm greens which was a good salad but was not worth $13. The paella was good and the shrimp were cooked perfectly but I didn't love the sausage and would've preferred more spice.  We probably should have tried more exotic dishes. Overall good experience and want to go back to try more but pretty expensive and was really only impressed by the dates.

Cheese foccacioa... Order one!! One of my fave places to eat in chicago. If you can, try coming to avec for brunch and dinner. Everything on the menu is AMAZING! I swear, their breakfast paella beats out any of the paella I had in Spain.

The restaurant was highly recommended but they don't take reservations and didn't think of leaving a message in their voice mail or website that they would be closed on Christmas Eve. So it wasn't really great to show up and find that the restaurant was closed.
Big fan.  Small shareable plates at communal tables.  Food is consistent.  Menu changes, and the wine list is well priced.

I finally had a chance to eat here last week after hearing many of my sister's rave reviews. It most definitely held up to the standards. The small seating area definitely makes you feel like you are in a metropolitan city, so if you don't like eating in crowded spaces, it might not be the place for you. We tried many of the current plates since there were five of us dining. Some of my favorites were the chorizo stuffed dates, the paella, the burrata, and the steak. The plates came out quickly even with a big crowd that night and no one went home hungry. Each of the dishes was well crafted and very tasty. The cafe avec espresso+brandy and the affogato were great ways to end a delicious meal. I hope to be back soon!

This place was great but I think I had higher expectations based on reviews.  Of course I had the bacon wrapped dates, but I would have to say that it was a little to spicy and little too sweet for my liking.  It was still incredible, but I think I was just expecting a little bit more.  The patatas bravas were excellent.  I liked that even more.

I have to say I really enjoyed this place and even came two nights in a row! There are a few downsides although including a small crowded space that get increasingly louder the closer to peak dinner service you stay.  The chairs are extremely uncomfortable most without a back rest and simply hard wood. FOOD: I had the cauliflower tabbouleh both nights and it was a great blend of crunchy and smooth along with sweet and spicy.  It is unlike any other tabbouleh and I highly recommend it.  The seared trout was another great dish with a warm trout and chilled shrimp.  The gyro sausage was another hit and highly recommended.  We enjoyed the paella (although the bottom was more crispy the previous night) with sausage and head on shrimp.  As well as the pork shoulder with so much pork we couldn't finish it.  For dessert it is a must to get the nutter butters which are conveniently bite sized and curiously crunchy.  On the other hand another reason for the 4 stars is that i did not quite understand the apple dessert.  It came out hot and crispy on the outside but the apples on the inside were cold...very cold and I am not sure if that was there intention but I believe they did not realize when trying to quickly get it out to the table.  They also have nice teas, coffees, and cappuccinos!
Wonderful meal.  Kind, patient service.  The focaccia with cheese was super tasty!  Nice range of dishes with varying flavors and a warm setting.

Avec has amazing food, but it's the cramped dining conditions that make it tough for me to give this a higher rating. We went during a weeknight and even at 8:30pm we still had a short wait- they do NOT take reservations. But the wait wasn't too bad the hostess was very nice and helpful. When we were finally seated it was a tight space. I'm not a big person but it was tight and they are communal tables so you might need to move to let other people out. To eat here with more than one other person might be tough. We split a pizza to start and then split the pork shoulder as our entrée. The pizza was cooked perfectly. The cheese on the pizza was a little too rich but it was very tasty. The pork shoulder was so yummy. Again cooked just right and full of flavor. All of the dishes of our dining neighbors looked great as well. It just would have been nice to have a bit more space. It's a very small place and again they don't do reservations, so perhaps I would come back for lunch but dinner might be too much of a production for me.

Yes, just yes. The food was amazing and they split everything for you so it is easy to share! The server seemed like he was just as excited as we were to be there and was definitely a foodie, which is the best kind of server in my opinion.

I lived in Chicago for years and moved away several years ago. Avec  was one of my favorite places in Chicago. Upon returning for a business trip I was disappointed that the quality of the food had declined. Still a fabulous serving staff, but the overall good quality wasn't there. Little things like the pasta was no longer homemade, and the apple pie was clearly made earlier and heated up before serving (it was soggy and partly cold).  I love Paul Kahn--Paul, please bring the quality back!
This place is my go-to when we are entertaining guests or just want good food. Yes it gets crowded and it's communal style seating but hey, it's all worth it for the Chorizo stuffed dates.

After reading so many rave reviews, I have been wanting to try Avec with much anticipation.  My girlfriend and I finally went for a late dinner and expected to be wowed.  What a disappointment.   Upon entering we were greeted with an apathetic hostess who barely made eye contact or said hello.  After being seated our waiter came over and also had a bit of an attitude.  We asked him about an item on the menu and he answered us in a dry cold manner saying one word - "terrific" followed by an awkward silence... Nothing about the content of the dish, the reason for it being so great, etc.   We ordered 2 small plates and 1 large plate: the kale panzanella, butcher's steak and rigatoni bolognese.  The kale salad dressing was bitter and overly pungent.  It had some kind of hot pepper that was not listed on the menu and overpowered the dish, so much so I felt my lips burning.  The croutons - a staple of panzanella, were stale and flavorless.  And worst of all, barely 2 bites of one of my favorite cheeses - halloumi.  Then the steak arrived; I remained hopeful.  The meat was well seasoned and tender, albeit a bit undercooked, but I felt it was excessively covered in parsley which overpowered the dish.  The portion was also very small for $16.  Lastly, the pasta arrived and it was mediocre at best.  The onions in the dish were undercooked and overpowering and the flavors just didn't quite go together.   To top it all, the interior design may be intended to be "minimalistic chic", but in fact is just uncomfortable. Seats are hard wood flat bottomed, with no back rests. My back was really bothering me by the time we were ready to leave (and I don't suffer from any back problems). Tables are long and rectangular, providing for communal dining - the hefty amount of money one spends in this place is apparently not enough to earn you an inch of privacy. Also, if you grab a table, there are only two seating options - facing the bar (which means you're staring right into people's backs sitting on the bar stools) or facing the wall (which means you're staring at a wooden plain wall with no decorations, pictures, etc.). It felt like a cheap pizza joint.  All in all the food was unsatisfying and the service was lacking.  The staff was unfriendly, not to mention my girlfriend's water glass went empty several times and we had to call over a server to refill it.  The interior design was just flat out wrong. This was an overpriced distasteful experience.

Amazing meal and really good value! We live down the street from Avec and aren't at that point in our lives anymore where No Reservations Accepted works for us, but the lingering crowds have definitely been an allure all these years, so we finally went during lunch today and everything we ordered was top notch, with great service to boot.  My husband and I mainly shared several small plates (like 5 - we went hungry!), had their yummy house made lemonade, and split a to-die-for orange marmalade gelato.  When compared to the other more "commercial" lunches I usually have in the loop which ring in at $10-$12, I feel like Avec offered a menu that was truly unique, fresh, flavorful, and filling all for a price point that was just slightly more.  Plus, I'm a vegetarian and felt totally satisfied with the number of options available to me, not having to pick from the single selection as is the case at many other establishments.  Totally loved it and will definitely be back again soon, and may even consider bearing the wait for an evening meal next time.

Amazing and memorable dinner here! Try to come early or during off hours as the restaurant is small and the wait could be long during peak hours. They do have a nice little hangout spot outside to sip wine while you're waiting for a table though.  On to the meal, here's a breakdown of what we ordered (dishes are served tapas style and meant to be shared): - Strawberry with fava beans, mint, straciatella cheese, rose vinegar, and aleppo pepper: Good refreshing summer dish that worked well as a sort of palete cleanser since the rest of our dishes were on the heavier, fattier side. - Smoked whitefish with taramasalsta, pickled turnip, cucumber, and baby spinach on seed bread: Solid dish especially for those who enjoy seafood, the smoked flavor is very apparent. - Chorizo stuffed medjool dates: bacon wrapped and served with piquillo pepper tomato sauce. This dish was packed with flavor; the sweetness of dates marries well with the saltiness of chorizo and the sauce adds a nice spicy kick. Be sure to soak up some more of that sauce goodness with the bread that comes served with the dish. - Squid ink pasta with sardines, fennel, lemon, dill and n'duja bread crumbs: This dish is packed full of aromatic flavor; I thought the sardine was bordering a bit on overwhelming but that could just because I don't eat sardines much. The dish was still delicious and I would recommend it for anyone who isn't afraid of some bolder flavors. - Honey lemon semifreddo with almond meringue and basil apricot sauce. Dessert was decent, didn't blow me away but I'm also not a dessert person so don't know if that's saying much. We were too full to get the much-raved about nutter butters, but the girlfriend has had them before and she says they're amazing :)  Decor here is modern and clean. The interior is lined with an abundance of natural wood. It's a bit on the pricey side, but the food is delicious. Definitely a date-worthy spot or a place you can go to celebrate a significant event. I would definitely recommend it and hope to go back to try more of the menu.
It was good but not as good as their neighbor (same owners) blackbird. A bit too much salt on most things and I am someone who tends to love salt.

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night with my friend. We didn't have reservations but we got seated within ten minutes at the bar. We decided to go with the small plates and got the stuffed dates, glazed steak, and gyro sausage. The stuffed dates were really good. A perfect combo of sweet and savory. The steak was cooked perfectly and had a nice flavor. However neither one of us liked the gyro sausage. The spices and flavors were a bit too powerful for this plate. Overall a good experience however it does get really loud with the large groups.

Avec is all about the dates, pork shoulder, and taleggio focaccia. The dates are exceptionally flavorful, a nice mix of sweet and savory with a hearty chorizo stuffing and bacon wrapping (thanks, Publican Quality Meats!) I would drink shots of the piquillo pepper sauce.  The preparation of the pork shoulder varies, but it's always incredibly tender and a very large portion. The latest rendition I've tried, with smoked clams and arugula, was very, very salty - hopefully that was just a one-off occurrence.  And man, I'm not a fan of truffle oil in most foods, but I think it actually pairs really well with the soft taleggio in the focaccia.  I'd love to try Avec's other offerings...it's just hard to stray from the staples above. A bit pricey, but generally worth it.
Incredible food with a vast selection of wines to choose from. Our server was warming and ridiculously friendly. However, it would be nice to see this place bring in some craft cocktails.

You know it has been a good experience when you can't decide which of the dishes you tasted were your favorite... Because they all were. Highlights for me were the dates, focaccia and the cauliflower dish... but everything was truthfully amazing. I really like the small space and cozy feel, but the seating arrangement was awkward and less than ideal if I'm going to be completely honest. That being said, I will absolutely be back for seconds.

One of my favorite spots in the city -- most recently sat at the bar stools directly in front of the stove, and it was an amazing front row seat to everything that was coming out of the kitchen. I highly recommend it if you're luckly enough to be there when it's available. The entire kitchen staff popped over to check on us, making sure our questions were answered and even talking us through their prep/techniques as we watched them assemble delicious dish after delicious dish. We also kept commenting on how calm and respectful the kitchen crew was -- it was strange to see a fairly busy kitchen staff work in such a zen state. Everyone there is passionate about what they do and what they serve, and seemed entirely approachable. Our server (seemed to be the manager) smirked as he plopped unknown tasters down when we requested help deciding on wine (he seemed to enjoy watching us try things and then surprising us with which pour it was), and the generous wine pours (a full pour + a small carafe with another pour+) are a solid deal. When we couldn't decide between the kale and serrano ham plate as starters, they ended up giving us the kale, compliments of the house, which left us giggling and smiling like kids. It was also fortuitous, as it's now one of my favorite dishes. The portions are generous, and they've adopted a few "half" portions for some of their larger menu items (dates, chicken, and paella can all be halved and still fill your belly). The kale panzanella was insanely good -- smokey and salty and complex. We kept stopping between bites and exclaiming, "I mean.. this is kale.. How is this salad? This is amazing. I don't understand." The paella made me smile -- crispy rice bits, smokey sausage, and shrimp -- and the pork shoulder made us weep with happiness (what felt like 5lbs of pork happiness - it was huge and dense and ridiculously tender). The one of the chefs (ok, all of the chefs)  excitedly recommended we take some home and throw a fried egg over it. YES PLEASE. Oh, and the serrano ham plate? It's huge. It was like getting a huge salad made out of ham, with pickled grapes that made my heart flutter. Everyone's great about helping you edit your choices, and making sure you understand how much food you really just ordered. Our guy talked us down a bit from our list when it grew to about 25% of the menu items. They also have a monthly brunch series with guest chefs that looks amazing, and that I'm excited to check out at some point. We went on a Sunday @ 7p with no wait, but it can get busy on Fri-Sat. Atmosphere is loud in a fun, family holiday way, and the high ceiling and wood interior gives everything an airy but cozy feel.

I've been here multiple times, with various people. We try to get there as soon as it opens to avoid a long wait. We always get the chorizo stuffed dates, and their whole fish. Depending on how many people are there, we will decide how many plates to get. I've never had anything bad here. Last time we went they had a paella, and it was so, so good. The staff has always been very friendly, and they have always helped us find a bottle of wine. Can't wait to go back!!

My favorite restaurant in Chicago.  Bacon Chorizo Dates - emphasis on the bacon and chorizo. large and full of flavor. Seafood Paella - rich, flavorful, but could use more shellfish Pork Shoulder with Clams - very hearty and tasty. a little on the salty side so keep that in mind when ordering other dishes Steak salad and Hummus - very very good. house made hummus was fantastic Kale salad - delicious! halumi, croutons, raisins were perfect together I also ordered a glass of the Malbec/Cab blend to go with dinner which was a great compliment. Ask the staff for wine recommendations, they won't disappoint. The place gets packed so be prepared to wait at peak dining hours. I will be back soon!
A true Chicago gem.  Went here in July 2015, after about 10 years.  And it's still very good.  Probably got better.
Avec has it all - intimate setting, yummy small and large plates served family style, delicious drinks and a great stuff. I am visiting from Portland and I felt like I was back home!

One of the great restaurants in Chicago. Unique, inspiringly good tasting food. Their braised pork shoulder is phenomenal. The daily fish special, a snapper if I recall was excellent and so was the bacon wrapped dates. Great atmosphere. A feeling of real vitality and spirit, where one feels  rewarded with the experience. It's time to go back as this was over a year ago.

This is always my first recommendation to anyone visiting Chicago.  Get in early because there are no reservations and the wait can get long, but it's worth every second you stand around smelling the delicious foods.  Get the pork shoulder, bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed dates and the Focaccia

Absolute MUST in the menu: Chorizo stuffed medjool dates, It has been a long time since I tasted something so weird and delicious at the same time, wow. I also liked the focaccia with cheese and truffle oil and the roasted chicken. Oh and the espresso mousse for dessert. Perfect.

Beautiful and tasty food.  The brandade completely lived up to its reputation.  The dates were yummy and the paella was also very satisfying.  We got there around 6 pm on a Tuesday, and it was about 70% full.  We chose to sit at the bar.      The bartender was the only sour note in an otherwise flawless meal.  He was a bit boorish to not just us, but to all the guests seated at the bar.  Maybe he was having a bad day?  Not sure, but it sort of took away from the experience.

Normally I add pictures to my reviews, but it was so good that I ate everything before I remembered to take any, ha! I think that says plenty about the quality of the food. This place is pretty small. I have a theory that it's actually a renovated shipping container. The tables are pretty cramped and the long communal table is a little annoying, especially if you need to go to the bathroom. That being said, all of the food was delicious! A little salty, but delicious! I would definitely recommend sticking to two small plates or one large plate per person. We got the large paella plate and it was enough for a person plus a little more for leftovers. Across the board, everything was very scrumptious. Expect to leave very full and in a food coma
There are not enough fabulous words to describe this place. Whoa. I have to go back and fast for several days before so I can eat more of the fabulousness! I love this place.

This is a solid place be it w a date or post work drinks.  A great section of wine / drinks + delish small plate apps in a cool ambiance.  I highly reco this spot. Only issue is the space (small & tight) and long wait times.

Great food, just little uncomfortable when you're asked in the middle of your bite to get up to let someone else slide in. The table seating is tight, and but worth a try. We had squid ink pasta (average), trout (pretty good) , farm green and Nutter butter ( good).

for the freeke  taboule salad with cauliflower  i wana give the kitchen a hugh mothafukinfive Good job guys keep it up Love the wood fired oven in the back kitchen i wish I would've sat by it but all seats were taken.. the host lady in front wasn't too happy to work on haloween.  Smile you have a lot happy people excited to be in your restau..
You must try dates and the pork shoulder. Cool hip place but not too much privacy since the interior is really tiny but every square inch was utilized well.

Dates and Pork Shoulder were both excellent.  Wine was not overly pricey.  Get there early as they don't take reservations.  It's community style seating with large tables.  Great for any celebration!
All of the dishes we've ordered were excellent!  I highly recommend the chorizo-stuffed dates and chicken liver crostini. Service was good, the staff was very knowledgeable about the food/menus.

Best brunch in the city! The menu changes weekly, but you really can't go wrong. I especially love the coddled eggs and the bacon wrapped dates, and was pleasantly surprised with the French toast (don't typically do sweet for brunch). The interior is contemporary, but cozy and service is good.

Hands down, the best I've tried while visiting Chicago. Starting with my favorite of the night: Chicken Liver Crostini. This was absolutely outstanding. The smooth and creamy chicken liver pâté was to die for.. the stone fruit mostarda with fresh herbs to top the crostini..amazing play of creamy, crunchy, sweet, salty, fresh. I wish I could eat this every day.  Chorizo Stuffed Medjool Dates. Another great one. Came in 4 pieces and again, the sweetness of the dates and saltiness of the chorizo and bacon were perfectly balanced. The tomato pepper sauce added a nice touch of acidity that really complimented the dates and made this dish different from other bacon wrapped dates I've tried. Definitely recommend! I also tried the Whole Roasted Branzino. Cooked and seasoned perfectly but since it is a mild tasting fish, I always found it a bit boring. They topped it with some wonderful colors which included carrots, parsley, cilantro, garbanzo beans (which were undercooked). It was good but I think the others items on the menu were better. The Pork Shoulder was also pretty good. Super tender with a generous portion. Loved the smoked yogurt that was on top. I would say give this one a try. Service lacked a bit but the food made up for it. If I visit again, I will definitely be back!

Three of us had dinner on Sunday night at Avec.  We enjoyed the community tables, and had fun talking with the folks next to us (they gave us some great food recommendations as well!)  The food was delicious, and the service was good.  Our only concern was how loud it got - it was a little tough to hear one another. That being said, we enjoyed our meal, and we would recommend Avec to others.
The food is straightforward, but good. The bar is somewhat sterile as you are facing a blank wall. I would come here again, but it's not a priority.

Most food was delicious.  A few salads were overly salty, especially the cauliflower appetizer. We ordered a whole sea bass that we were told could be shared by two people.  Fish was delicious but had very little meat.

What a great find! So glad that I spent an enjoyable hour for lunch at this little gem. Excellent creative fare - and the wait staff were knowledgeable, friendly, and professional.  I look forwar to returning!

Not a place for a quiet romantic meal, but we weren't looking for that tonight. The small and large plate menu offered a ton of variety.  We enjoyed sharing the salted cod, whole fish, and the pork shoulder.  Everything tasted fresh and was cooked perfectly. The family style serving and communal seating brought a little bit of home into the experience.  Service was quick and friendly.
Went for drinks and apps after a late meeting.  Loved the space, and was absolutely blown away by the drinks and the food.  The drinks were perfect and the food was innovative and perfectly executed.

Out of towner here.  The hubs and I came here for brunch on a Sunday and we are so happy we did! One of the best restaurants we visited on our little Chicago foodie adventure.  Must eats: -Dates -Seafood Paella  -Patatas Bravas Must Drink: -Bloody Mary -Atomium beer (so good!) Avoid: -French Exit (tastes like soap) Definitely eat as much as possible here. I heard the waitress say she also loves the trout... Maybe get that too!  Overall Yum and *****

This place is awesome...I don't know if we got lucky but I called around town for dinner and everything was an hour or greater wait, but we went to this place and got seated IMMEDIATELY...lord have mercy I felt like the hulk on ice skates... Anyways we ordered about 8 plates of food and dessert for 4 people and honestly everything we ordered was amazing! We went to the purple pig a few days ago and waited two and a half hours and the food wasn't as good as this place--I'm looking at you pork shoulder! The pork shoulder here was like getting a BJ from a leprechaun on St Patricks day, really. Paella, squid ink noodles, and bacon dates were sexy too. This might just be me but I really liked the dessert SWEET CORN POT DE CREME--I literally have no clue what any of the words meant in the desciption except for the words sweet corn. But I took a leap of faith and it was freaking amazing...I wanted to slap someone after eating it... I would throw a litter of kittens off a balcony for a liter of this stuff. Also the ambience is like the last supper with Jesus, but with Pandora playing loudly so you gotta scream to talk to people. You eat on a long bench along side strangers which allows you to eat their leftovers. Also please no smoking, the entire place is made out of wood. Cheers

This was great restaurant! It was a discreet entrance but once we found our way in it was a great experience. Fast service, they bring the dishes out as they are ready. Food quality was wonderful and even the bathroom experience was neat (you have to use the hand dryers). Would come here again for sure. There was a 15 min. wait so wasn't too bad & parking is easy to find in the area.
Bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed dates paired with a berry fresh Pinot Noir followed by smokey mussels and pork shoulder.  Delicious!  Wait staff was attentive and friendly.  Very enjoyable.
Came here once late on a Monday night. The place is nice and the food is decent. The service is great!

Great place for a date or just to catch up with an old friend. Very creative plates. The bartenders are quick and knowledgeable when I asked about certain cocktails and liquors. One of my favorite places for eclectic french food in the city :)

Friend told me I had to come try this place and the dates.  Truth be told i was having a hard time getting excited about eating dates but then he said the magic word (Bacon) so I caved and came by. They are doing a deal where they donate to the Lynn Sage foundation if you get a ginger daiquiri so I started with one of those...hey, its for a good cause! ordered the dates...WOW.  and truth be told there is more meat than fruit...  its like a date cut open and placed on a chorizo meatball and wrapped in bacon...I mean, savory, sweet...bacon... bread to dip in the sauce...whats not to love. also had the hanger steak.  was good.  but didn't blow me away the way the bacon wrapped dates did. and wrapped up with home made "nutter butters".  these were good...  did not look at all like the peanut shaped cookies, more like fudge.  but very tasty...peanut butter, caramel...bit of texture...mmm.

Literally one of the best meals I have ever eaten...!! Dined here with a friend on Labor Day around 8PM (We were seated within 10 minutes - woohoo!!) We ordered the chorizo-stuffed medjool dates, squid ink pasta, and slow roasted pork shoulder. Ohmy. Everything was sooo delicious and it was more than enough food for two people. The next time I am in town, I am coming back for those stuffed dates!!
The line and the wait are terrible but the food is incredible. We were a party of 3 and waited almost an hour to be sited. Again, worth it!!  The food is AMAZING!!

Go with people you know and the more the better. You'll want to order everything on the menu and share it! It's a great decor and the open style of the restaurant is fun! You have to try the chorizo bacon dates!!! So tasty! You might sit next to strangers but it's a pleasant community and the staff is very friendly! Dessert is worth every penny as well!

Not taking reservation is fantastic. I've stopped here at the oddest of hours and easily been able to get a seat. The communal table is a great place to chat, and I actually made friends with two of my neighbors who were on a date.  The food is top notch, but I wouldn't say it blew my mind. The staff however were some of the friendliest in Chicago. They always have a joke ready and they know when it is/isn't appropriate to jump in to a conversation. Service is fast and drinks are strong. My only complaint is that it does get crowded.  Avec is good for brunches, casual dates, pregaming, and solo dining.

Sadly the brunch has come to an end and I must move on. This was an amazing experience. Everything from the service to the food to the ambience was great. I can't say anything bad about his place. Just know the space is a little small and gets fairly crowded for brunch. If you don't like eating too close to strangers or get claustrophobic easily this might not be the restaurant for you. If you go during the brunch rush (11-1pm) you need to anticipate waiting for both your table and food. I recommend going as close to 10am as possible since they don't take reservations. I'm very impressed with how quickly they do serve you given the space they have to work with. If you eat at the bar, hopefully you get Duron to wait on you. He's a stud. Kelly is great too. They function in a very tight space and have a lot of people to wait on so be patient with them. I suggest going at 10am when they open to avoid as much of the crowds as possible. I've been there from 10-3pm so have seen the entire brunch unfold in real time. They close the kitchen at 2pm so just make sure you get your last order in before then and you can eat and drink until 3pm. Just know they start seating people for dinner at 3:30pm. After trying everything on the menu, my favorite small plates are the poached eggs and chorizo-stuffed medjool dates. Favorite large plates are the pizza, pork shoulder, and focaccia. Both the papas braves and pork belly are great sides. Nutter butters and Affogato for dessert are amazing too. For a full review on each menu item check out my blog:  bradysbrunch.com  or my IG @bradysbrunch Food: 4.8/5 Service: 4.5/5 Overall: 4.7/5 Waiters: Duron  / Kelly Executive Chef: Erling Wu-Bower Chef de Cuisine: Perry Hendrix Mediterranean and Midwestern influenced shared plates Opened October 2003 James Beard awards: Nominated for Outstanding Restaurant Graphics in 2005 Awarded Outstanding Restaurant Design in 2005 2 Star Green Restaurant certified

I went in around 9:45 pm on sunday and was seated right away. I told the waiter that I was a vegetarian and he recommended the roasted cauliflower salad and the charred sweet potatoes. My favorite was the roasted cauliflower. It's such a refreshing salad, a myriad of flavors burst in your mouth with each bite. The charred sweet potatoes were really good too. It was a little salty but I didn't mind it too much. I am definitely going back to try their other vegetarian options!

Love this place! Food is just amazing! You have to try chicken liver crostini and chorizo-stuffed medjool dates!! Mouth-watering! FYI they don't take reservations! They get really busy on Saturdays... But it is really worth it to wait!

A place that doesn't take reservations is always hyped up. Expecting to wait, we came in and put our names down and then headed next door to Salero for some cocktails. We waited about 45-1hr and were seated at the end of one of the communal tables. I don't know that I like this way of dining, especially when it's a nicer spot and not say, a sandwich place. We had an unruly group of people next to us that were several cocktails in when we got there, and then still ordering drinks when we left. The whole time they were yelling, laughing at crazy volumes. I should state the men were the ooc ones, the ladies with them were well mannered. We order a mix of plates - we didn't the infamous dates - might have to grab em at some point. Since we love meat, we had the lamb, pork shoulder, steak and then a fish pate to get some variety. Also had a wine. Everything was good and the pork was outstanding. We had more than enough left and took some pork to go. We liked the food but I don't know that it's one is the best dining experiences I've had in Chicago. Still happy that we tried it as its right near our home. Worth a try and maybe you'll get a more tame group next to you!

The food was pretty good (small plates) and I had really good service. Sat at the same table as another couple visiting Chicago. We all really enjoyed our food, but nothing really stood out to me. I would go back if friends wanted to go.

SO. GOOD. The most sophisticated party for your taste buds!  I'm a vegetarian, but having options was not a problem at all. Our waitress recommended a bunch of great things: 1) Royal Jamaican - Ginger beer [$5] -- On the (much) sweeter side with a strong ginger taste,  but a pretty solid drink if you have a thing for ginger.  2) Charred corn - tabbouleh with peach, freekeh, parsely, radish, olive and tahini [$12] --  FREEKEHN GREAT. It is enough for two people probably, but I sneakily pecked at it all night long, till it was gone. Smoked, spiced, and seasoned just right.  3) Burrata Pizza - with charred eggplant, cherry tomato confit, basil, and calabrian chili honey [$18] -- Heaven....Is it sweet? Is it savory? Is it spicy? Is it herby? Is it soft? Is it crispy? Is it awesome? YES, to all of the above. I used to be an Eduardo's Enoteca pizza fanatic....but I think this one has won me over! 4) Chorizo-stuffed medjool dates with bacon and piquillo pepper-tomato sauce [$14] -- My brother, who loves his meat, got this...Couldn't stop raving about it the whole time he was eating it and saying "you wish you weren't a vegetarian right now" ...He finished the whole thing..alone.... Having stuffed our faces, we didn't have room for dessert, but it definitely looked good. So maybe just share a bunch of little portions and then end with something sweet, because chances are, its probably amazing!  One little thing - You do get seated really close to each other, enough to have the side of your arms touching the person next to you sometimes. But it's loud enough for you and your party to have your own conversation (perhaps having to lean in and repeat yourself a few times to hard of hearing people like me). Overall, the crowd is friendly, the service is solid, and the overall ambiance is perfect for essentially any event.  Definitely worth a 2nd trip (and maybe a 3rd, 4th, and 5th too).

Love going to Avec with my friends. usually difficult to get seated but we enjoy wine while waiting for a seat. It is pescatarian friendly which is important for me. Menu changes enough for us to try new things here. Go as a party of 3 or 4 to get the best experience.

Food was good. I love eclectic flavor combinations. This place was creative. The braised pork shoulder was a huge portion. I took home leftovers and at it in the morning with a couple poached eggs on top. The overall meal wasnt mind blowing, but still good. I heard it was a Chicago staple, so i had to give it a try!

Love this place! Went here for dinner w/ a friend before she left Chicago, and I had been wanting to dine here so I'm glad she picked this spot. We came on Thursday night around 7 and the place was packed, but we were lucky enough to grab a seat immediately at the bar. They have a nice wine list and we settled for a bottle of red from Spain (I forget which). The real star, though, is the food. We got: -Seared trout with red pepper-almond romesco and rock shrimp escabeche: the trout was cooked perfectly and had a great sear. I think this was my first time having a romesco and I definitely loved the sauce and flavor that it added to the dish. -Chorizo-stuffed medjool dates with bacon and piquillo pepper-tomato sauce: THESE ARE CRACK. I really don't know how else to describe them. It had the perfect amount of sweet and savory from the dates and chorizo, respectively. Anytime you have bacon, that's a plus. The sauce compliments the dish very well. Also, I've had bacon-wrapped-anything before, but the way they wrap the bacon here is some sort of witchcraft. Normally, whenever you cut into something wrapped in bacon, the bacon sort of falls apart or falls off whatever it wrapped. The bacon here, however, stayed wrapped tightly around the dates. I know this is a weird thing to get excited about, but it made eating the entire dish easier and not as messy. A must-get! -Slow roasted pork shoulder with piri piri broth, cracked wheat, snow pea, smoked yogurt and clams: tender and packed full of flavor. The yogurt was a great accompaniment to the dish. Also, the clams were a welcome surprise (I don't think I've had pork + clams in the same dish before). Another must-get! It's a pretty lively spot. If you're seated at the tables, you will probably be right up next to a stranger, so be prepared to make friends. It can get pretty loud here, so you definitely won't be having any intimate, quiet conversations here. Also, they don't take reservations, so come in really early or really late, as I've come here before during primetime and was quoted a wait of 2 hours (or...just get lucky like we did and hope to grab a seat by the bar).  Do yourself a favor and dine here. Your taste buds will thank you for it!
First time at Avec and it was amazing! The restaurant is a little small but the food was amazing! Especially the chorizo stuffed dates, wrapped in bacon. Orgasmic!
Loved the small shared plates! The Squid ink pasta, chicken liver and the dates were delicious! Happy Belly!

ATTENTION ALL FOODIES: you have to try this place. Been here over 5 times and always hungry for more! The menu changes frequently, yet I like how some of the classics such as chorizo stuffed dates, focaccia bread, paella, and nutter butters are always available. You can't go wrong with what you order, everything is tasty. I like to be adventurous  and dine at other top restaurants in Chicago, but this place will always be one of my favorites.

Extremely disappointing.  We sat at the far end of the room, which was bad for a few reasons. For starters, the restaurant gets extremely loud and it was next to impossible to have any sort of conversation - I could barely hear our waitress. We also sat directly behind the kitchen and ovens, which meant it was really hot. Finally, we were also sitting right by the entrance to the bathrooms, which is generally unpleasant.  The drink list is sparse (nonexistent?). We had the chorizo-stuffed dates which were greasy and bland. Serrano ham plate was far from special. The only shining light, in my opinion, was the chicken liver crostini.  Our waitress was disinterested and unhelpful.  Big disappointment, especially considering that I love The Publican.

Great vibe. Small communal tables. Sat at the bar and started with the stuffed Marjool Dates. Signature dish and they we yummy. Had the Branzano whole fish and it was tasty though not too much meat. Nice place if you are in Chi-town!
Love this room. Modern & cool. Food awesome. Wine great & all this not expensive. Great value for such quality delicious food.

Avec is a restaurant I've wanted to try for a while now, so what better time than my birthday, right?  Unfortunately, everything there was just okay - nothing really stuck out as memorable. Given the lack of a reservation system, we got there about 5:30 on a beautiful Saturday a few weeks ago.  We were seated right away.  It's definitely not a large place, and there is no outside seating.  What they have outside are more like high tables for a drink while waiting for a table inside. We started with the sangria - which was typical sangria.  We had the  chorizo stuffed dates - which given all the rave reviews, I was expecting much much better.  We also had the whipped brandade - which even though I am not a big fish fan, I went for.  It was a spread that you put on large pieces of garlic bread.  It was pretty good.  The bread is very filling, however.  Keep that in mind.   For our main dish, we got the pork shoulder - which neither my husband nor myself really cared for.  The smoked yogurt on it was really good, but certainly not enough of it.  We ended with the warm raspberry bread pudding - which seemed to be a very popular dish, but again - nothing that was great.  The creme fraiche sort of ruined it for me. In the end, I'm glad I went, but it's not some place I would be back.
We had a wonderful night at Avec! Great service and amazing wine list!

We were lucky to not have to wait for a table (cuz it was pouring that night so I guess everyone stayed in). I really liked the food and feeling of the place. One problem was that we ordered too much, because the waiter explained we should consider 2 small + 1 large dishes per person. Turns out all the "small" plates were actually pretty big and for 3 people 4 small plates + 2 big plates + 1 dessert was too much.  The wine was great for the price, comes in a 250ml caraff and for 11/16$ we got to try two really nice wines - Success! The food:  butchers steak was pretty good, trout was yummy and the stuffed dates were tasty and very large, also liked the chicken liver - very generous dish we couldn't finish it. For mains we had the pork shoulder (big expectations but wasn't my fav) and the squid ink pasta - great flavor. Dessert was blah - bread pudding. Overall a bit expensive but good value, can go for less food next time and the night was fun.
Always amazing--seriously has never disappointed the 5 or so times I've been here.  STRONGLY recommend going for brunch; just don't tell too many people about this commonly unknown aspect.
The bacon wrapped dates will change your life. Get something on the menu and you'll like it. Multiple thumbs up on all fronts for this place.

This was definitely one of the most disappointing dining experiences i've had this year. Everything I ate (with the exception of the bread, I felt I could have cooked better myself and for a fraction of the price. I also found the seating style to be obscene and obnoxious: we were seated in the middle and we finished eating before the party at the end, so two of the three of them had to stand up IN THE MIDDLE OF THEIR MEAL to let us out. I think communal seating can be okay when you're in the mood for it, but not like this...you should be able to get up without disrupting an entire table. Here's what we ate:  Chicken Liver Crostini: This was the first thing they brought to the table. It took them 30 minutes (which was confusing because it's clear that they had the liver pate sitting in the fridge and just spooned it into the container they served it in...there's no reason it should have taken that long, especially considering that they brought the second dish out (a hot one) 5 minutes after we started eating that one. This was pretty good. If you like chicken liver you will appreciate this...but it wasn't exceptional Brandade: This was the second dish that was served. This was decent but WAY too salty (they buttered the bread with salted butter and then generously seasoned the fish as well. Trout with shrimp:  The trout was cooked very well, but the shrimp were not good...the quality just did not seem good (maybe farmed and previously frozen). Pork Shoulder: This had to be the biggest culinary disappointment of the night. The conceptualization of this dish was ridiculous: Pork with clams in a salty broth covered in creamy yogurt sitting in "cracked wheat" that is soaking in the broth. WHY? I would definitely avoid this one. Amaretto Cake with Peaches:  This was okay, but it did not seem fresh...we agreed that it must have been sitting in the fridge for hours (not in a good way...like, maybe hours was actually days).  The Alcoholic Ginger beer was excellent (it's bottled, not something they make in house); I thought the cucumber cocktail was not good, but my boyfriend liked it (I would only recommend it if you really really love artificial cucumber flavor). I've given this 3 stars because I think the technique was there, but the flavors, execution, and concept are are not great. P. S. they put a ton of raw parsley on EVERY DISH with the exception of the cake.

I have been here a couple of times and amazing experience each time.  For a party of two around 10:00P on Friday and Saturday, the wait was around ten minutes each time, with cocktails in hands.    The most recent visit we had the charred corn, butcher's steak, marinated olives and paella.  The small plates were quite voluptuous, a pleasant surprise.  The paella was not the traditional Valencia, different and delicious.  The blood sausages in the paella...not necessary.  Due to the fact that the small plates were generous, we could have easily forgo the paella. We did not go crazy with our cocktails and ordered from the menu.  I have not had a mediocre cocktail at Avec.   Due to the communal seating, not conducive for a romantic evening if you are hoping to end the night with your own desserts.

A lot of our friends recommended this place for our one night dinner. My boyfriend and I got some greens, bacon wrap dates and pork shoulder! Everything was so tasty and pork shoulder was my favorite! It is a huge potion! It can be noisy and cramped (shared seating at long tables) but we had a good experience.
Perfection. They just made another regular. Two things you must try: bacon-wrapped dates and deluxe focaccia. Your taste buds will rejoice.

I'm not sure why but this place is not what it used to be. The chorizo dates are still fantastic but everything else was fairly average. We ordered about  seven or eight dishes between 4 of us and were left parched with thirst from the amount of salt in the food. Disappointed...

I went for a weekday lunch interview, and the place was half full. It gets packed for later lunches, I believe. The service was good. The food was great. The heavy, backless seats are tiring, but the food is worth it. My coworkers had the avec burger, and I had the trout tartine. They really enjoyed it. Mine was colorful and juicy and delicious. The chips are salty for my taste and not too special. The butter butters we split for dessert were very good. Recommended. Must return for dinner.
