Prior to traveling from Los Angeles, I knew Avec would be on my list of dinners while in town.  What an absolute devine experience. Yes the chorizo dates are fab. So was the charred corn and special summer salad and sangria.  Can't wait for bragging rights to my friends back in Cali

Had an amazing dinner here with my husband on our 10th anniversary. Without a reservation, we walked up at 6pm and were seated immediately. We sat at the bar, overlooking the kitchen, which was very interesting although pretty darn hot, being so close to the woodburning oven. It was fascinating to watch the chefs work and they were very knowledgeable about all of the food they were preparing. We had the chorizo-stuffed dates and they were worth raving about. So sweet, savory & delicious! With a mouth-watering tomato-pepper sauce & crusty, hot, fresh bread to soak it up. The beer selection was minimal but excellent. We also had the cheese plate, a salad & the steak. It would have been 5 stars, but the head chef, who apparently also runs Blackberry (?) next door, showed up (until then the perfectly capable sous-chef was running the show), and nixed our steak when it showed up for delivery. It was sent to the back with the busboys. Because of this we waited an especially long time for our last plate and were hot and frustrated when it finally arrived. It was delicious, of course.

Chorizo stuffed dates are one of the best things on the menu. They are heavenly! But also, don´t skip the trout, the gyro sausage and the eggplant pizza. Oh, and order sangria by all means! :) I will definitely come back soon.  On a side note, we (a party of three) ordered a bunch of food, two or three rounds of drinks and it added up to $45 each (including tip). I thought that was awesome for the quality of the food and beverages.

Went there for brunch on a Sunday afternoon - food - I had the French toast and the steak. Also ordered coffee. Was I impressed ? Not really. The French toast was dry and the steak was too. The hummus that came with the steak was salty. They do allow for half orders so that's a positive. I hate getting large portion sizes & not finishing what's on my plate.  Service - Slow. I was served the French toast before the steak. Coffee (intelligentsia) was served l with the steak. I had to call the server to remind him of the coffee.  Ambience - you will be sitting cheek by jowl with other patrons. I saw an argument flare up between two people. Predictably, the manager was called. I wouldn't mind sitting at the bar, but refine your idea of personal space if you want to dine here.    Would I go there again? No.

This place is awesome. We had to wait 45 min to get in initially, but they ended up texting us within 10 min. The ambiance was excellent, casual and trendy. We had three dishes: the chorizo-stuffed dates were really good, serrano ham was a great portion for the price and finally, the paella was perfectly cooked. All in all, this was a great restaurant and will definetly suggest to anyone visiting Chicago.

Avec is a really nice place to meet for great cocktails and food. I was convinced to try Avec by my nephew who lives on a shoestring budget. Let's just say that the beer, food, wine, and dessert were worth every penny. The folks who serve make amazing recommendations. I was wishy washy about pair a white wine with a dish and they came up with not one but three ideas. That means that they have great people to make sure that no one leaves dissatisfied.  I love that they had Galician beer and French wines, and North African-inspired food. A great night all around.

As an out of Towner was so Happy to Find such a cool and delicious brunch spot for a Sunday morning.  Cocktails and food left absolutely nothing to complain about.  The service is so friendly and knowledgable.  Highly recommend to any one visiting Chicago!

There is so many reviews for this place, I am sure just being on the yelp page is overwhelming. WOODEN, UNIQUE AND INTERESTING. The ambiance is really interesting and very trendy of course. Wooden decor top to bottom. GREAT WINE LIST. Some very rare and unusual wines, such as an Israeli Pinot Noir...what? OVERSALTED. I don't know if they are catering to retirees whose taste buds may not be at the peak, but every single dish here was insanely oversalted. Had the bacon wrapped chorizo figs, enjoyed the dish otherwise. The pork entree was massive, enough to feed two people easily.  SMALL SPACE. Keep in mind, this is a very very a small space and not a lot of tables. HOPPING ON A MONDAY NIGHT. I was able to get a seat at the bar, but it was the only one available. It does get busy!

Came here for brunch on Sunday and was shocked that we were seated immediately. It's interesting because they have long tables so you end up sitting next to other people not with your party. I tried the pork belly, poached eggs and french toast. The pork belly was really good! It had the perfect ratio of fat and was just cooked and seasoned to perfection. The french toast was very very moist, almost like a pudding texture. It wasn't really my cup of tea but my friend liked it. The poached eggs were a little bit hard to eat but it was alright, I wasn't the biggest fan of the flavors and the poached egg was not as good as others that I've had, but it wasn't terrible. I will note that they have really good customer service. My friend and I both ordered the poached eggs and ended up having to wait a really long time before we got any updates on them - to the point where everyone else in our group already got and finished their food. After asking them a few times, they finally told me that they had a problem poaching their eggs so they had to go get new eggs and would take both orders of poached eggs off our bill. They also brought us two raspberry pastries on them. I really appreciated this gesture because I know not all restaurants would go to this effort to make it up to you. I'm not super enthusiastic about coming back to avec for brunch but would definitely consider it again for dinner because I've heard great things about their burgers and know that their staff will make sure we have a good experience.

This place is the real deal. The food is absolutely phenomenal and the service is actually the best I've ever seen. The waitstaff is friendly helpful and won't leave your glass empty for one second. Get the brandade as an appetizer. Do it.

Amazing brunch. We did embarrassingly struggle to find the door (it's on the side of the building) but once we got in we were thoroughly impressed. The coddled eggs were our favorite--a delight. We'll be back!
What a fantastic experience. Service was a great and the burger was absolutely amazing. Sweet, salty and perfect textures.
This place is exactly what u want in a quick bite restaurant with friends or alone.  We had the yogurt and pizza.  The bartender and all service staff were extremely nice and welcoming.

Great restaurant, get the stuffed dates. It was on the expensive side but you share everything, so for our group of 6 it came to around $15 a person. The restaurant is small so come early or prepare for a wait.

Hands down one o four faves in the city!  The bacon wrapped dates are to die for and when you order the taleggio focaccia ask for extra red sauce from the dates. The summer fruits salad with aleppo pepper is so flavorful I dream about it. YUM

We've now been here for brunch once (previous review) and dinner once. I'm not really sold on the place. The food has been a mixed bag, ranging from quite good to pretty poor. My wife liked it less than I did too.  I thought the chorizo stuffed dates were very good, as everyone says. The pork shoulder entree was quite good as well. The focaccia bread large plate is very bland, and probably not what you are picturing when you think focaccia. It's two very thin layers, the thickness and crunchiness of a saltine cracker, with cheese in the middle. It tastes like it needs a few extra ingredients to give it some personality. Their Sangria also is lackluster, skip it. Overall the food, for me, was probably a 3.5 or 4 star. I don't care for the environment at all though. It's very small, very crowded, very communal, and very loud. Even on a Tuesday, we were quite literally elbow to elbow between two other parties at a communal table, and were cupping our ears and shouting to hear each other 8 inches away. Just not my style for dinner. And the food, while good, wasn't good enough to make me want to repeat that experience. Still, its a place worth trying.

This is my second time here. The food was so great the first time that it set a very high bar. This time I ordered 3 dishes and I only enjoyed 1 of them. Came here at 6pm and we can sit at the bar without wait. - Chorizo-stuffed medjool dates: I LOVE this dish from the last time. MUST try! - Charred Sepia: I think the chef just put TOO MUCH salt on the sepia. It was so salty. But it helped with the intake of the arugula and watermelon at the same time. It would be a great dish for the summer if the sepia was less salty - Squid ink pasta: The pasta taste TOO fishy. It tasted more fishy than a piece of raw tuna. And I do not like small bones in general. So do not order this dish if you feels the same way. Because the Sardines has a lot of small bones in it.  I am a little disappointed since I got such a great experience last time. But in general this place is a great hangout place for groups or single travelers. People at the bar are very friendly and will give you a lot of good tips.

A group of us from the office went to Avec on a Thursday at 12:15pm.  It was a 30 minute wait for a table so we sat at the bar instead.  From the second we at down, I was immediately uncomfortable.  The restaurant is long and narrow in minimalist decor, with the main "path" right down the middle.  The bar is on one side and tables are on the other.  If you're sitting at the bar, customers and wait staff are always walking by and brushing into you.  It was loud and crowded with communal tables.  This was a major turn off for me but I can see how others would like the social aspect.   For lunch I tried the charred beet tartine and sampled someone else's salmon tartine. The beet dish was just alright but the salmon was amazing.  Cooked perfectly on crispy bread.  I really enjoyed the salmon although there seemed to be a collective feeling among the people I was with, the food was too salty overall. I wouldn't go back because Avec for lunch was pricey without the food or atmosphere being worth it.

I was in Chicago for just a few hours. Came here on the firm recommendation of a local. Avec met and surpassed all expectations! Very friendly and professional staff. Excellent food (gyro sausage for me- It was fabulous). Out of this world customer service. I could not have had a better dinning experience. Go there or miss out. Your choice.  I'd post a photo of the food but I ate it already :)  (FYI this my first review because IT IS THAT OUTSTANDING!!)

This place has been on my must-try list for a very long time. I came here for brunch before but I was not very satisfied with the food. So I decided to come again to try its dinner. The service was great: friendly and quick. But the food was just not good enough to survive the price. For dinner, we ordered salad, medjool dates, paella (half portion), and pork shoulder. Maybe I did not order the correct combination - I feel the sauce of most dishes were somehow similar. I had this problem with its brunch too.  The first bite was good, but I got tired of them really quick.

This place is so overrated. The pork shoulder was so dry that I couldn't finish it. The paella was ok. The chicken liver appetizer was so sour that you could even taste the liver.  The other appetizer wasn't even memorable.

Visiting a friend in the city and came by one of her favorite spots! We called in on a Monday and night and were told a 45 minute wait, but as soon as we arrived we were seated at the bar!  Started off with some delicious rose sangria with blueberries. One serving is enough for about 2 wine glasses. As for the food- incredible. We were a party of 3, and split the stuffed dates, the strawberry salad (they used cherries that day), the steak, and the paella. All items so so original, fresh, and satisfying! Favorite, by far, were the stuffed dates in a pablano pepper tomato sauce. My least favorite dish was the paella (only because I was comparing it to a paella I recently had in Spain.., probably not fair!), but it was a huge portion, perfect to share. I was most impressed by their desserts- my friend I came with us a pastry chef, and she said it was one of her spots in the city for unique deserts. The home made nutter butters come in 4 (size of ice cubes, I'd say) and great to share. although I could have easily finished them on my own...even two orders! We might have gone a bit overboard on dessert, as we also ordered the goat cheese and cookie, as well as the merengue tart. But really...Can you really ever go overboard on dessert?? Needless to say, not a bite was left on our plates from all our meals. I love this place. Price point is amazing for the quality and location of the restaurant. I can't wait til my next visit to Chicago to come back here and try the rest of the menu.

It's like a modern log cabin with wood everywhere! Ceilings, walls, chairs, tables.. everything!! We went right when they opened for lunch on a weekday and were able to get a table right away. We saw that the chorizo stuffed dates were popular but they don't have them for lunch! Bummer! Also, the communal seating is interesting because sometimes you have to get up to make room for people but no biggie! We shared three sandwiches between three people and it was perfect! They even cut them in thirds! We tried the salmon tartine, roasted pork and avec burger. All were good but the burger definitely was the best! We ordered a dessert but it ended up being unavailable so they gave us the homemade nutter butters on the house and it was delicious!! I'll definitely be back for dinner!!

Quick Summary --- Solid fine dining with a breadth of intriguing dishes, delivered in a claustrophobic communal seating attached to a high price tag. No reservations allowed, so make sure you plan for up to an hour of waiting during peak dinner hours. Knowledgeable staff to guide your through their impressive wine offerings. Highly recommended: chorizo-stuffed dates Intro --- Like many reviewers here, Avec had been on my to-try list for a while. Various friends have encouraged for me to try it. The long narrow dining room always intrigued me, and when a friend and I planned to eat at The Publican only to find it reserved for a private party, with Avec in proximity, it was the perfect opportunity to give Avec a shot. Setting --- The dining room is long and quite narrow with a pleasing minimalist aesthetic. There's the bar seating on one side and the table seating on the other separated by a very narrow space to traverse the length of the room. The tables are communal. To be honest, I'm not a big fan of communal seating, at least when it comes to finer dining. It was crowded and loud. My friend was seated at the middle of the table up against the wall, so as we were leaving the table, three other people had to get up and move for him to get out. Honestly, this restaurant commands too high a price for customers to have to deal with that kind of inconvenience. Service --- It was a very busy night, and it seemed like there was only one server. The server seemed stressed and wasn't in the best of moods, but I couldn't blame her. I felt rushed in ordering due to her impatience. On the flip side, she was of great help when I was trying to decide what wine to have. Their list is impressive, and she made a great selection based off of what characteristics I wanted. Not too sure if my request to have the wine be brought out with the first dish was obnoxious, but the wait for the food seemed to be long (and it was) and I didn't want my white wine to be warm by the time the food came out. She was visibly annoyed with the request, and perhaps in hindsight, with how busy they were, it was not the best request to make. The wine, however, was presented by the time we finished dish #2 out of 3. Wasn't too happy about that. Food (for 2) --- (* denotes highly recommended)    Charred octopus with white beans: The lemon lifted up the dish with a piercing (but pleasant) that cut through the savoriness of the octopus and beans. Great char on the octopus, extremely tender and fresh. The hazelnuts were far too large and felt disruptive. Sure it paired well with the nuttiness of endives, but the texture combination of slimy beans, leafy endives, and crunchy hazelnuts was not appreciated.    * Chorizo-stuffed medjool dates: I've had plenty of bacon wrapped dates, but this is by far the greatest of them all. The added spicy and acidic dimensions provided by the chorizo and tomato sauce respectively were in perfect balance with the salty and sweet dimensions of the bacon and dates. It seems from the other reviews here that you can order a half-portion of this? Don't sell yourself short. Get the full portion. No, get five full portions. 10/10 would order again 10 times.    Slow roasted pork shoulder: Huge generous service of pork. Slowly cooked to fork-tender, the meat melted in my mouth. The Brussels sprouts held up their own against the pork and spiced lentils, while the apples added a much needed vibrancy to an otherwise heavy dish. It was delicious, but split between two people, the portion was too much. Other notes --- With the crowded communal setting, this is not a place for an intimate date. The food was overall very good, but not without flaws. With a high price point, I wouldn't necessarily call it a great value. I saw some other large plates being served to those adjacent to us, and they really are large. Between two people, perhaps it would be better to stick to the small plates. Conclusion --- A beautifully designed dining space marred by the almost-claustrophobic seating. Having only tried three dishes, I do think Avec warrants another visit to try the other enticing menu options. However, I would do so at non-peak hours as the service provided by a stressed irate server was less than ideal. The food was great, but a tad overpriced. My overall experience here wasn't poor by any means, but it wasn't great either. Keep in mind this is just my experience from ONE visit, as there are plenty of stellar reviews. It's worth checking out yourself at least once. Grade --- (1* - never come back, 2* - poor, 3* - good, 4* - excellent, 5* - perfect) Avec gets a 3.5*

Ugh I would have gave this place an easy 5 stars if it wasn't for the awful kale pizza we got. To start we had the bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed dates that were amazing. The dates were lukewarm while the tomato sauce it came in was 400 degrees hot (I burnt my mouth so bad because I wasn't expecting it to be so hot from the bite of lukewarm stuffed date I had) which is something they could work on. But still an awesome dish. Then we ordered the kale pizza and the seafood paella. The waitress said the pizza would come out first and we were completely fine with that because that's how we wanted it to be, so we would have the star of the night and the heaviest dish (the paella) at the end. 45 minutes goes by and the paella arrives first. The paella is awesome and even better after we asked for lemon to squeeze on top. So good and such a large serving! They must have forgot about our pizza. The waitress apologized that it was taking long and said it should be out soon. We finished the entire paella (probably took about 20 minutes) and then the pizza finally came out. At this point we were full and decided to try 1 bite and box the rest.  Well let me tell you that 1 bite was awful. It has a green pesto which literally tastes like a ginger-apple-spinach smoothie that was dumped all over the crust. The pesto had such a sweet taste to it and I swear it had hints of ginger. Then it had toasted walnuts which I do not think went well and some sort of white cheese that did not have any flavor at all. Then it had some kale on top which was the only good part of the pizza which is sad to say. I am cringing thinking about that green-smoothie pesto that should have never been on a pizza. So from the taste of the pizza and the way the food came out I knocked it down 2 stars. I wish we would have never ordered the pizza because we definitely did not need it and it caused all the problems.

I have been to Avec on three previous occasions and the food was always excellent and the service was satisfactory. However on my recent visit, the food was again great, but the service strongly detracted from the overall experience.  The maitre'd who seated me just placed the two menues on the counter without the usual 'have a nice dinner'.  The waitress started out OK. I ordered two items and a glass of wine.  About halfway through the meal, it would have been nice if the water glass had been refilled, but that never happened.  I could have used another glass of wine, but the waitress never checked back, not even to ask 'how's the food'.  Then before I was finished with main course item number 2, the cleanup guy came by, took my plate with knife and fork.  I told him that I needed my knife to finish the second course and he said that he would be right back with another one. I never did get another knife, so I finished cutting the entree item with my fork.  The waiteress finally did come by and I said that I might like another glass of wine.  However after over 5 minutes had passed, I just asked for my check.  In a restaurnat with like this one that has really excellent food, I seldom tip less than 18%, but for this meal, 9% seemed sufficient.  I have had far better service at restaurants where the food was not nearly as good.  The staff here seemed distracted or bored and that contributed to the negative experience that I had.  Clearly, the staff needs some serious training in how service should be conducted in what could be a fine restaurant.
When in Chicago do not miss this place small plates of yum is the way to go. Fresh ingredients done right.
Best paella ever! The place is small, so try and get there as early as possible, especially on the weekend! All staff I've encountered have all been incredibly polite and welcoming!

Amazing. Orgasmic. Beautiful. Social. Experience. The menu is one of a kind -you won't have anything that's on this menu any where else. I am a foodie and eat all over the US. Love it here. We had the bacon figs. OMGOMGOMG. Also the pate -YUMYUMYUM. And the cheesepizzathing -it's like a creamy dessert. I think my friends had to roll me out the door as I couldn't stop stuffing my face with "just one more bite...." This is the only place where I was legit-concerned that might die of overeating in one sitting....it's THAT good. I also love their set-up. You're seated with other people, and you can't help but overhear conversations and make new friends. This place attracts great people. We made new friends, and will definitely be back to make more!

Avec had been on my list to try for a while so was pleasantly surprised to find no wait when I walked by on a cold and rainy Friday evening ( thanks crappy Chicago summer!).  The seating is a little claustrophobic, wouldn't be so bad if the wall side didn't require customers tapping fellow diners on the shoulder to let them in/out Food:  - Had the medjool dates but forgot to ask for the half order (no indication on the menu that this is an option) but they were quite good so we *somehow* managed to finish the order (and wiped the bowl clean with the delicious warm bread) - the charred octopus was perfectly prepped and cooked, the beans and citrus added depth and lightness to the dish I really liked - the deluxe focaccia was delish, but super rich (ricotta+truffle oil+butter tends to do that) and large so probably better shared as an app with a group of 3-4 - the tiramisu was good but nothing special A little on the pricey side but has been added to the return list so I can continue making my way through the menu...

Some friends and I stopped by here for lunch which they just recently started serving. Beware that they don't take reservations, so be ready to either wait a period of time to be seated, or go in the off hours to have a faster dining experience.  The food was very tasty. I had the stead sandwhich which was great, and I absolutely loved the ricotta spread they had on it. It was hard to eat as a sandwich, so just keep in mind that you'll likely have to fork and knife it.  The service was just ok. The waitress forgot my drink, and they didn't have the flavor of soda I requested off the menu. Additionally, she was a little slow to get us the check. For dinner, I think the pacing makes sense, but for lunch, I definitely think they could pick it up some.  Overall, delicious and a great spot!

Was really excited to try this place. Its midnight and I'm hungry AND want to get my drink on. We pull up...was able to get seating right away.  Sat down...and realized it was cold as FUK in the place. I mean, uncomfortable cold. I thought it was me until I looked around and EVERYONE had on jackets and sweaters. It's unseasonably cool in Chicago tonight. Its 65 degrees outside. It had to be 50 in that restaurant.  Too much for my old bones!  We had to leave. Maybe another time...
Fun ambiance, and good wait staff. The brussel sprouts salad was tasty but the salmon was awesome. The dessert - crumble was awful, too hard and too tart.

Avec!!! (One of) Chi-town's favorite french. Tried their superb small plates which are perfect for sharing--- bacon wrapped dates (top choice!), charred octopus, roasted salmon, charred beet, serrano ham, and a large plate-- deluxe foccacia.
Delicious. This place was recommended by a foodie fried. I had salmon tartine. Flavorful. Came with side of lentil salad - with touch of mint. Yum.

Decided to try this place after work one day. I have to say I don't see what all the rave reviews are about. Skip this place and head a little more west to Girl & The Goat. If your a party of two you can get seated at the bar or the lounge and the food is sooooooooo much better.

My favorite new Chicago restaurant. Cozy modern atmosphere, wonderful bread straight out of the wood fire oven, and delicious seasonal dishes. Great wine selection and service as well. The chorizo stuffed, bacon wrapped dates are a must-try, but my favorite dishes were the fresh pumpernickel toast with goat cheese, strawberries, and shaved asparagus and the basil apricot semifreddo. Awesome flavor combinations! Will definitely come here again.

Avec is pretty special.  Once you figure how how to get inside (side door on the left, push really hard) it's a long narrow floor plan. Choose to sit at the bar or a table.  Their are extensive wine choices not as reasonably priced (the one recommended to me  was $15 a glass) and some great beer options - I had the Satan Red Ale, 8 bucks & delicious!  It was late and I wasn't starving, so I choose the Brussels sprout salad that had a light  dressing and the thinly shaved, raw Brussels  sprouts were ingenious as a salad! Very good & I would order that again if I find myself at Avec.  I wanted one other dish, but small. The server mentioned a few items that they'd do half orders of - one of those the chorizo stuffed bacon wrapped dates. Done. These were nothing short of amazing. Much better with the chorizo than not, in my opinion, because the dates are so sweet - I'm all about adding more savory. And that piquillo pepper sauce - YES! It was so delicious that I would like to put it on more and more things.  Yelpers didn't steer me wrong on this one. Thanks, you guys!

We went for lunch and were able to walk in and immediately be seated. The butcher steak sandwich was great, although it was on the smaller side. The Avec burger was also great and slightly larger. The nutter butters were fabulous.  Service, on the other hand, left something to be desired. From hitting people on the back with plates to bringing the wrong desserts, I was not impressed by the staff. We'll probably be back, especially since the lunch and dinner menus are different.

The food here is AMAZING! We had dinner at Alinea the night before we came to Avec, and honestly, the food we experienced at Avec was a lot tastier. Portions here are small, like tapas style, but very filling. The restaurant is small, prepare to wait awhile if you come at prime time (we waited about an hour to hour and half). We had our dinner at the bar and the bartending staff were very nice, fast and accommodating. Our bartender provided us with great recommendations on wine, food selections and he was right on about how many plates we should order that would be filling for the two of us. We had a great experience and will definitely stop by the next time we're in Chicago.

Delicious small plates that pack big flavor.  // WAIT // Less than 5 minutes at 9 PM on a weeknight for a party of 2  // AMBIANCE // Prepare to eat in an incredibly narrow restaurant with communal tables where you will sit shoulder to shoulder with other dining patrons.  // FOOD //      + Chorizo stuffed dates: salty, sweet, and savory, all in a cute little package      + pork shoulder: Ridiculously tender hunk of savory meat. Will please the carnivore in you.  Definitely worth a try if you are in Chicago
All four dishes were excellent! Server made our night...he even called Violet Hour and got us in without waiting in line. I'll def come back when I'm in Chitown again!
Hard to get into but worth it. Try facocia bread . So perfect.its amzing place to have date but be careful somebody can pour your wine:)

I came here today for dinner and got the usual....the bacon wrapped dates which were awesome as usual and got the pork shoulder which was very very disappointing. Now I have gotten the pork twice before this and it was amazing but today the sauce was different which they change based on the season apparently....anyways the sauce was way too salty. We also got the paella which was very salty...ugh i thought this place was my favorite restaurant in Chicago but after this visit not so sure any more. By the way, we also got the chicken liver pate which was delicious. Side note...before today I would have rated this place 5 stars.
This place is great.  The food was delicious and the waiter was very helpful.  Great atmosphere, although a little loud.  Overall I can't wait to go back and try some other dishes
I really wanted to like everything that we had and I would have, if... if they didn't put so much frickin salt on everything! Holy crap, I thought I was going to be hypertensive after we left.
Delicious! chicken liver dish is amazing. I'd go back just for that. Simple, clean interior.
Fancy the bacon-wrapped chorizo-stuffed dates and pork shoulder. Enjoy the experience overall.

A majority of my visits have been in the last year or so.  I'd read, heard and seen photos of the awesome which is, Avec, but waited and waited to try it.  Now that I have...  I'll usually include this as a hop during a drink & small plates excursion.   Service has been decent.  Out of three visits, two were stellar and the first wasn't as speedy or friendly, but still alright.   Food and drink were pretty excellent.  The medjool dates is outta this world.  Sweet, spicy and tasty.  Depending on how many you're sharing that plate with, get more bread and dip, dip, dip!  Tried the brandade and can't say that it's been a table winner.  Spiced labneh cheese thing with pomegranates was interesting and tasty.  Butcher's steak and the octopus, both stellar.   Don't allow hype or assumed cost to thwart a trip out to this fine business.  Investigate their website, prices are listed.  Check out Yelp photos or Instagram and go with an idea of the best items to order.  You should enjoy yourself. My first visit out, I was smitten with the food, the booze, the space, the faucet in the Men's room and then while urinating into the toilet I was bobbing my head to some great hip hop music whose tunes were echoing from some unknown destination.  I walked back into the hallway to see where it was coming from and was met by a server headed to the basement.  So, I asked about the hip hop.  He said, "that's the dishwasher, he likes this music."  I asked if I could get the rest of my order down there with that guy.   I couldn't.
SO AMAZING!! Brunch line forms quickly on Sundays though so have to be there super early. The chorizo stuffed dates was so delicious! Everything down to something mundane like pizza was great!

Expensive, uncomfortable, loud, and just ok.  This perhaps has been one of the biggest disappointments of my dining adventures in Chicago.  This is my first time in Avec (will definitely be my last) and I had heard wonderful things about the place. What a disappointment our experience here was.  Firstly, the restaurant is very small, doesn't take reservations, has shared tables and is EXTREMELY noisy! I could barely hear my fiancée and this made conversation difficult and uncomfortable. Furthermore, our table neighbors (seated in our same table and with which I constantly rubbed shoulders) were annoyingly loud.  Food was just OK.  We started by sharing the Serrano Ham platter and started with the wrong foot. Simple, uncreative, boring. No other way to describe it. We followed with the salmon starter and it was an improvement, still nothing impressive. We continued with a whole fish that was actually pretty good! But definitely not worth $42. For desert, we concluded with a cheesecake "with chocolate", which turned out to be a chocolate cheesecake (and I'm not a big fan of chocolate).  Overall, our experience was only ok. I am disappointed because I had heard great things about Avec and there was nothing great about our dinner.  The only "great" thing was the bill: UBER EXPENSIVE and totally not worth it  (and we didn't even order wine).

I'd heard rave reviews of Avec over the years, but had only tried Publican and Blackbird, both great restaurants.  Avec was another level. The atmosphere was fun, although the lighting was too bright (my only complaint).  It's an intimate place that was playing old school hip hop and the waiters were friendly and knowledgeable. I was shocked that a restaurant could pull of a great paella without more time (they'd well thought out the prep).  Too many times restaurant try to pull off soupy rice or just rice with veggies and meat/seafood as paella.  The rice held rich flavor and had a nice level of soccarat (caramelized rice).  The snap peas were possibly the best vegetarian dish I've had.  The salmon had a unique sweet chili glaze that was a whole new way of tasting salmon.  I can't wait to try the rest of the menu.

We were exploring many good restaurants on our trip to Chicago, and this was certainly one of our favorites!  Delicious interesting food in a hip, comfortable setting.  We LOVED the chorizo filled dates.  also enjoyed the octopus, the spread made out of whipped cheese and salted cod.  The paella was also very good ( a bit different from traditional paellas though).  Great food, in a great setting.
Extremely delicious food, great atmosphere. The octopus is out of this world. I also love the cheese flatbread. No reservations, great wine.

Disagree with @EaterChicago on this one. Not an #essential38. #chicago #restaurantreview Ambience: All communal seating. Loud. Difficult to have a conversation.  No reservations, but that can work in your favor. They'll take down your cell number and you can go grab a drink (recommend Maude Liquor Bar - only 0.3 miles away). Food: We had four small plates and dessert. We had the brussels sprouts, the medjool dates, the chicken liver pate, and the other salmon. Brussels were too acidic. Dates and salmons were very salty. And the liver was just okay. Overall, there wasn't a single dish that I would go out of my way to eat again.

I went there for lunch. Waited for around 25 minutes for table. They were busy. It's reasonable. But the waitress didn't take care of us for like 15 minutes after we got the table . We had to ask the waiter for the table next to us to order. And it took FOREVER to get our food. I don't think I would come back. At least not lunch time. The waitress was horrible.

I am confused writing this review. If it weren't for the mishaps, maybe I'd give it an extra star. I wanted to like this more. This was bookmarked for over 2 yrs and I decided to take the bf out here for his birthday. For a Wed evening at 7, the host (initially) said there was no wait but i had to wait for the boy to get here before seating. From the looks of it, tables and bar seats were all full. Then at one moment the host said it would be a 30 min wait but then we were seated about 5 min. Confused but yaay! I guess it was a matter of minutes for some diners to leave.  observations: -picnic seats - very 'communal' seating. You better get comfortable with others next to you. you are seated so close that a 5 ft., 110 lb. person like myself will likely bump elbows with you. This happened 3 times. if you are sitting on the wall side, people have to get out of their seats for you to move in.....interesting. guess it's a great way to maximize revenue.    - you can hear everyone's conversation or lack of conversation next to you. Lucky for us, we can speak another language to give ourselves some privacy. (LOL!) the eh or mishaps: - While I waited for the boy to park the car, I was looking at the wine list and asked for suggestions from the hosts. the bartender(?) nearby suggested something that sounded ok and I told the host I'll try remember it later when I order. She told me "oh I think he'll bring it over to try". which sounded nice as my intention was to buy a bottle with the birthday boy. i had no intention to open a tab and buy a glass right there...but instead they give me full glass...(um....I never actually ordered it). In about 1 min once the bf arrived, I had to close out this "forced" tab since we were going to be seated.  - once we were seated, The BF asked the waitress for a glass (just the empty glass) to share the "forced" glass of wine I was having. we thought we'll order a different wine later. She even asked if we wanted just the glass...instead we end up getting a second full glass of the same wine. So the idea to buy a bottle was not happening and the idea to try something different didn't happen either.  - Dessert mishap? - see below Food: - The chorizo-stuffed medjool dates were great. the chorizo had a good kick. these are stuffed well. thanks to fellow yelpers, I took the idea to get a half order, which allowed us to try more items - the octopus was tasty - it was just a small slab over a bed of white beans. looking at the menu prices....this wasn't that worth it. maybe it was a good 4 small bites to savor. - the salmon - was decently portioned and tasty.  - the slow roasted pork shoulder - (very popular item but...) it didn't live up to the hype much.  this last dish was a heavy stew of brussel sprouts and lentils. the pork was very tender no doubt. waitress was nice enough to provide a small half portion of bread since it didn't come with anything. rice would be a nice compliment. anyways it made great leftovers for lunch that was envied by my coworkers today. it was a bit salty and just heavy compared to the seafood dishes obviously.  - praline cheesecake: this came out with a candle on top as we told the waitress that it was the boy's birthday. it was just okay...but i was so full to enjoy it much. I was hoping a place like AVEC would have taken this off the check as a birthday courtesy...maybe it was my bad to assume but they didn't. Maybe I'd come back if I someone else wanted to try it and there happened to be no wait but otherwise there are plenty of other places to try.

What they do with vegetables is transformative. The charred snap peas with grain dish is worthy of bended knee. Still love the bacon wrapped dates. If your not here by 6 forget it and they do not do take out. We had a great dinner but the speed of service made me think they could accommodate more if they picked up the pace.  Pork next time. It was on every table as I left.

This place was on our list of restaurants to go to while in Chicago so we felt like we had to do it in order to complete our trip.  I just wished I came here while hungrier and not sick of food. We came here during our last night, after a full day of eating gyros, white castles, hot dogs, popcorn and filling our stomachs with booze. I felt like I had just competed in a food eating competition and that the buttons on my jeans would pop off any minute. We pretty much ordered the entire menu and although I was in a drunken and food comatose state, I could tell that all the dishes were superb. My favorite was the chorizo filled dates wrapped with bacon. An amazing dish of sweet and savory. The octopus, pork shoulder, pate and paella were also to die for. All in all a great restaurant and I will definitely be back under better conditions. My overall impression of Chicago is that the food scene is one of the best in the U.S. Even gives SF a run for its money. I ate very well on my trip and pretty sure my cholesterol is in a dangerous place. My liver pretty much turned to foie gras after this trip.
Probably my favorite place in Chicago. And they have fat pug the best beer I've ever had

Its a nice small restaurant, goes very busy during dinner time but its worth waiting for it, their focacia bread is awesome never had something like that before, its a little bit noisy but after few drinks u wont mind the noise :)
Rating: 3.5/5. Great restaurant with delicious plates to sample and share, service, clean bathroom, edgy decor in wood, etc. Avec is located near a bar.
Service was amazing. Christine made the whole experience memorable. Every single thing we ate and drank was perfect! Such a cool ambiance. Will definitely come back next time I'm in Chicago!

It hurts me to write this. I'd been wanting to go here for months. Like ever since I heard Avec existed. It's been bookmarked on my Yelp forever. I'd been waiting for the right time because they don't take reservations and I didn't want to wait forever.  So three of us went on a Wednesday night around 7:30 and were seated right away. Yay! Awesome! We ordered. First come the chorizo stuffed dates. Basically giant bacon wrapped dates the size of meatballs.  Were they good? Yes. But they're bacon wrapped dates. No better or worse than any others I've had at other tapas places. Slightly different texture but not that great.  Then the serrano ham. This was freaking awesome. The ham is so thinly cut and creamy but not too salty. On top of it is super thinly sliced pears (I believe), arugula, peas.. idk what else just awesomeness. I loved this. This was amazing and hands down my favorite dish, but honestly the competition wasn't that strong.  Next came the focaccia. It was good but surprisingly bland. Disappointingly bland. I love truffle anything so I kind of had high hopes for this and I just expected a lot more flavor.  The paella came after and it was good but I realized I'm not a huge paella fan (crazy right.. not the paella's fault).  The sausage in the paella was creamy melt in your mouth goodness.  And finally we also had the whipped brandade which was tasty but after a while the garlic gets really strong.  It was good but nothing unique.  That's kind of how I felt about a lot of this: good but not as amazing as it was hyped up to be and the focaccia really was on the bland side. The serrano ham was the only thing that stuck out. A unique combination of flavors that were amazing. Finally, we had dessert. The chocolate cheesecake and gelato.  The cheesecake was good but not very rich. In a good way, it seemed less dense but maybe it was still a huge calorie bomb like regular cheesecake. I liked it but it wasn't actually that cheesecake-y.  The gelato that night was burnt honey gelato. Holy hell that was good. Super rich and creamy and the flavor was unique. My two friends and I are all foodies. One thought the meal was great (4 star worth), the other thought it was just ok (3 star worth) so 2/3 of us were unimpressed. I would not go here again given that I know so many other places in the city are so much more amazing. Also be ready to rub elbows with your neighbors given the table set up. Which would be fine but you might make people mad if you have to go to the bathroom multiple times.

The food was amazing, especially the butcher's steak.  If I could rate the patrons, I would give this place one star; we were seated in the middle of a table with yelling women on either end, it was so loud my husband and I could barely speak to each other during the entire meal.  Our waitress was great, but she could also barely hear us.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while and finally got the chance on my most recent visit to Chicago. The restaurant itself is small but cute, bustling, and trendy-- Be prepared to sit at a community table and overhear all the interesting conversation happening between your accompanying dinner-mates.  To my left was a first date (awkward) and to my right was maybe a second or third date?  A first date encounter after being friends?  (Less awkward.)  Also be prepared to have to interrupt people when you need to pee if you're sitting in the middle.   The food was pretty great.  We had the highly recommended chorizo-stuffed dates (very good, a little too salty), the focaccia (not what I expected; also good, but too much for two to eat and not enough truffle oil!), and the squid-ink pasta (tasty, but do not get this dish if you do not like the taste of anchovy.. very heavy anchovy flavor).  We ended the night with a strawberry-rhubarb crumble (good, but standard and nothing special) and the homemade nutter butters (preferred this to the crumble; pretty good!). Overall, a tasty meal and a place I can see myself visiting again.  :)  Definitely give it a try if you're in the Chicago area!

Avec was on my list of restaurants to check out for a while. Upon walking in, I found the seating arrangement a little cumbersome. There were wooden tables and long booth benches, which made it difficult to get in and out once I had been seated. I kept apologizing to the couple next to me.  I had the chorizo stuffed dates, lamb neck, and something not memorable for dessert. I thought the dates were overrated. The lamb neck was good, but didn't make the trip to Avec worthwhile. My friend had a miserable experience because they apparently ran out of everything he wanted to order, which included steak and pork shoulder. They didn't even have the ice cream he wanted for dessert, which was odd because the waiter raved about the ice cream and then came back to inform us that we couldn't have it. To be honest, I don't even remember what he ended up eating for dinner, but I do remember that he wasn't very pleased. Suffice to say, I felt that Avec was a lot of hype with poor follow through. I don't really have a strong desire to go back, but I suppose I wouldn't be completely opposed to giving it another try... If there was no place else to go...

I love when I'm thinking the words as I'm eating and then it's expressed by our waiter!  Marcus is as important as the mint and tiny bite of Dill mixed in our entrée.  It's like a bit museum and theatre infused dining experience.  It's something magical and special happening inside a simple light wood, narrow space and in my mind.  I'm thankful for the full but small bites I experienced this evening.  I hope to taste again!

I've had this Avec on my radar for a long time and finally came in on an early Sunday evening and got seated right away. I'd imagine that getting a table would be a lot more difficult on a Friday or Saturday night as there are no reservations. The style inside is really unique. There is just one row of tables on one side and barstools on the other. Wood goes from the floor to the ceiling and it just looks really sleek and modern inside.   For the two of us we got two small plates and two large.  We probably could have gotten away with one less plate but we got great leftovers.  So we went with chorizo dates, foccacia, burrata pizza and the butchers steak.  The dates were amazing as everyone seems to recommend.  The foccacia is something I would drive into the city just to order for takeout if I could.  The steak was good but it wasn't special.  The burrata pizza was some of the best pizza I've had in a while too.  The crust was super thin in the middle and toppings worked really well together.   Avec is worth the hype.  I would definitely go again.

We ate at Avec and it was so good.  There were many patrons but it is a very small restaurant.  We got the salad, roasted salmon, and the chorizo-stuffed mesh oil dates, paella, and the pork shoulder.  The dates were the best!  The wait times were a bit slow but it was a busy night for them.  All of the dishes were excellent.  I recommend arriving early because the restaurant gets very busy.

Bacon-wrapped chorizo dates...OMG! We didn't think there was anything better there until we got their Focaccia flatbread! Holy crap! What a unique dish! I am a sucker for truffles and cheese so I knew it was going to be a winner...but it was even better than I imagined - and it tasted great as left overs! Speaking of leftovers, my only complaint is that the portions are too big. For a "tapas" style restaurant, you want to be able to try a lot. You can maybe have 2 small plates a piece, maybe. But you the main dishes are HUGE! So, realistically in order to try a lot, you have to be prepared to bring a lot home. Everything we ordered reheated well, so we were fine with that, however if they could just serve smaller portions, that would be better!

Fantastic. Really well done. We had the poached eggs on Olive bread and the medjool dates stuffed with chorizo and wrapped in bacon. Great texture and complimenting flavors. Topped with a bourbon Bloody Mary and we left with a beautiful taste in our mouths

Very trendy place. The menu is pretty awesome and the cocktails are good. The food was outstanding. The salmon is fresh and flavorful. Good balance of spices. The pork shoulder is tasty. The foccacia is really interesting, where I never knew that it could be think like a cracker. Downside is that the cream also had truffle oil. However I would come back again. It is a little pricey.

Visited Avec with a friend Tuesday night around 7:30PM, and we were able to grab seats at the bar right away. I was so excited to check the place out since I've heard so many great things about their food. We ordered: 1) Chorizo stuffed dates 2) Focaccia with truffle oil  3) Pork Shoulder  4) Cheesecake for dessert Honestly...I wanted to love it...but I didn't. I was not into the focaccia at all - too much truffle oil in my opinion. The chorizo stuffed dates were just okay - I expected them to be mind blowing according to other reviews. I did enjoy the pork shoulder and the cheesecake though. All in all, a very mediocre experience at Avec. Maybe we ordered the wrong things - not really sure what happened. OH - I do want to mention that the service was excellent though. Everyone we encountered was really on point, which I really appreciated.

My GF at the time was a heck of a chef and enjoyed fine dining. Me personally, I could care less but hey whatever the woman wants right? A respectable friend of mine recommended this place as a good choice to take her since she can appreciate spices and delicacies. Yea...she didn't understand the hype lol and neither did I so there you have it, a simpleton like me wasn't impressed and neither was a "fine dining" gal like her.  We had the skirt steak dish, the poultry on rice, and a cheese cake for the dessert(Recommended by the server)....eeeeh whatever. Small portions I guess fit the whole "fine dining" gig but the taste wasn't captivating enough to warrant so. The seating is wooden benches where if crowded i can imagine can have you in another party's affairs for better or worse. It does give Avec a distinct look so respect to that. Luckily when we came it was vacant. Haven't been since the first visit and don't see myself going again. I'm sure she'd venture to say the same.

Dined here on Saturday and had a great experience!  I had always shied away because of the no reservation policy and communal seating set up, but both weren't an issue and I will definitely be back!  My husband and I decided to split 5 small plates and it was definitely too much food but we couldn't help ourselves!  Standouts were the whipped brandade, chicken liver crostini, and roasted cauliflower.  Excited to return to try some of the large plates and great wine selection.

The pork shoulder is truly phenomenal. So tender, flavorful, perfect. I visited avec a while ago, but they used to have a small plate of zesty, pesto shrimp, and it was my absolute favorite. They change their menu frequently but the favorites (like bacon wrapped dates, pork shoulder) do not change. You can always try something new or go with their classics. Everything is amazing!

Food is astounding. Got the cauliflower, salmon, flatbread, bacon wrapped dates, and the pork shoulder. So good, food was to die for. Beautiful ambiance with the wood on the walls, and prompt service. One of the coolest joints in Chicago, don't miss out!

Overpriced food and trendy place to dine. Came in because we couldn't get a reservation in girl and the goat. You have to sit literally on the same table with other groups.  Food was too heavy on sauce and you lose the fresh taste in the ingredients. Would not come back again.

My beau and I went to Avec on a Friday night--we showed up around 8:45 and only had to wait about 30 minutes for a table. Diners were dressed a lot more casually than I expected to see here. Like others have mentioned, if you enjoy personal space while dining, Avec may not be the place for you--communal dining in a very small restaurant may make some uncomfortable.  We ordered 2 small plates and 2 large plates (and dessert)--no regrets! We left feeling very satisfied.  The squid ink pasta arrived first, which I wish had come later in the meal. I'm a huge fan of squid ink pasta, and this did not disappoint. The sardines added a nice saltiness while the fennel and lemon provided a nice balance to the dish. The textures were also perfect together.  Next, we received the charred octopus. This dish was another hit! It included 2 large pieces of octopus, which were perfect since this was defined as a small plate. The octopus was cooked great, too. The char mixed great with the "sauce" it came with.  Deluxe focaccia was next in the lineup--this is a must try! I was apprehensive to order something as plain as focaccia at dinner, but I'm happy I was convinced otherwise. I'd also suggest asking for honey with this dish. The sweetness of the honey balances the saltiness of the bread and cheese.  The chorizo stuffed dates were our final course. Just like everyone has said, you must try them! The dates were much larger than I expected, but you definitely get a good amount of food for your money! We also ordered Avec's take on Nutter Butters for dessert--they were so cheap and a perfect end to the meal! I think they were $3 or $4, and we recieved 4 little squares of what tasted exactly like a Nutter Butter. If you're looking for a sweet bite to end your meal, this is a great option.  Our bill was a lot cheaper than I expected--we also got a bottle of wine in addition to the above and spent about $125 before tip!

I love coming to Avec. I've been here twice and both times the food and the service is awesome.  I'm not a huge wino or wine person so I usually ask the bartender for their suggestions.  Both times the bottles of wine that were suggested were not only great tasting, it paired well with the food and reasonably priced.  They even offer get you another bottle of their recommendation does not fit your taste.  Btw the wine list here is HUGE so you shouldn't have any problems finding something you like.  As for the food we always get the bacon wrapped chorizo dates every time, they are just so good.  The sweet dates combined with the savory-ness of the bacon and chorizo is delicious and also pretty filling because they come in sets of four with bread. The restaurant itself is beautifully designed, it has that simple modern high end Swedish Ikea feel to it.  Everything is made of the same beautiful wood throughout the place.

This restaurant is kinda a small and a little tight in space but not to the point where you can't sit down or have to move a table out to go use the washroom. I went with a couple of people and we order brunch food. I have to say the food was phenomenal and I enjoy it so much along with my mimosa. The waiter we had was very attentive to our needs and he apologize right away feeling bad in giving our check already knowing we didn't get our last dish yet. The restaurant was pack and we didn't have to wait that long to be seated. The decor is of the place is nice with a nice ambiance. I would definitely go back to this restaurant a bring along some other friends who haven't try the place.

Avec was our final meal before departing Chicago, a last hurrah to the city and snow before we headed back to O'Hara. It's one of many successful restaurants under Paul Kahan, a wine-focused dining space that first opened in 2003. Although the restaurant has received more praise for the eclectic, ever-changing menu that pulls from many different cuisines and genres, it's nonetheless yet another quintessential Chicago restaurant. We arrived on the early end of a weekend brunch, as Avec does not take reservations; thankfully, at the time, there were only a few other parties present, so we were quickly greeted and seated at a table. The dining room is bright, featuring light woodwork, and the single row of dining tables in addition to the bar seating can be deemed minimalistic. It's a clear counter to the diversity of dishes found on their menu, which are small(er) plates, and best when shared. Each is as tempting as the last, and it's not difficult to overorder; three dishes is a good starting point between two people, unless, of course, you have sizable appetites like the two of us. One of the must-order dishes at Avec is the Chorizo-stuffed Medjool Dates. Lovers of the combination of sweet and savory will instantly appreciate this pairing, which consists of plump medjool dates stuffed with diced chorizo and then wrapped in a strip of smoky bacon. The dish is served in a spicy-tart piquillo pepper-tomato sauce, a perfect foil to the flavors, and can thankfully be ordered in a small (2) or large (4) size. We weren't as impressed with the Poached Eggs, which were served on sourdough with 'nduja, a condiment made of spicy, soft pork sausage. Perhaps it was the preserved lemon hollandaise, which tread towards being too acidic, but the pairing of ingredients didn't seem as harmonious. There's also a dish listed as the "Deluxe" Focaccia, a dish that wound up being the equivalent of a flatbread pizza. The focaccia was a commendable texture, simultaneously crisp and doughy, and held a center layer of ricotta. There were a few herbs to add some freshness as well as the all-too familiar drizzle of truffle oil; while delicious, it became rather heavy towards the halfway point. In hindsight, it would be better to serve a smaller portion of it as an appetizer, as it would make a perfect starter for a group. We barely had room for the Slow Roasted Pork Shoulder, a hefty serving of tender pork served in a lentil stew with onions, brussels sprouts, raisins, and a few slices of apple. It was a delicious and well seasoned dish, and ideal for the colder months, especially as the pork shoulder had just the right ratio of lean to fatty meat. I have to commend Avec on delivering a strong dining experience, from the delicious and well-executed food to the thoughtful service. They were kind enough to let us linger after our meal as we tried to figure out our next course of action (limited in scope given the nature of Chicago winters), and if we hadn't had to board a plane that afternoon, I'd have been tempted to return that evening for dinner.

I'm not sure if the food at this place is really mediocre, or if my palate is not sophisticated enough for it, or if we Americans have been exposed to so many clashing quisine that we are willing to give 5 stars to anything that confuses our taste buds and makes us cringe. It truly is a dilemma of flavor when you try to devour the "Braised Lamb Neck With Harissa", it was very salty and the grain (the harissa part) was lumpy, moist and muddy. In addition mounds of white sour creme-like substance made the experience absolutely horrid. Sure, the decor and atmosphere are quite nice and tatted up ladies serving food give a hip sense to the joint but all else aside the food is a flavorless, colorless astronaut powder concentrate.

I enjoyed Avec a lot more in the summertime than in the wintertime. Both times it was just a pit stop en route to a final destination--in the summer, my boyfriend and I shared a porron of sangria on the standing patio outside while waiting for the Girl and the Goat, and in the winter my friends and I lined up at the bar for amaro sours. My main complaint is the limited cocktail menu. The cocktails were SO GOOD and a bartender that talented should be allowed to get really creative because he could probably do a lot. That said, the wine and beer menu is legit. I've never eaten here but the food always looks and smells delicious... Maybe one day. Make more cocktails, please!!

My husband and I have had another great dining experience at Avec. Despite the fact that we live 4 hours away and can only come here a few times a year, people remember us and are always friendly. Of course, my husband and I are a middle aged couple without kids that always travels with small stuffed animals, so we're probably pretty memorable. In addition to everything I have mentioned before, I have a few more tips: Get the PIZZA. Whatever flavor is on the menu for the evening, just get it. You won't be sorry. Perhaps the best pizza I've ever had, better than those I've had in Italy. The TIRAMISU is similarly outstanding, light yet flavorful and delicious. Easily tops any of the other tiramisus I have had in my life.

Am I missing something? Have been here twice and have had over half the menu and the dates are the only thing even worth mentioning... chicken liver crostini is still in my fridge from last weekend because no one touched it; cauliflower and brussels sprouts were good but not that much better than the whole foods hot foods section; paella was overly salty; marrow was unmemorable. To be fair, the food is not bad, just undeserving of 4.5 stars.  The atmosphere here is fantastic and I've always had a good time when eating here. Would definitely come back if others were making plans but wouldn't proactively pick this place

Probably top 10 if we are talking about food quality, creativity, freshness and great concept. Great customer service and nice atmosphere. We had the fish of the day, grilled octopus, cauliflower tabbouleh / salad.  Chocolate Cheesecake and almond tart with homemade ice cream. To drink: a bottle of their txakoli.

I never knew there was Basque food outside of Reno, NV. But if you are lucky enough to find avec, then you must eat the following:  chorizo stuffed dates, paella, and roasted pork.  Hello......is it me you're looking for? These dishes were amazing.   My friend and I shared these three dishes and they were all amazing, lick the plate clean type of dishes.  The dates were stuffed with delicious chorizo and wrapped in crisp bacon. Quite perfect.  The paella was packed with flavor with sausage and shrimp and spiced just right. The pork was slow cooked, a generous portion with a delicious stew like presentation.  All were very good. I would come back for those dates alone. The wine list is varied but don't expect Napa Chards here.  Most of the wine (or maybe all of it) was from France and Spain and the server was more than happy to help me pick the perfect glass.  They also had some mixed drinks and beer, but it didn't seem like a full bar. Service here is very good. It's a small space and there are family style tables or a long bar. We sat at the bar and didn't want for anything. Water filled quickly and servers letting you eat and yet keeping informed of your needs.   Overall, I highly recommend you venture out for avec. It was popping on a Tuesday night, which is a GREAT sign!

We have been to Avec twice - a hit for Sunday brunch and a scrumptious spot for dinner/late night!  It's a community setting and enjoyable if you like meeting new people like I do. Avec offers fantastic sharable small and large plates, so order a few to taste. Memorable dishes we ordered were: Tender Wood Oven Paella with Confit Chicken topped with house-made snail boudin and sunny side-up eggs (I had asked to leave off the Tangerine Aioli) - chicken was so moist and just simply fell off its bones. WOW the snail boudin was delicious! I would suggest getting the half portion paella so that you can try other things from the menu. I really enjoyed the charred and fluffy, saucy rice parts that were seasoned so well.  Slow Roasted Pork Shoulder - I went for and half order as well and it was still an extremely generous portion served in its own crock pot along with lentils, roasted brussels sprouts, and apples.  The pork was tender and pulled apart effortlessly.  It was a bit salty for my likely but it seem to be a hit dish for others.  For the dinner experience - it was nothing less than exceptional - from the seasonal salad, grill salmon, featured sausage dish, to the honorable mention grilled octopus... all of which I would definitely return for.

Arrived around 7, and there was an hour and fifteen minute wait.  Not terrible, so left to go to a nearby bar for a little bit.   Pork shoulder and chorizo dates definitely lived up to the hype!  They are must haves :).  I was a little bit disappointed by the paella though.  And I LOVE paella, so that was a bummer.  Drinks were quite on point.  I had two apples to apples.  Not only because I love the game, but because it tasted good and it was strong.   There were only two of us, so they had us sitting at the bar.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  Oh and Chef Jonathan Waxman was sitting two seats down from me, so that was cool!  And no, I didn't ask to take a picture with him, but I was tempted to!

Another great dining experience in West Loop! Perfect for date night -- just remember that you will be overhearing and be overheard, as people are seated directly next to you in communal tables. That being said, the food:  Chorizo-stuffed Medjool Dates: 4.5/5 -- Nothing special about the bread. Bacon dates themselves were juicy, filled with flavor, and drizzled in tomato sauce. Very well-made.  Walnut Pesto Pizza: 3/5 -- In retrospect should have gone with deluxe focaccia. This was actually recommended by the waitress, but we didn't take the advice. Instead, we sadly looked at our neighbors' plates when their focaccia arrived. It looked excellent.  Squid Ink Pasta: 5/5 -- By far the best part of the meal - never tasted a pasta like this. The sardines, the bread crumbs, everything... Just came together really well. Definitely recommended. Don't make the same mistake as I did. Make sure you go with the deluxe focaccia and the dates. Try the squid ink pasta and you'll have a perfect dinner for two.

Just when you think you've tried most of the best food that Chi Town has to offer........think again. I had heard great things about Avec so we gave it a try on a Thursday night.  The place was just jam packed and I could easily see why.  The ambience at this restaurant is just spectacular; it's almost like the food just comes along for the ride.  Well.....the food's not that bad either. The restaurant isn't for everyone; you are crammed into a really loud place with a whole bunch of people you don't know.  Say hello to communal dining in a really small restaurant.  If you don't like this kind of closeness, this is not the place for  you.  Our hostess told us to cram ourselves between several people already eating.  You find yourselves apologizing to folks who have to stop eating and get up to let you in.  Then you're apologizing profusely again as you somewhat get stuck trying to cram yourself onto one of the long benches.  Oh it was so much fun though. The rule of thumb is two small plates and a large plate for a table of two.  As we found out, even this can be way too much food. There's nothing else that can be said about the chorizo stuffed dates that already hasn't been.  An incredible combination of sweet, meaty, and spicy taste in a phenomenal sauce.  Note this is a "small plate" that really is closer to a "large plate".  There are four stuffed dates on a plate and you're pretty full afterwards but it is oh so worth every bite!! Even if you don't love cauliflower, you will love this dish on the small plates menu.  What gives it the utterly unique twist is the tabbouleh, freekeh, and the tahini.  It's light and flavorful. We ended our main courses with the full order of paella.  This is where the overload kicked in.  It doesn't say so on the menu but you can get a half order of paella and this is what we should have done.  The paella is fantastic and chock full of clams and tangerine aioli.  The only complaint was we would have preferred chicken breast in lieu of the dark meat on bone that is in this dish.  Needless to say a large portion of this dish ended up in a bag to take home.  Left-over paella tasted even better the next day.   Yes we were incredibly full but couldn't resist getting the warm chocolate bread pudding.  This didn't have the wow factor of dinner but perhaps because I'm not a huge fan of cherries.  It was a good finish nonetheless. The service is utterly cool.  Our waitress recomended one of the best white wines I've had in a long time - a portuguese blend MUX that was just superb.  It seemed to be a combination of sauvignon blanc and chardonnay and just out of this world. Can't wait to go back.  Will be ordering less food though.

Came to Avec to celebrate my boo thang's birthday and upon arriving at 6:32pm we were told the wait would be about 47 minutes and we could go have a drink else where and they would text us when it was time to be seated. So seeing how I needed to get to my 10K step goal for the day we walked around and found a bar to drink (water for me) and wait at. About 30 minutes later we got the text that a spot at Avec's bar was awaiting us and we had 10 minutes to get back. Our hungry gave us that Carl Lewis speed we needed to walk/run back 4 blocks. We got back with 2 minutes to spare and was seated at the bar directly in front of the stove which was awesome because we got to interact with the staff and watch all the food be cooked. Everything we ate was truly amazing! Also, the staff was friendly, funny and offered up great recommendations. I will definitely be back coming back to Avec again. If you haven't dined here yet, well you need to ASAP. For our meal we decided to get *Cheese selection: I believe we got Montenebro from  Spain, Comte St. Antoine from France and  Robiola Rochetta from Italia. Each bite of these cheeses had this dairy lover on cloud 9. *Chorizo stuffed Medjool Dates blew my f'ing mind. These dates will good you food dreams that will have you drooling when you wake up. The spiciness of the chorizo paired with the sweetness of the Medjool Dates set my taste buds to dancing and the bacon wrapped around the dates just topped it off perfectly. These are must tries!  *Charred octopus which was so fresh, so flavorful, so good! *Kibbeh Sausage which was pump and juicy.  *Squid Ink Pasta with Sardines was the perfect way course to end our dining experience. I never had sardines before and I'll probably never eat them again...unless the chef at Avec is making them for me.

I had an amazing dinner at Avec and was impressed by the delicious food.  Some highlights included the chorizo stuffed dates, charred octopus and tiramisu. The dates were flavorful and filling; the spicy-sweet combination was so good! The charred octopus was tender and well-seasoned, I just wish there was more of it.  The tiramisu surprised me by how good it was; it was the perfect ending to the meal.  For as busy as they were on a Saturday night, we received excellent service and the food came out at an appropriate pace without any delays.  The only part I didn't like is the seating arrangement.  Personally, I found the seating layout took away from the overall dining experience.

Seriously one of the best meals I ever had in my life. My dinner consisted of the stuffed dates, salmon, and paella. From the first bite, you knew this was going to be something special. Everything from the service, plating, portion, and taste was fantastic. For the price: wow! Extremely affordable for the experience, and a total fan of the restaurant.  The only knock is the communal seating arrangements, but it does give a casual vibe to the place. Must go!

Awesome menu! Of the three dishes we tried - chorizo stuffed medjool dates, Brussels sprouts panzanella and slow-roasted pork shoulder, the first was by far my favorite. The dish comes with 4 and the flavors are explosive. Spicy and hearty. The pork shoulder was also very decent, but I thought it could ease up on the saltiness. Otherwise, the meat was extremely tender and we gobbled it up.  Can't say I'm a fan of the stark layout, but I know it was purposely designed to be this way. Personal preference...

Over 3 years later, this has been my favorite place in Chicago since it opened, and it is so exciting to hear it was rated #1 on Zagat list of top 50 Chicago restaurants. Food is great, service is excellent, attentive, and as good as it possibly can be given the restaurant can be a bit cramped, but the staff is great with suggestions. And, though it is not cheap, for the quality and taste, the price is overly reasonable. This is my birthday go to place, my top recommendation if you could only have one night to eat in Chicago, and I only wish they took reservations so I could go more often without wondering if there is a wait! Go right now and try the sumac salmon. And, always get the foccaccia!

Had a great dinner here on a Sunday night. It was busy but not packed, making for a comfortable environment.  For the record, you literally are sitting at a table with other people. With a couple to one side of us and a group of women to the other side, I felt like I was constantly leaning over the table as far as I could to talk with my date, but it was fine. The waiter gave me the most perfect wine recommendation and I highly recommend it, as well. It was a glass of the Statti, so rich and smooth. Definitely set the tone for a great meal. We ordered: the roasted cauliflower tabbouleh, the sausage, and the chorizo-stuffed dates. Chocolate bread pudding for dessert. The roasted cauliflower tabbouleh was my FAVORITE, it was so delicious. My date's favorite dish was the dates, though they were a bit too spicy for me. We both agreed we could have done without the sausage, it wasn't anything special. Dessert was good, not much more to say about it. My date wanted the chocolate crisps; he has  had them on a previous visit to Avec and said they're great. We will have to try those next time. Still, we had a great dinner and we will most certainly be back!

I don't know much, but one thing I do know is beer.  The food here is excellent.  The wine is good I'm told.  BUT!  hello!?!  Some of the best beer in the entire world is being made IN CHICAGO!!!... less than 10 miles from this place!  The European beer offerings were completely lackluster.  Galicia!?  Really?  That beer is the Bud Light of Spain!  You need more local craft beer, not only because it's simply better than what you currently offer, but it also helps supports a growing local industry.

Avec is a lovely little wine bar and tapas place. Definitely a step above most other wine bars in the city. It's a really small place and doesn't take reservations, so the wait can often be long. The standout dishes were the chorizo-stuffed medjool dates, butcher's steak and the "deluxe" focaccia. The chocolate crips desert was fantastic as well. It also has a great selection of wines, which I'd expect given that it is a wine bar. But the cocktail selection isn't that great.

We counted down the days until Valentine's Day, because we had decided it was the day we would finally go to Avec.  Per other reviewers' recommendations, we got there exactly at 4 pm and it was already PACKED. This was a V-Day anomaly, I believe. Either way, we decided to wait until a bar seat down by the kitchen opened up, which was definitely the right call. The hostesses, who were a bit stressed by the earlier-than-usual flood of people, were perfectly happy to accommodate us and we got the two specialty cocktails while we waited. Note that though there are only 3 cocktails listed on their menu, Avec will happily make you whatever you want. Our waiter made my boyfriend two unique and yummy whiskey cocktails, so just ask. If you're flying solo or with only one other person, I highly suggest waiting for a bar seat. At the tables, you'll be up close and personal with your fellow diners, but at the bar you'll have a bit more privacy and it'll be easier to hear one another. But, I should probably note that the bar has only backless stools (which is the reason my boyfriend's boss says she's "too old" for this place). ` Once we were seated, we ordered the octopus and OF COURSE the bacon wrapped chorizo stuffed dates. These were easily the most tasty dishes we ordered. Even writing about them 3 days later makes my mouth water. Did I mention that I don't eat meat? Well, at Avec I did. These are two must-have dishes--I don't care if you're vegan. Next we ordered Avec's famous focaccia and the half-plate paella with clams and confit chicken. Yes, you can do the half serving of paella even though it is not explicitly stated on the menu. The focaccia is massive but was a tad too salty for my taste. We ended up taking half of it home and, per our waiter's recommendation, ate it for breakfast topped with egg. We decided we probably should have skipped the focaccia for a whole order of paella, which was incredible. The chicken and seafood were perfectly cooked, the rice was moist and sticky, and we literally sat there scrapping the final bits out. However, if you're into salt, crunch, and truffle oil, then by all means, get the focaccia. Then was dessert. Though the bread pudding sounding incredible, we were stuffed so our waiter, the hero, suggested we get the homemade nutter butters. We also ordered the date gelato which was the special for the night. The nutter butters were the perfect little sweet thing for those who like chocolate, peanut butter, and crunch but who are stuffed, as you should be after eating at Avec. The gelato ended up being the most memorable dish of the night--creamy and sweet in your mouth and spicy in the back of your throat. It was a work of culinary art.
