Simple, interesting, beautiful, and deserving of every positive adjective in the English dictionary. If you haven't already been able to tell, our waiter was fantastic. Looking like an ex-frontman of an indie rock band, he was around when we needed him and not around when we didn't (which is great because I cannot stand hover waiters, especially when I'm trying to savor my meal i.e. eat really slowly) and all of his suggestions were on point. Avec was truly a one-of-a-kind experience only deserving of 5 stars. I cannot wait to go back from brunch and lunch and dinner and to bring the whole family.
Two great experiences. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars is the volume. Sitting communal plus the tight space makes an extremely loud evening (but a GREAT meal).

balls out food experience. and i mean that in the classiest way. you can tell a tremendous amount of thought and work went into this place. kudos to everyone who made Avec exist. amongst the top tier restaurants in the city and my fav in the esteemed One Off list of restaurants

Incredible. A must try if in Chicago.  I usually sit at the bar, and the service is very attentive and knowledgable. The Truffle Flatbread pjzza is my favorite; I'll occasionally have random cravings for it and wish I could have it delivered. The Chorizo stuffed dates are also a winner; the sauce is so good and actually combos really well with the Truffle pizza.  They don't take reservations, so there can be a wait, but it's worth it. I also can't get over how reasonable the price is, even including wine. Avec is the standard that I measure I hold other Chicago restaurants, especially for the value.
I am a meat eater and I love this compact restaurant that serves elegant meat dishes: from bacon wrapped dates to grilled pork shoulder! I want to go another time and try something else on the menu!

Best business trip meal ever! Easy to do solo or with a small party. Great service. As I was eating I thought, "Someone should be winning awards for this...it's fantastic!" Salad was memorable and chorizo-stuffed medjool dates...um...need I say more?

Attentive service. Good ambiance. Amazing food! This spot is a gem.  It's like a shot-gun style restaurant that fits at most 50 guests.  We grabbed two seats at the bar/kitchen/back of the house area.  Liberally, they are very efficient in real estate.  Their coffee bar was in the restroom area! Very different, but it works.  We came for lunch and had cobbled eggs, Moroccan wings and pancakes, aioli potatoes, and the best chicken Confit chicken paella.... Ever.  I would suggest getting the half portion paella so that you can try other bites.  Everything was delicious!!

Thank you, Avec, for being everything we wanted you to be. Service- attentive- not pushy, happy to give recommendations. Ambiance- fantastic. Food? Oh my goodness. So great. We had the octopus, dates, pork shoulder, nutter butters, and affogato. Also, some cocktails, wine, bubbly and sherry.  Tip- dunk the nutter butters right into the espresso on the affogato. Do it. You'll be happy. You made my husband's birthday amazing, and we will be coming back for sure!

The food here was amazing, and the small plates make it great to share and try a little of everything!  Service was attentive and the dining experience is casual.  The seating is a little tight, and the prices are steep, but overall, it's a great dining experience, perfect for a date or an informal client meeting.

I kept warning the server I would be yelping about my experience and she didn't seem to care. This place has great edible food and a somewhat un-pretentious wait staff. I recommend ordering the focaccia and eating the paper it comes on. It's great. Don't get the the shrimp pizza, it's hard to eat. Try the shrimp pizza.

food was great! the highlight of my evening was when my adorable, knowledgeable and very patient waiter (wish I would've gotten his name!) brought our table another serving of the house made nutter-butters. the chicken liver pâté is an absolute must.
Really cool, finely prepared, fresh and French (for the most part) One of the great unsung and probably unheard of places that make dining in Chicago a treat GO!!!

Avec is lively, loud and fun. But it didn't blow me away like Gilt Bar the other night. Service was excellent but the food was just okay. They talked me into the date which they said was a specialty- it reminds me of Chicago deep dish pizza and not fine dining flavors. I wouldn't recommend. It also came in a super hot bowl that no one warned me about; I burned 3 fingertips. The chicken liver is beautiful and interesting but you can't eat much of it it is so rich. The Languedoc white wine was nice and presentation for everything was lovely. The salmon was pretty delectable. Crispy, seasoned and tangy. The one thing you should order.  It is a nice place for a drink but nothing about the ambiance makes me want to linger. The lights are too bright and it is chatty and clanky and a bit sterile. Pleasant enough but I don't know that I'll be back with the rest of the city to explore....

The service was terrible, she never asked whether we enjoyed our meal or if we wanted more, beyond that the food recommendations of our waitress were underwhelming.  I only enjoyed the dates.  The waitress didn't even have a wine recommendation.  Never again will I come here.

It is always fun to have tapas with a group of friends, especially when traveling.  There were so many exotic things on the menu. We tried about almost all we could stomach and left feeling happy so this place is really worth the try.  Worth the wait?  Um, I dunno.  This place is teeny tiny.  Super small.  My apartment is bigger than this little popular joint.  But with all small and great places, the demand becomes bigger and boom you have a successful tapas restaurant. Service is great.   Although we waited outside for our party of 4 table, they did offer us to drink in their waiting area.  The man dressed like Mr. Belvedere got our orders and was very accommodating. Once our table was ready, we had a feast.  The highlight to our dining experience was the Chicken Liver Crostini.  I hate liver.  I can't do it.  HOWEVER, I will eat an Avec Chicken Liver Crostini any day, without hesitation.  We were all fighting for the last bites. The pork shoulder got better and better the deeper in the pot you got in.   Everything else was not as memorable. All in all, I do appreciate Avec and will come back for more Chicken Liver.  Service was top notch and I definitely recommend dining here.
Absolutely my favorite restaurant in Chicago. Get the following items: medjool dates butcher's steak pork shoulder foccaccia You won't be dissapointed.

I had heard such amazing things about this place, read so many blogs about the food at this place, and then we finally went here and I couldn't believe how salty some of our dishes were and how average I thought the flavors were! So average 3 stars it is, even though I love the concept of the restaurant and the layout, decor and vibe. The service was also great and so friendly. But the food just didn't quite do it for me... We got the roasted cauliflower dish with radishes and olives and tahini but it didn't taste like much to me other than salt...The brussel sprout panzanella with raisins and cheese  also was on the salty side, and the octopus dish with beans was pretty good but not enough octopus and again still salty! We also got the chorizo stuffed dates that were wrapped in bacon which I loved since they were so rich and full of flavor but others at our table weren't as impressed but the pequillo pepper sauce we mopped up with their really really tasty bread they fire up in their oven. We also used more of that bread with the pork shoulder dish we got that included apples and lentils which was good and pretty flavorful but it didn't seem novel enough to me for such a trend setting restaurant. Their foccacia with talleggio cheese and truffle oil was so addicting though! And we ended with their nutter butters which also were some of the best nutter butter bites ever, so definitely a hit and miss meal for me, but still a great dining out choice that is more affordable than some of the other restaurants near here and we had a great small group dining experience here.

This is by far my favorite restaurant!  I literally dream about the deluxe focaccia and chorizo stuffed dates.  Please don't ever eat here without ordering both of those.  The portions are a great size and everything is reasonable priced.  We bring out-of-towners here all the time and everyone is always just as impressed as we are.   They don't take reservations for small parties, so be prepared to wait.  The good thing is, you can put your name down and go grab drinks somewhere in the neighborhood since they call you when your table is almost ready.  It's well worth the wait!

Always a pleasure to dine here. This is a review of Avec from my experience here in 2013 and 2014. The restaurant is split down the middle with half bar and half table seating. Tried out a few small plates and 1 one of Avec's larger plates. The focaccia bread with cheese is huge-mogous and completely wiped by trying to finish it. The cheese is soft, very flavorful, and there was a hint of truffle. I had high expectations for the chorizo-stuffed dates, but the star of the dish had to be the sauce (fantastic dish, if you are into the savory-sweet dishes).  I would recommend coming here for a happy hour with a few coworkers. When coming after work, a friend from Canada and I were immediately seated. Needless to say, he was very satisfied with the food.

I have been here at least 7 times and find it to be consistently refreshing - brunch, dinner, and dessert. Every time I come, I have managed to get seating within 20 minutes. If I plan well, I don't even have to wait and get to sit comfortably without large crowds around me (tip: around 4pm for dinner, right at 10am for brunch, and after 9pm for late night dessert). I really do like their intimate communal setting which really perpetuates good vibes and good times (socially). I have a lot of favorites off their menu, so here goes. Medjool dates are a must-have for a first visit. Pork shoulder is ah-mazing (they did serve it with couscous about a year ago and I really loved that one). Focaccia has just the perfect flavor of truffle, however the portion is huge - it's either a take home or be-generous-to-your-dining-neighbor-and-share-because-that's-what-communal-tables-are-for  (I've experienced this a few times). The roasted whole fish is divine. I've usually only eaten steamed/roasted whole fishes asian-style, so this was definitely a nice change in spice and flavor. I tried the squid ink spaghetti with oysters one time and found it to be solid, but not a must. Great food keeps you interested throughout your dining experience, but this didn't occur with the squid ink. I would recommend ordering two small plates and one large plate to share between 2 people. Either that or one small plate and two large plates if you're feeling really hungry. I have no complaints with their service and found everything conducted very smoothly. Save room for dessert! I never leave Avec without ordering a sweet plate. Their menu changes often, so you may only have one chance to try what you see on the menu! With that being said, I still daydream about the lavender ice cream they had one time served with a stone fruits cobbler. Serious mouthgasm there. Street parking is pay-to-park and could be a hassle during rush hour times. Late night dining wouldn't be a problem, though, since I believe street parking is free after 9 or 10pm. Metra or green line is a good option - very walkable distance.

I had an absolutely wonderful meal here at Avec! Every single dish was amazing!!! We had a pescetarian with us, so we didn't order many meat dishes. We did get the bacon wrapped dates. OBVI. And then the octopus, which was pretty good too. We decided to try the whole fish special of the day, and I'm actually really glad that we did! I usually don't order any sort of fish dish at any restaurant, but when they prepare it the way they do here, you gotta try it! I definitely want to come back to try some of their other dishes (particularly the meat ones) because I'm sure they would be just as delicious as all the other dishes we had here.

This place is amazing! I always bring friends from out of town to Avec (it never lets me down!). My favorite dishes are the bacon wrapped dates, octopus, and paella. The wait can be long but if you go during off hours, it's not too bad. I went at 7pm on a Tuesday and got in without a wait with a table for 3.

I first heard about Avec a few years ago when Anthony Bourdain had a Chicago spot and he had dinner here with Eric Ripert.  Of the many fine restaurant establishments in Chicago, this was Ripert's favorite place so I had to come here and check out the dishes. I came here for my birthday in September with a friend and had a wonderful waitress go over the wine list with us as we started out with a few starter plates. We had the chorizo stuffed medjool dates which is considered one of the top starter dishes to try and the charred corn tabbouleh. The charred corn tabbouleh was light and fresh.  A nice dish to start and not overwhelm your palate as you move into the chorizo stuffed medjool dates which is complemented nicely with a nice bottle of red wine.  We opted for a rioja since it would complement all the dishes that we would try out that evening. Afterwards, we had the braised lamp neck which was the highlight of the meal.  It was moist, succulent and flavorful.  It didn't give you that heavy feeling after you ate a long meal but it was enough to keep you satisfied. Based on this dinner, I knew I wanted to come back so a few months later, I read many reviews that brunch was also superb and came back with another friend who was in town for the holidays. My friend and I shared two dishes.  She was intrigued by the coddled egg with roasted mushrooms in  a fonduta cream sauce served with a crostini and I ordered the deluxe focaccia with taleggio cheese.  The fonduta was definitely delicious but who abhors cheese? The deluxe focaccia was also amazing and I could eat this endlessly.  Afterwards, my friend had coffee and I ordered a chocolate mocha chai. You can't miss with either dinner or brunch so this is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in the city!  DELICIOUS!
Love Avec  Food is excellent, staff is attentive, and I have never been disappointed!

pure ENERGY. Energetic atmosphere, engaging conversations, great food, good drinks all combined to make Avec one of the best dining experiences I've had.  EVER. SETTING:  Located in a very nondescript building, surely one would not think such a lively dining establishment would exist in such a place.  Approaching the first floor window, looking at all those conversing, laughing, eating and drinking, it's with the utmost certainty that you WILL want to join in the crowds for sure.  At least that's how I felt.   CHECK:  Coat check available as there isn't much space for coats, jackets, etc. within the seating areas. ENTER:  Though the restaurant looked extremely crowded, as the odds seem to be in or favor once more, the hostess informed us we could be seated right away.  And so, we we were seated at one of the many community tables, where six other people were already enjoying food, drink, and good conversation. NOTE:  No reservations.  We called ahead to determine when might be the best time to come down for dinner on a week night.  The advice we were given:  "the earlier the better." FOOD: *Chorizo stuffed medjool dates (with bacon and piquillo pepper tomato sauce):  This dish was quite delicious.  Sweet and spicy pair just right and provide a flavorful combination.  But beware, for those not accustomed to spicey, this dish has a definite "kick" for sure. *Whipped Brandade (with garlic bread and chives):  I absolutely loved this spread.  The whipped salt cod and olive oil finish well together, thus producing a strong dish.  *Slow roasted pork shoulder:  An extremely generous portion served in its own crock pot along with lentils, roasted brussels sprouts, and apples.  The pork is tender and shreds easily.  Mix the entire contents to combine the flavors.  Bon appétit! SERVICE:  Simply phenomenal.  I feel there are no words to truly describe the incredible service we received at Avec, but I'll do my best.  To start, the hostess was very polite and friendly.  She swiftly checked our coats and seated us.  Our (sadly her name escapes my memory) server was just amazing in terms of service and knowledge regarding the food and drink menus.  She definitely played a hand in helping us decide which wines to pair with our meal.  Throughout the evening, she checked on us periodically, engaged us in conversation, made sure the food and drink was satisfactory.  She gained our respect early on thanks to her extensive knowledge with the food menus and wine list, and definitely made our experience all the more enjoyable.  Overall, terrific customer service. SOCIAL:  The absence of social media was evident. Don't expect to see people on their phones checking Facebook or texting.  The food, drink, and conversation are the social aspects of Avec for sure. BOTTOM LINE:  A memorable meal and dining experience in the Windy City.
My taste buds and eyes were in heaven. Every dish was amazing and the design of the space is beautiful and clever. Worth every penny spent! I've been twice and will keep going.

If my wife and I could bring one restaurant home with us, it would be Avec.   Very simple, GO there. Delicious creative food.  Best octopus dish we have ever had, chicken liver mousse and artisan bread were close second best anywhere (edged out by girl and a fig in sonoma.) Taleggio pizza fantastic. This is what is so unique here and people need to appreciate. Bread and certain proteins love a slight char.  Avec seems to not only know this, but perfects it.  I wish more restaurants would follow their lead instead of worrying about customers who think their food is burned.  Bravo Avec.  We can not wait till our next chicago trip. Thank you for great memories.

We decided to give this place a try after seeing it a few times. The servers were friendly and attentive. We ordered a appetizer, and it was so delicious. My entree was a little too salty for my taste.  The white fish was cooked perfectly. It was so tender. We will visit again.

You have to laugh at the where's the door comments in the postings. It is hard to find. The space is tight, but cosy. We sat next to a really nice gaggle of ladies to our left and goofy "foodies" who bragged their son was a chef to our right. It's communal seating so it matters! Everyone raves about the bacon/dates. They were ok, but nothing special. I can't really remember what else we ordered, but compared to food in Philadelphia, NY and even Minneapolis I was not impressed. I would go to Goat and the Girl again instead.

Loveeeeee this place. There was a time I would hop back and forth btw this place and purple pig. I try my best to avoid the wait by coming here a bit either early or late. My friends, the wait can be as long as 2hrs. One thing I always order is the bacon wrapped dates. So... good....  just writing abt it makes me salivate. There was not one thing that I ordered here and was disappointed.

This place is a gem! I've been twice for dinner, and it was as good as it gets.  The plates are small, but not so small that they leave you completely unsatisfied. The chorizo-stuffed dates are to die for. I've also tried the bruschetta and pasta. Both are fantastic. Anybody living in/visiting Chicago needs to try this place!

I talked my friend Dave into coming here so that he could try some Spanish fare. The atmosphere is pretty neat in that it's a community setting and even though this isn't my "thing" it fits the location and was enjoyable. The service was friendly and given the amount of other patrons efficient, in particular the water server - he was "Johnny on the Spot." For the small plate we had the Roasted Salmon which was excellent. The frisee and the Muhammara complemented the Salmon and made it an exceptional dish. For the Large Plate we ordered The Paella - unfortunately the Paella fell short in almost every aspect: The chicken was "rubbery" and flavorless, the Tangerine Aioli made the whole dish taste overly bitter - the rice however, was cooked to perfection.  For Dessert I had the Chocolate Mousse while Dave had the Goat Cheese Cheesecake - both desserts were excellent. While it wasn't the best food I have ever had it was pretty good and the vibrant  atmosphere made for an enjoyable evening. I would definitely come back and try a whole array of small plates.  The next morning I found out that my friend was sick and was up all night - the only difference between what we ate, was that he indulged in the clams and I did not.

This was the very first stop on my Big Chicago Foodie Crawl weekend in mid-Sept and it definitely set the tone to 3 days of great eatin' in the Windy City! :) Straight off the plane on a thurs evening (with a quick stop to drop off luggage at the hotel), I was pretty hungry.  My friend and I had specifically chosen Avec to get our foodie weekend started because of the later kitchen closing time.  The plan was for some small plates and wine, followed by a late-late stop at Pequod's for some Chicago-style deep dish pizza pie :) All three small plates we tried were good, and our wine complemented it all quite well.  We ordered "charred summer squash with shishito peppers, almonds, mint, and pickled feta", "chicken liver crostini with plum mostarda, and a salad of plums, mint, and red onion", and "chorizo-stuffed medjool dates with bacon and piquillo pepper-tomato sauce".  I will definitely be dreaming about those signature dates for a while... yum, yum!  Just be forewarned that we were expecting one or two-bite treats (the waitress said 4 to the plate), but what arrived were the size of large meatballs-- so make sure you plan accordingly! The house bread was warm and grilled, a nice touch. Based on the few things I tried, I can see why Avec made it as #12 on BA's list of 20 Most Important Restaurants in America!  If I lived local, I would definitely be returning here to try even more things off the menu!

***I did not like the brunch dishes at Paul Kahan's well regarded Avec, but the chorizo-stuffed and bacon wrapped dates were delicious and memorable; maybe a return for dinner is needed to experience the best that Avec has to offer*** Avec is part of Paul Kahan's restaurant empire, which also includes Publican and his Michelin-starred fine dining restaurant Blackbird.  Avec is a casual small plates restaurant that reminds me of Los Angeles' AOC (both restaurants have French and Spanish inspired menus, a wood burning oven and a collection of both small and large plates for sharing).  Avec is primarily known for dinner, but it is also open for Sunday brunch. Their Sunday brunch menu is fairly limited when it comes to dinner-like courses.  The brunch menu is comprised mostly of egg dishes and sweets like a wood oven baked French toast and a daily breakfast pastry.  Avec does feature one of their signature small plates (chorizo-stuffed and bacon wrapped medjool dates) and I started with them. The dates were very good.  The date was nicely sweet and was perfectly balanced by a crispy, salty and smoky wrapping of bacon as well as a moist, soft and spicy stuffing of chorizo.  The dates sat on a piquillo pepper-tomato sauce that provided a warm and comforting heat.  The dates also came with very good bread.  The bread was a freshly baked roll that had a crispy and chewy exterior and a soft and airy interior. I was hoping the rest of the courses would live up to those dates, but unfortunately they did not.  The hanger steak was served with bitter radicchio and saba as well as a fried egg.  The hanger steak was moist but too chewy and the beefy flavor was ruined by the too bitter radicchio and the saba, which was too vinegary, too acidic and too sour.  Hanger steak is a cheaper cut and is harder to cook and thus it tends to be chewier than a lot of steak cuts, but I have had much more satisfying preparations of hanger steak at Suzanne Goin's restaurants (Lucques, AOC and Tavern). I ended the brunch with a sweet note--their daily breakfast pastry, which was a salted caramel doughnut.  The doughnut looked great.  It had a sticky salted caramel glaze.  Unfortunately, it did not really taste like a doughnut.  Instead, it tasted like a dense dry bread or a bagel.  It was very bland too and there was too much bread to glaze. Service was very good as the staff was personable and the food came out at a quick pace. Prices were okay.  Almost everything on the menu was $15 and below and the small plates here were quite filling. Avec has a good design.  The room has a narrow and rectangular setup (like a rail train).  This setup along with the two doors to get into the restaurant give the dining room an exclusive feeling.  The room is simple but nice and contemporary with attractive light colored wood. The chorizo stuffed and bacon wrapped dates were very memorable and worthy of Avec's strong reputation.  Unfortunately, I found the rest of the food disappointing.  What I had though were more brunch-like items so maybe a return for dinner is needed to truly experience the best that Avec has to offer. I believe street parking in this area is free.
I don't know, it is good but.. Not so much my type. I don't think it is good enough for four and half stars. For me, it's kind like three and a half.

Decided to give this place a try at the "request" of my wife.  Let me tell you that we very surprised with the quality of food. All I can say is I am glad we came here as I left a happy man.  Small plates are nice to share but the Big plates/dishes were enough to feed four.  We had the chorizo stuffed dates and pork shoulder. The pork shoulder can easily feed four.  Overall, place is a great. Enjoy!

I'm a loyal customer, I believe AVEC it's one of the best spots in the west loop/downtown area. However, tonight service was not as expected. I found a hair in my food and the service was not as usual. Besides the ambiance, food taste was exceptional.  I had better nights at AVEV and I look forward to its usual charming!

Chicago never ceases to amaze me!  Some of the best meals I've ever had have been in Chicago and my dinner at Avec was no exception.  For starters, as an Angeleno, I'm always floored by the ability to just walk in to a restaurant and ask for a table when I'm in another city. In LA, this is unheard of without an eye roll.  In our case, we walked in and were warmly welcomed by the host who offered us the menu to review before we committed.  It wasn't a hard sell as the menu here is deliciously unique and the vibe is sexy! Our server was promptly at our end of the communal table to offer up cocktails and some really good suggestions -- some off the menu, which I love.  I settled on a bourbon cocktail that went down nice and easy and my dining partner went with a moscow mule which was equally nice. We ordered a fab sounding salad that had currants and what tasted like indian spices - it was fantastic!  Then we had the chorizo stuffed dates -WOW - they have a kick!, but they are a wonderful combination of savory, sweet, and the textures and layers just melt in your mouth.  Our last item was a truffle oil focaccia that was crispy and savory and a little on the salty side, which I attribute to the cheese it had inside.  2 of us were not able to eat everything and we were STARVING when we arrived.  The portions aren't incredibly large, but the flavors and textures are so satisfying that you need not over order. The service here was friendly and helpful.  Not overbearing in any way, but you felt welcomed and everyone was attentive and seemed to enjoy what they were doing, it really added to a wonderful dining experience. I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend Avec and hope to return on my next Chitown jaunt!

Great evening at avec. The chorizo stuffed dates more than lived up to the reviews-could have eaten several more - only knock was one small, killer chunk of bread that we reluctantly shared. Charred octopus was excellent - not rubbery and perfectly done. Shawarma sausage with cucumber sauce had the right mix of spicy and cool. Pork shoulder was tender but at little heavy/rich towards the end of the meal. Paella not bad but did not seem to have a good melding of flavors. We all agreed that we preferred the small plates over the large. Black raspberry sorbet and pumpkin bread pudding with salted seeds and coffee ice cream a nice finish.
Only negative is that you cannot set reservations. Their food was very unique and packed with taste . Very quick service . Loved it

Best experience ever! Came for an anniversary -- every waiter on staff came by to congratulate us, the service was absolutely perfect, the food was great and clever... I honestly don't know how it could have been a better night.

I have lived in Chicago for almost a decade and have heard someone mention Avec at least once a week since I moved here.  I see Avec on all kinds of "must" lists.  Not to mention the numerous awards Avec has received.  FINALLY I made my way into this small, smell so good, award winning restaurant and I was not disappointed.   The service is not 'nose up' but rather very friendly and super helpful for first timers.  The Chorizo-stuffed Dates, their signature dish, is pretty fabulous.  Biggest dates ever and the chorizo has a really nice kick.  The Focaccia is a must order.   I want to go back and try the butchers steak and papardalle pasta!

Visited them on a Sunday not knowing they served a brunch  menu. Mostly the dishes I wanted to try based on yelp reviews were not available, but stuffed dates and pork shoulder were. We ordered these and thought were were ok, good even, but nothing spectacular. Came back on a week night hoping to see an expanded menu, but it wasn't what we expected. We ordered several dishes but nothing really stood out. This is evident as I am writing this review about a month after our dining experience and I can't even remember what We ate that night. Service was top notch and the atmosphere was nice and vibrant.

Three words. Oh My God. This place is amazing. The place was hard to find, since they don't have signs. It's definitely worth looking for and the wait in line. Tables here is like sitting at a frat house dinner table, long slabs of wooden table stretched across the length of the restaurant. The food was amazing. Tried the lamb and it blew me away. Menu was not huge and manageable. Portions were healthy. Definitely return and try the pork shoulder next time.
Avec has a great modern atmosphere. Food is great tapas style easily to share for a party of two. They book fast reservations are necessary unless you know the staff here.

If you are looking for a busy, kinda after work place, Avec is the place to go. This place offers communal tables and bar seating which is a great way to meet people and socialize. It is not a private, quite place. The manager was very nice and accommodating . We had a pregnant girl with us and the manager was nice enough and gave us a bigger section . Food was great and flavorful . Defiantly a must try place!!!

How anyone could put anything less than 5 stars I don't understand.  The Chicken Liver Crostini with the fall fruit mostarda  (+ mint and parsley) was divine. I'm pretty picky about my  food experiences and this place was amazing.

While the food here was good (yes the spicy chorizo stuff dates are tasty), the overall experience was more of a one-and-done than a restaurant worth revisiting. The wine selection is quite nice, the wait staff are all friendly, none of the food is outstanding (delicious, just not memorable). Likely the only reason folks are raving about the stuffed dates is because dates (similar to Kale and Pork Belly) are en vogue. Worth a visit, just not multiple.

Came here after being told that Girl and the Goat would be a two hour wait and I am so glad I did!  We were quoted 45m to an hour wait time, but it ended up being closer to 30 minutes.  The restaurant is really small - basically a narrow room with a bar down one side and tables down the other with a walkway in the middle.  Tables were long and communal, but at the same time I didn't feel crowded at all and had room to put my belongings on the bench next to me.   They note that everything here is meant to be shared, but the items were definitely not NYC tapa sized.  We came in wanting to order two apps and two mains, but our waitress kindly explained that would be too much food and we would be better off ordering two apps and one main.  We went with the following: 1) Chorizo-stuffed madjool dates - I've had dates wrapped in other types of meat at other restaurants before, but they all pale in comparison to this dish.  These were SO good and I probably could have eaten all four myself.  I've never seen dates so big, and the sweetness of the date perfectly complimented the savory chorizo.  Do yourself a favor and get this.  If you are with a party of four get two servings because you will want to eat more than one.   2) Whipped brandade - I liked this as well, it was super rich and creamy, so it worked just right with the toasted bread they brought out alongside it.  It came out piping hot and I burned my tongue several times - my own fault - because I'm not patient enough. 3) Slow roasted pork shoulder - we chose this for our large plate and while it was solid, it was my least favorite dish of the night.  The flavors were good (interesting mix of spices and vegetables), but the pork shoulder wasn't as tender as it could have been, and the portion was too overwhelming.   4) Warm pumpkin bread pudding - DELICIOUS.  Sweet but not overwhelmingly so, and came out nice and warm with ice cream on top.  Perfect ending to our meal. In conclusion, GO if you're in Chicago.  Prices were so reasonable as well (~$50 a head with wine, tax and tip).  I definitely plan to be back one day with a larger group so I can try more of their dishes.

They don't take reservations but that's fine.  The communal seating is a bit uncomfortable and limited since the restaurant is so small.  The service was good but the food options were limited and very unique.  It was tapas style so it's better if you order multiple items and share.  I'm not a foodie so I won't comment on the food too much, but overall, it was a nice place to have dinner.

My friends had a great time at this restaurant. It's kind of small, but we went at 5 PM and had no problems getting a seat. The pork shoulder was juicy and tender. The meat was seasoned just right as well. The chorizo covered dates was quickly devoured by the table. The sweetness of the dates complimented the chorizo quite well. Paella was done just right. Rice wasn't too dry and had just the right moisture. I find a lot of paella way too salty for my taste, but this was perfect. I love pate. Pate and bread is pretty much a winning combination for me. Their pate texture was really good, creamy, but not super creamy. It taste great too! Our servers were excellent. Frequently came by to check up on us and give us information on the dishes. Really friendly.

I loved the interior and the vibe but the food was just OK.  The brandade is whipped fish and tastes fishy. Not my thing. The stuffed dates were pretty good.  The chicken liver crostini is fantastic. If you like liver sausage you'll love this.   The pork shoulder is weird tasting and the white meat is dried out, but you get a lot of it. I let four people next to us have it and after they tried it none of them wanted to finish it.  At this price point, with this food, and with no reservations I give it three stars because I have no interest in returning.

I headed to Avec for a late Sunday brunch. When I arrived at 1.30, the place was still bustling with activity. Lucky for my friend and I, two spots in the bar opened up and we managed to grab them. We started out with the Atomium, which is a Belgian beer. If you are into beer (especially pale ale), I highly recommend it. It's flavorful and you can taste the grains. Personally, I love wheat beer - and wheat is one of the six grains in the beer. Unfortunately though, the server took a while to get our beer to us. After 10 minutes, we asked him about it and it slipped his mind. I suppose it's because he was pretty busy, so that was fine with us. We started out with the chorizo-stuffed medjool dates. The dates were wrapped with bacon, served in a dish with piquillo pepper-tomato sauce. The dates do live up to the hype. It was such a flavorful dish, the saltiness of the bacon complemented the sweetness of the dates. It still amazes me that they found such huge dates. The sauce was slightly spicy, and provided a nice kick to the dish. I'll be dreaming of these dates until I return. Next, we had coddled egg with roasted mushrooms. This was topped with bitter greens. My favorite part of the dish was using the garlic crostini on the side (toasted and flavored to perfection) and scooping up the egg and the fonduta.  We finished the meal with the focaccia with taleggio cheese, ricotta, herbs and most importantly, truffle oil. On my first bite, I thought the focaccia seemed a little plain. But after taking a few more bites, the truffle taste started growing and I was addicted to it. The focaccia was also well baked, it was thin and crunchy, but still held up the cheese.  I will definitely be returning to Avec! The food was very impressive, and I can't wait to try everything else on the menu!

High energy, loud, boisterous conversations on communal tables, spurred on by great, unpretentious food and perfectly matched wines.   This is avec. No slight to West Coast yelpers, but at avec, friends and food come before social media and taking pics.  The atmosphere alone will make you feel like a fool for engaging in such trivial matters.    avec  captivates from the start.  It is impossible not to get excited as dishes are placed by your closely seated neighbors.  The aromas, the sights, ahhhh... Straight to it, the food.  All dishes are meant to be shared.  Portion sizes are good.  3-4 dishes should suffice for two diners. The chorizo stuffed medjool dates live up to the hype.  Sweet paired with the right amount of spicy, porky goodness.  The accompanying piquillo pepper tomato sauce adds excellent acidity that perfectly balances the dish and accentuates the natural sweetness of the pork.    The brandade; near perfect.   Peppery olive oil adds a huge richness when whipped with the reconstituted salt cod.  A good dose of raw garlic adds a sulfuric finish that elevates the flavors.   For large plates, props to the slow roasted pork shoulder.   Served in its own "crock" over curried lentils, roasted young Brussels sprouts, dried apricots and apples, this is a winner.   The strong aroma of turmeric and curry spices perfumes the air long before you take the first bite.  The pork; juicy, fall apart tender with just the right amount of residual fat to balance the dish.  Shred the pork shoulder with a fork then mix the entire dish up.  The flavors complement each other perfectly. Short but very well chosen wine list focusing on France, Italy, Portugal, and Spain.  There are NO wines from the US and rightfully so.  Reinvented, old world foods pairing with modern interpretations of old world wines.  Prices are fair with the average bottle at $40. Service friendly, unobtrusive, and Midwest sensible (meaning, if you need to flag someone down, you don't get attitude). Need a reminder why we eat out?  avec awaits.
Chorizo dates, the salmon and bread pudding was amazing! The service was top notch as well.

Summary: FOOD very good;                   ATMOSPHERE: ok, small place, not especially aesthetic                  STAFF: Horrible, possibly worst I have encountered We were very excited about Avec, having read the reviews and seen their website. However, this turned out to be one of the worst experiences ever.  We had dinner reservations at Girl and The Goat later (which was amazing) but wanted to swing by Avec first for a drink and appetizer. It was 5 pm on a Thursday, thinking it would not be too busy. The restaurant was only 3/4 full and there were at least 10 open seats at the bar. The surly hostess informed us if we were not eating dinner, and only sharing small plates, we would have to be prepared to give up our seats at the bar for patrons planning on eating a full meal. I have dined at hundreds of fine upscale restaurants from San Francisco to New York to Paris and have never heard anything like this. So we took our chances and sat down at the bar. We were handed menus without a greeting, sat for at least  10 minutes before the bartender/ waitress came to take our order by her saying "what do you want"? She didn't explain the menu, or ask if we had any questions. She was not very friendly. We ordered two glasses of wine a Portugese red and a Riojo, they were very good but pricey.   We also had the chorizo stuffed dates and I must say they were good. The sweet and spicy sauce they are prepared in is good as well.  We felt rushed however, eating quickly, for fear of getting "kicked out" of our seats. Interestingly, 4 seats at the bar remained empty the entire time we were there. Recently, my wife made the chorizo stuffed dates and duplicated them exactly. So I have to give Avec credit for "inventing" the recipe, however, that was the only thing going for them and we can have them at home now!

Avec used to be one of my favorite restaurants, and I had even featured it on my website. That said, a recent trip was very disappointing. The formerly-amazing chorizo-stuffed bacon wrapped dates were drowned out in a sweet sauce. Some of my other favorite dishes only ok. The focaccia is still outstanding, but the prices still high. This was an unfortunate development...

Insanely good! My favorite place in Chicago. i've had the best bottle of wine there that in a long time and the food was stellar! We had the charred Cauliflower tabouli, muscles, flatbread and lamb neck. Amazing food wine and atmosphere.
This is my favorite restaurant in the city.  Does not disappoint. Ever.  DEEELISH.
Love the vibe - food fun and innovative- we've walked in and met new people tried new combinations or stayed with standards faves like focaccia or pizza.

There isn't much else I can say that the other 1,300+ reviews have not.  This is one of the best places in the city, and it won't break the bank.  Be forwarned though, it is communal seating at two long tables, so don't go here expecting a quiet sit down dinner with only the person/people you are with.

avec is pretty amazing - it reminds me of nights in london hanging out with friends, and it's not the sort of place you get in singapore (we don't seem to have that convival culture). it's a long and narrow restaurant, with a bar counter running the length and diners going all casual and noisy. sharing is the order of the day - and I wanted to eat everything on the menu. but we settled for their: famous chorizo-stuffed medjool dates wrapped with bacon and served with a piquillo pepper-tomato sauce: justifiably famous, these were sweet and salty and delicious, but that tomato sauce really boosted that umami punch. roasted wild salmon chickpeas served on a roasted beet-walnut muhammara (pepper dip) and with lots of tender baby leaves: tender, flaky salmon and another one of those tangy sauces (I just wished there were more greens to liven things up a bit more). charred summer squash with shishito peppers, almonds, mint and pickled feta: a nice antipasti to break up the stronger flavours in the other dishes. hand cut pappardalle with mushroom bolognese, madeira, pine nuts and crescenza cheese: this was hands-down delicious, with a rich mushroom and cheese flavor coating the chewy, perfectly-cooked noodles. a special-of-the-day of muessels in white wine and shallots: a light dish compared to our others, but nice nonetheless.   slow roasted pork shoulder with roasted carrots, oil cured olives, cous cous, mint and ricotta salata: this was, utterly delicious, with tender meat and a fantastic braising liquid. braised lamb neck with harissa, chickpeas, currants,almonds, pickled turnips and orange flower water (I don't eat lamb, so I really couldn't tell you how it was - but it was definitely enjoyed across the table). it's all interesting, exotic, fresh flavors, and a level of cooking that's rather something to behold. definitely worth a visit if you're in town.

Yes. It's as good as advertised. Every fare is exquisite and original. And prices are very decent. One of the better meal you can get in the $40-60 price range in Chicago. They don't take reservations and you sit at communal tables - so you have to be ok with that.

We looked forward to eating at Avec from all we've heard. All the reviews sounded amazing and the pictures looked magnificent. We strolled in late at night around 9 pm. The place itself is pretty small with limited seating. We waited about 10 mins for our table. Based off yelp reviews and pictures, we had an idea of what we wanted to order. But when we sat down and looked over their menu, almost everything was different. Almost all the dishes we wanted they weren't serving anymore. We were already disappointed from the start. We decided to go with the medjool dates, the pork shoulder and the lamb neck. The medjool dates were pretty good and decent sized. I've never seen dates that big before. The dates were a bit too sweet for my liking but the chorizo was delicious and that marinara sauce they have in there went perfect with the bread. We saw pictures of the pork shoulder served with clams, but even their pork shoulder was different. The pork shoulder was very tender from the slow roasting, but the seasonings they had made it taste very herbal and earthy. The lamb neck was also super tender and peeled right off the bone with no effort. However, the lamb neck was extremely gamey. Some people don't like the gamey taste of lamb. I usually love lamb but the gaminess definitely caught me off guard. I did eat it though, but it was the gamiest lamb I've ever had. Overall, the food was just below average to me. The style and taste of the food was just not to my liking despite the fact that each dish was cooked perfectly.  Our dishes were also pretty pricey. Disappointing because we paid quite a bit for dishes we ended up not liking and finishing. However, their service was great. Both the hostess and our waitress were very friendly and helpful. Our waters were constantly refilled and we were checked up on often.

I've been to Avec before and enjoyed it, but this last time I had an underwhelming and unpleasant experience ruined by the service and the inconsistent quality of the food. I think what you order will make a huge difference in your experience, as not all dishes here are created equal.  If you want to be safe, stick to the paella and the pork shoulder. I am a seafood lover and ordered the mussels. When we tasted the mussels, they had an unpleasant odor, as if they had been dead a while before being refrigerated.  When we told our server our concerns, she started to lecture us and went on and on about where they get their mussels from and how they import it and how it was impossible that it was unfresh, and that we "could not get any fresher mussels in Chicago." Well as a matter of fact we've ordered mussels at a dozen other places in Chicago, and none of them smelled the way these did-- unpleasantly unfresh. The server  was very unprofessional.  She even had the cook come over and taste the mussels in front of our face just to prove she was right. That basically ruined our whole experience at Avec and was uncalled for.  Then when we tried to seek out our server to order an additional dish, she kept her back turned to all the tables, sipping a wine at the counter while chatting to coworkers for a good five minutes without turning around. This was on a Saturday night with the place packed. Another dish we did not find up to par was the quail dish.  It was dry and tiny.  We asked if five people could share this dish and was told that it was an adequate size to share.  Unfortunately, the dish was so tiny that not all of us got to try a piece. The schwarma meatball was also mediocre.  Although the paella and pork shoulder were good, the inconsistent quality of the dishes overall and the unprofessional manner of the server was very disappointing. This is another place that allows its trendy popularity to mask what are otherwise serious shortcomings. Let's hope they are addressed.

Honestly the food and service is amazing. The only drawback of this restaurant is that it's absolutely tiny and unbelievably loud. You're either sitting on a bar in the same row as dozens of other people or you're in a tiny table of 6-8 sitting side by side other guests. There is no privacy, definitely not a place to take someone out for a date or romantic restaurant night. The only thing that kept me there and keeps me coming back is the delicious food.

The space is tight, but the food is worth it. I've been to Avec several times for dinner and brunch, and I've yet to meet a dish I didn't like.  The dishes are served as they're ready in a tapas-like manner; they're meant to be shared and sampled. The waiters are knowledgeable, and it's worth seeking their input before you order. In fact, one of the waiters talked me into ordering what is now my favorite item on Avec's brunch menu: coddled eggs (probably the best brunch food I've ever had). If you're going for dinner, I recommend the chorizo-stuffed dates, werp farm greens and whole roasted fish (the texture is like butter, and I mean that in the best way possible). Don't miss the nutter butters for dessert. If you're going for brunch, try a latte, the coddled eggs and the French toast. The eggs are silky and savory with an earthy quality from the mushrooms; they're everything you could want in a brunch dish. If you arrive right around 10, you'll minimize your wait time (they don't take reservations). Avec never lets me down. It's my favorite place to enjoy a relaxed meal with friends.

I've needed to review this place. I went for brunch and although the wait was kind of spotty and inconsistent, I loved the food options! To make it easier for everyone, it's best to order tapas style to share because the food will come in the order the tapas will typically come in. They struggled to bring our various items at similar times so sometimes one person had something and the rest of us watched lol. I enjoy the tapas-style of sharing, but I think they could have done a better job in working to get our orders in a timely fashion.  We went right when brunch started and it was empty. However, that changed so fast as it got packed very quickly! What I got: coddled eggs. Who would have thought that this would be so flavorful and delicious! It comes with roasted mushrooms, taleggio fonduta, bitter greens and garlic crostini. Considered a small plate but still very filling.  I then got the wood oven french toast which comes with some fresh cheese, meyer lemon curd, mint and almonds. It also had some jam that kind of looked like it was some sweetened tomato lol. It was an acquired taste. The syrup was a little bourboney. The flavors were so different but still veyr good. I also got to try the breakfast paella which has chicken confit, snail boudin, eggs and tangerine aioli. The snail boudin was surprisingly good haha. To be honest though, I preferred my first two dishes. These flavors were interesting but I think after eating the french toast, my palate wasn't ready for some chicken and snail. Overall, the experience was very yummy! They offer good cocktails. Yummy place for brunch and I would definitely try it again!

Two of the top five meals I've ever had in my life have been at Avec. Super chic and cozy atmosphere. Top shelf food. Don't pass up on the liver pate or chorizo stuffed dates. A total destination dining spot, not to be missed, when you're in Chicago.

My mouth waters just remembering my dinner here. The chorizo stuffed dates were outstanding! We also had the focaccia bread with cheese which was very tasty also. I'd really recommend trying this place! It's small but the servers try to get you in as quick as possible.

Randolph street is known for terrific food and terrible parking. As the food culture continues to grow west of Halsted it's good to remind yourself what's on the east side of the highway. We popped in to Avec early in the week to avoid the crowds and really had a solid experience. The space is small, the kitchen is open, and the service is just the right amount of attentive. Our waitress knew what's up, and helped steer our selections.  The roasted salmon was perfectly cooked, and served with a tasty muhammara dip/sauce. Great texture plays on this one. I'm not sure what I loved most about the chorizo-stuffed dates. It was the perfect combination of spicy, salty and sweet. The bright red piquillo pepper-tomato sauce was out of this world. SO bright in flavor, it wonderfully soaked into the provided bread. There is a reason Avec is known for this dish. It's perfect. My goal is to someday retire and be able to eat things like this every day. The "butcher's" steak appetizer had a great combination of flavors with crispy fried kale, roasted leeks, blue cheese and anchovy butter. It was served a perfect medium but unfortunately it was just a tough piece of meat. Flavors were great but the execution was a little off. We ended the meal with a REALLY good bite size dessert. The "nutter butters" were described as a gourmet version of a butterfinger without the chocolate. And yup, that's exactly what it tasted like. Salty, crispy and sweet, it was a delightful! In the words of the great Arnold schwarzenegger, I'll be back.

There's not much I'm going to say that hasn't been said already. The service is super friendly. The communal seating is awful and very tight. The place is too loud. It's very hard to have a conversation because you have to talk over each other, and filter out your neighbors. Not a good place for a date.  Food: Medjool dates - very good PEI mussels - just okay Whipped brandade - a little too fishy Butcher's steak - boring and chewy Paella - very little rice that was too burnt and stuck to the pan. A little too greasy, but flavorful. The presentation looked nice though. The food overall was just okay. Maybe it was much better when they first opened. The long lines have kept me away for a while, but I'm glad I finally tried it. I don't think I'll be returning though.

One of the best restaurants in chicago hands down. I am never disappointed. Having been to a lot of Michelen star restaurants throughout the world the food quality of avec ranks up there with the best and the price is still reasonable. Also, the atmosphere is great. Only negative is they do not take reservations so you might need to wait an hour to be seated. However, totally worth the wait. Another great restaurant in the west loop. This area is taking off.

One of my favorite meals in Chicago!! I came here with my husband and a friend for dinner. They don't take reservations, so I was afraid we'd have to wait a long time, but we got lucky and were able to be seated right away!  It's a pretty small restaurant, with one long narrow hallway of tables. Very minimal decor.  The 3 of us shared the following which was the perfect amount of food:  DRINK: PECHE SANGRIA. This was super light, pretty much like peach juice. I could barely taste the wine... CHORIZO-STUFFED MEDJOOL DATES w/ bacon: OMG!!! SOOOO GOOD!! Definitely the best thing on the menu! you MUST GET THIS!! It is perfection. I could have easily eaten a whole order of these by myself. This dish deserves 10 stars on its own. The most perfect blend of savory, sweet, crunchy, soft. YUM! Best dates dish of my life! WHIPPED BRANDADE w/ garlic bread & chives: my 2nd fave dish of the night! I highly recommend this one too! It's a fishy type of spread (salt cod + olive oil), and wow it is amazing when you eat it with the toasted garlic bread. So delish!!   BRUSCHETTA: I believe this is one of their seasonal items not always on the menu. I like bruschetta in general and this one was very good! The tomatoes tasted fresh. A good starter for sharing!  CHARRED CORN: this wasn't anything too special. If you like corn like I do, then you will like this dish. I think this is one of their seasonal items so they may not always have it.  SQUID AND CHORIZO: this was probably my least fave of the night, and also the least memorable for me. But if you're a fan of squid and squid ink, maybe you'll like this.  PORK SHOULDER w/ roasted carrots, olives, cous cous, mint, and ricotta salata. This one was also pretty forgettable for me. It was meaty and hearty, more of an entree dish. If you want some amazing pork dishes, go to Purple Pig to get it. At Avec, I'd suggest going with some of their other dishes. Pass on this one.  Overall one of the better dining destinations in Chicago! :) I would come back if I had the chance. Definitely recommend!!

Came here on a Friday night, got seated right away but the service was horrible. Our waitress was working all the tables in the restaurant and we had to ask for our drink orders to be taken. The food was over spiced and the middle of our pizza wasn't cooked well.  I would have hoped for a better experience but unfortunately it wasn't the best.  The wine menu is nice and the signature stuffed dates lived up to expectations

This place goes high up there on my "must have" list for Chicago. We got a bunch of random things from here, and ended up more stuffed than the medjool dates. We had to take some of the roasted pork shoulder back to the hotel. Had it for breakfast the next day and it was still crazy good. A few other standouts were the chorizo-stuffed dates, brandade, and house-marinated olives. We got the dates purely based on the unanimous Yelp reviews (didn't even question it) and once again, people were right! They should take these dates and feature them in the Contemporary section at the Art Institute of Chicago. Enough said. The pork shoulder was so tender and the portion was very generous. It was pure perfection. House-cured olives were amazing. Blew my mind. I didn't even realize how big of an olive fan I was (especially the bitter ones), until I had these ones. I should also mention two other things: 1) the ambiance was super laid back and casual, yet somehow classy at the same time. Pretty much everything is made of finished wood. 2) Their beer selection is superb, especially when it comes to local brews which you can only find in Chicago.

I've heard from several people now that this is a place I should check out for their dates.  We decided to come here for my birthday dinner.  The seating here is communal style so get comfortable with your neighbors.  We were seated next to a couple who ordered the paella and we decided to try that dish as well.  On the other side, we sat next to two ladies taking a Road trip from the East Coast.  We shared a pleasant conversation with them and share a few tips on their visit here in Chicago.   We ordered the Chorizo stuffed medjool dates and the Wood oven paella with confit chicken snail boudin mussels and tangerine aioli.  The chorizo date dish was good, but I felt like the flavor of the dates was overpowered by the chorizo and bacon.  The paella is not your typical seafood paella since it has confit chicken in it.  It was not my favorite.   We were seated promptly which was nice and service was friendly and direct. Overall, we were not really impressed.  Perhaps this type of food is just too fancy for me.

I came here last Sunday with a couple of out of town friends for brunch. We made sure to be one of the first ones there (got there at 10:15am) because we know how waits for brunch at these places in Chicago can be.  First off, this space is so poorly designed and cramped. Everyone gets seated at either communal tables or at the bar. Out party of four were seated at one of the communal tables. Throughout our meal we were constantly shuffling around or getting bumped into due to neighboring patrons that needed to use the bathroom, new patrons getting seated, baby strollers getting through the aisle, waiters moving around, etc. Hardly a relaxing way to dine.  Second of all, I'm pretty fed up with these trendy restaurants serving up "tapas" style meals meant to be shared. Our waiter had informed us of this, but it was clear by the way out table ordered that we wanted to order separately. What if someone just doesn't care to eat as much and would just like to have a small bite with the rest of the group? I would hope that my preference on sharing would be respected by my waiter. We had dishes ordered by separate people in our group to arrive at very different times, which obviously created very awkward moments of waiting for each other's dishes to arrive. Our waiter noticed us waiting for our dishes to arrive and again insisted on their establishment being "meant to be shared." I just don't get why they can't get over that we were ordering separately.  We waited and waited and waited. And the half order of paella came out as a full order. They reassured we'd only be charged for a half order. And we waited some more until we asked about our undelivered pizza for the third time. We asked to have the pizza canceled since by that time, I had been taking bites from my friends. They ended up packing up the pizza and comping it.  They food was pretty good, but it was the most unenjoyable meal I've had at this level of dining. I could never go back to avec or recommend it to anyone.

Ambience: A little cramped. A long bar and one row of bench tables in a narrow space. The bench seating also means you may have to climb over someone to get a seat. Somehow this place won a James Beard design award but I can't see it. Service: A little hit and miss. Some people got all their dishes at once, others got them one at a time and one never got theirs at all. You want to be clear in ordering how you want them to come out as it's tapas style. Food: Okay but nothing memorable. We went for brunch and it was probably a little heavy for that. In fact most dishes were pretty aggressively seasoned in general. We had the coddled eggs which was good, but unnecessarily had truffle oil added which destroyed the taste of the actual mushrooms in it. Worse was the focaccia which wasn't actually a focaccia (I was eating with a baker who was more than a little disappointed). This came with *loads* of truffle oil and garlic making it all but inedible.  Price: Pretty steep all things considered. Probably wouldn't go back unless it looked like the menu had changed to something a little more subtle.

Absolutely worth to wait and try! We took a vacation in Chicago and find this place for dinner. It's totally rocking! Love all dishes we ordered. Chicken liver, port shoulder, baked fish and lamb neck. Good environment and nice smiles everywhere.

Chorizo stuffed bacon wrapped dates - there's a reason these never leave the menu-- they are spectacular. A full order is 4, and each is pretty large, so one could consider a half order...but do yourself a favor and go for the whole kielbasa (or chorizo, as it were). The charred corn and tabouli salad, salmon, and paella dishes were all fantastic as well; there was not a single sub-par bite the whole night. The greatness of the food was only rivaled by the service and the atmosphere-- we sat at the bartop and our waiter and the rest of the staff were awesome, timely, helpful, unobtrusive, and fun. This was a great dinner, through and through.

We were super lucky to be seated at the bar without making a reservation. Even though this place was supposed to be a wine bar, they also had a very good beer selection. Our waiter recommended a Belgium beer, Atomium, to me. I loved it a lot. We also had chorizo stuffed medjool dates with smoked bacon and piquillo pepper tomato sauce, whipped brandade with garlic bread & chives, slow roasted pork shoulder with roasted carrots, oil cured olives, cous cous, mint and ricotta salata, house marinated olives, and a complementary dessert (lucky!!): roasted hazelnut dacquoise with dark chocolate ganache and coffee buttercream. Everything was so good. This place was very trendy and casual. I would like to try the truffle pizza next time.
Just so so. Date is my favorite dish. But I dont like inside tables, which we have to share with other people.

my favorite go to restaurant.  Been there a million times and the food is to die for.  I can't get enough.  Sometimes the wait stinks, but they are just so nice and the food is so amazing.   Love love love the truffle focaccia!! mmmmmm

Not that there aren't enough positive reviews about this place, but here goes.. Me: New York foodie visiting Chicago for the weekend I've had my fair share of fantastic food in New York and was not expecting to be wowed by anything other than the famous Chicago deep dish. But after taking my first bite of the roasted salmon (small dish), I knew Avec would be one of the highlights of my trip. All the dishes I had were unique, flavorful, and well priced: - Roasted wild salmon (HIGHLY recommended) - Chorizo stuffed dates (HIGHLY recommended, dip the bread in the sauce) - Braised lamb neck (the most tender lamb, again... HIGHHHHLY recommended) - Wood oven paella with confit chicken (pretty good but I wouldn't recommend) - Slow roasted pork shoulder (very good, but kinda salty, maybe recommend..) You could buy bottles of wine (many choices) starting at ~$40, or glasses for ~$10, which may be considered pricey(?) in Chicago, but given the quality of the food, I think it'd only be fair to compliment the meal with some good red wine :) Very good portions for the large plates. I was with 5 dudes and 1 girl. There was so much meat in the dishes even the guys had trouble cleaning up ;o The total came out to be around $33 each including tip, tax, wine. This is a STEAL for how much food we had and the quality of service we got. PLUS at the end, the server was able to divide up the check 7 ways for our convenience... how often does that happen!?!? Thank you Avec for such an AWESOME dining experience. There is almost always a 1+ hr wait but it's so worth it. Just walk across the bridge over the highway (uh sorry, I'm not from Chicago) and there's a bunch of bars where you can kill time.

I think Avec gets better and better every single time I come. I've been here for drinks, dinner twice, and brunch and out of the three I would say hands down brunch was the best. My favorite things at avec - the paella (just as good as the ones in Barcelona!) and the squid and chorizo. The brunch drinks are really tasty (the alcohol will sneak up on you but you can't taste it). Seating is a bit tight but makes for better hearing conversations right?

Had been wanting to come to Avec for a  while now and today we came in for Sunday Brunch. Definitely was not disappointed!  First, love the location. The interior is really nice and modern, though a tad bit cramped. It's basically a long, narrow room with a bar to the entire left side when you walk in and tables to the right. It's also pretty loud. However, when we arrived at 12, there was no wait and we were seated immediately! The service was great! Our waiter we very helpful when it came to suggesting what to order! Since it was just two of us, he suggested either 2 small plates person or 2 small and a half order of 1 large plate. Also, every server in the restaurant was very attentive and was quick to fill an empty water glass.  Anyway, for food here's what we got: Medjool Dates (stuffed with chorizo sausage, wrapped in bacon, and served with piquillo pepper-tomato sauce and fresh bread): THESE WERE AMAAAAZING! We should have gotten another order! The bacon was perfectly cooked and it made for a savory bite of absolute deliciousness. mmmm still thinking about these.... French Toast 1/2 order (topped with jam, cream, mint, and almonds and served with maple syrup): Fantastic! The bread was more dense like a pound cake but was very moist and amazingly tasty! When paired with the maple syrup.... oh yeah. Heavenly. Coddled Eggs (topped with garlic cream, bitter greens, mushrooms, and fonduta; served with garlic crostini): Sooo great! The eggs were perfect and had a creamy, rich texture to them.  My fav dish were the dates. Seriously-order these.  Overall, had an amazing experience here for brunch and can't wait to come for dinner!

Spent about $100 on a variety of menu items for a group of 4 and was seated in between two other parties. Distance between us and them was probably closer to 5 inches and would have been fine if the other people here didn't look so annoyed at us invading their private space. Good Dishes: Chorizo Medjool dates Slow roasted pork shoulders Squid and chorizo Pass Dishes: Summer squash Roasted wild salmon Butcher's steak Staff seemed pretty friendly and there wasn't really a wait on a Monday evening (6:30pm). Although with the food quality and pricing, I can't be too surprised.

Must try stuffed dates. Bartender from trump towers recommended this joint  and we were highly satisfied. The paella was fantastic and generous. Glad we took the adventure to get us there. Ambiance was also great.

One glimpse at the James Beard Foundation award on the wall and you know you are in for a memorable and delicious experience. Walking into Avec, you'll find a long room filled with modern wooden communal tables, ample bar space, and large open windows. It's stylish, welcoming, and contemporary. My friend and I came for their Sunday brunch and were fortunate to get seated promptly at the bar.  Seriously, EVERYTHING on the menu looks amazing. I saw a few tables ordering the breakfast pizza and oh man, if only I ate meat, I'd be all over that! My friend and I split a few dishes- coddled eggs with mushrooms and crostini, patatas bravas, and deluxe focaccia. Each came on a beautiful, thick wooden cutting board: 1.) Coddled Eggs- By far my favorite! The eggs are creamy, rich, and enhanced by the earthiness of the roasted mushrooms. Served on a crusty slice of bread, it was everything I wanted in a brunch dish 2.) Patatas Bravas- Incredibly crispy and accompanied by the best sauces (aioli and possible a romesco), they were spicy and delicious! 3.) Focaccia- Typically, I've seen focaccia baked about an inch thick. This was more akin to thin crust pizza between which was creamy ricotta and taleggio cheeses and the perfect hint of truffle oil. The top layer is cripsy from the oven and finished with a touch of sea salt. It was addicting.  Lastly, I finished my meal with a bourbon, cold brew cocktail. A little bit to relax and a little caffeine fix. What a wonderful way to spend a Sunday- in an Avec-induced food coma!

I feel bad ranking it two stars because everyone was extremely nice, but the food was why we came and it disappointed.  The flatbread thing with truffle oil tastes like slathering your tongue in truffle oil. This is not a good thing. Apparently it is their signature dish, but they may want to practice their handwriting. The steak we got was gristly. The veggies were almost an accidental velouté.  The cocktails (specifically a negroni blanco) were great, however, and the rosé txakoli they have was delicious.  The highlight of the meal was the peanut butter chocolate desserts. We got an extra order to go.  The most offputting thing though was the staff we talked to bad mouthing a nearby restaurant, The Girl and the Goat, that we ended up going to and having much better experience at.

I was really stuck in between 3 and 4 stars.. I came here with a party of 4 on a weekday evening around 5:45pm. We were seated pretty quickly, however, we were probably the last group to be able to be seated without having to wait. The place is quite cramped and the seating arrangements can be odd. Lots of sliding in and out of a long communal bench seat to let other people in. The service was also ridiculously slow. It seemed like their was only one waitress for the whole back of the restaurant. It took almost 15 minutes just get our drink orders in.  Yes, the chorizo stuffed medjool dates are good. Btw, I have no idea why they are soo huge? Did they combine multiple dates together to make one monstrous date or was it grown with crazy chemicals to make it golf ball-sized?? Anyhow, yes, do get those even if they may be radioactive. I didn't think much of the focaccia. I thought it was excessively oily and not as good as it's hyped up to be. The squid and chorizo was rich and fun to eat. The pork shoulder was heavy, as one would imagine, but still quite tasty. We also had the nutter butters dessert and some chocolate dessert. Both were not that exciting. I would skip that and go somewhere else for dessert.
The dates are simply the best dish in Chicago.   Everything else is terrific as well.   The ingredients are extremely fresh and the Mediterranean influences  are perfectly executed.

I had the brunch of dreams at Avec this weekend. If you're going to brunch here and don't want to wait a long time, I suggest going right at 10am... that's what we did, and while we were seated second, the place was completely packed within a few minutes. I can't blame the crowd, either -- this brunch is pretty dreamy. If you're hesitant about ordering a bloody mary, just do it. They're so good, and made with harissa (a Maghrebian hot chili pepper paste.) Pair it with a coffee and your beverage lineup is five stars alone. We started with the chorizo-stuffed medjool dates with bacon and piquillo pepper tomato sauce. I can't emphasize how wonderful and hearty this dish was... it's perfect for sharing. The dates are huge, the sauce robust, and the flavors exploding. I could have went home happy then, but I would have missed the delux focaccia, complete with taleggio cheese, ricotta, truffle oil, and fresh herbs. We could have ordered more (and trust me when I say I wanted to), but this was the perfect brunch as it was. I can't wait to go back on my next trip to Chicago!  But seriously... get a bloody mary.
First yelp review and well deserved! By far the best restaurant I have ever been to AND in Chicago!! The food, ambience, and music is impeccable! Definitely a must go!!

I have been coming here for forever! The food is fantastic and you just never know who you're going to run into. I've heard a rumor that they keep their pork in the oven at a low heat ALL night long, which is why it falls off the bone. God, this place is unbelievable. Please try it. Also the waiters are incredible- they bring your food out in a way that is most pleasing to your palate.

We finally hit up Avec again after uneventful first visit figuring maybe we missed something.  Also those dates were really quite scrumptious. On the first visit we had a rubbery octopus dish with a mess of flavors and an extremely mediocre squid amatriciana.  There was also something else with pork.  But the only thing that saved the date were the dates. Second time, dates are still good, but not insanely omgoosh good and I am pretty sure I could make a decent facsimile with what is posted at NYT.  Then we had charred summer squash and shishito peppers.  For 12 dollars this was tiny and really underwhelming in the flavor department.  So many places are doing good vegetable dishes that Avec's attempt is a travesty. We tried a paella with chicken, sausage and mussels.  The chicken was moist and had a well seasoned skin, but everything else was bland, bland, bland.  Also where is the socarrat?  The crusty rice on the bottom is essential to a paella.  The mussels were pretty damn sad for the price too.  Lastly was the braised lamb neck.  Really tender meet with some marrow and nice accouterments of currants, carrots and herbs.  It and the dates were the only worthwhile things we ate. Anyways, we are done with Avec.  I believe prices went up at least 10% between visits and 50 a person without alcohol is steep for the mediocre offerings.

5 stars is an understatement to describe my experience at Avec.  My roommate and I had just come from an event and were in the neighborhood and figured we'd try out this place.  I didn't know exactly where it was located so we were just walking along Randolph and completely passed it (there isn't a sign on the building, just FYI).  We luckily found it and am so glad that we did. We came at around 8pm on a Wednesday night and  they let us sit at the bar and didn't have to wait at all.   We started off with the wine, which is a good portion that you can slowly pour into your glass as you drink it.  In terms of food we just split a few small plates, the chorizo stuffed dates are a must have.  That was truly a magical dish, they melt in your mouth.  It was a good portion size too for the quality and the price. After the dates we had the steak, and that was excellent.  Perfectly cooked, I however didn't like the blue cheese- it was a little strong but I'm not a huge blue cheese fan to begin with.  You don't even need anything on the steak, the flavor is so good.  I love how they time the dishes they bring out.  At some places they keep piling up the plates as they come out of the kitchen, but here they let you enjoy your dish and have you complete it before they bring the next one out.  I didn't feel rushed at all, and was truly able to enjoy the experience.   I really like the size of the restaurant, the place is tiny but very intimate.  Great date spot or group get-together.  Will definitely be back as my budget allows.  The experience to me was worth every penny.   I liked this place better than Girl & the goat, that's how good it is.  In terms of the quality of food, experience, and the people this is my favorite restaurant in Chicago.

This place has been in my to do list for the longest time, but the pictures of the space, comments about the wait and the fact that they didn't take reservations, kept me away from trying it. I was surprised to walk-in on a Thursday at 5pm, and got seated right away. The service is phenomenal, everyone is super friendly and accommodating (some of the dishes had 4 servings and they brought us extra for the whole party, at no extra charge). The food was delicious, especially the chorizo stuffed dates, and the portions were larger than expected; they had a great wine selection too. As far as the space, it's small, but they do a great job in managing it, it got crowded towards the end, but there was still space to walk, didn't feel suffocated. Definitely coming back!

My friend and I instantly start snack talking this place when we walked in. We wanted to catch up (ie, discuss socially inappropriate subject matter freely) so the community seating was an instant turn off. HOWEVER....the people we sat in between were really cool and didn't mind us literally brushing elbows with them. Also, and very strangely, we hardly noticed our neighbors' conversations. So hopefully they didn't overhear ours! The menu features only wine, but they do make a number of classic cocktails so feel free to ask your server (the Old Fashioned was delicious, though on the sweeter side for my tastes).
